5467 /* Compute the source terms of the manufactured solution.
5468 THIS IS A TEMPORARY IMPLEMENTATION. FOR AN ACTUAL TIME ACCURATE
5469 SIMULATION THE CORRECT TIME MUST BE GIVEN TO THIS FUNCTION. */
5470 su2double sourceMan[4];
5471 VerificationSolution->GetMMSSourceTerm(coor, 0.0, sourceMan);
5472
5473 /* Add the source terms to the flux divergence. Note that the source
5474 terms are multiplied with minus the integration weight in order
5475 to be consistent with the formulation of the residual. */
5476 divFluxInt[0] -= weightJac*sourceMan[0];
5477 divFluxInt[1] -= weightJac*sourceMan[1];
5478 divFluxInt[2] -= weightJac*sourceMan[2];
5479 divFluxInt[3] -= weightJac*sourceMan[3];
5480 }
5481 }
5482 }
5483 }
5484
5485 /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
5486 /*--- Compute the residual in the DOFs, which is the matrix product of ---*/
5487 /*--- basisFunctionsIntTrans and divFlux. ---*/
5488 /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
5489
5490 blasFunctions->gemm(nDOFs, NPad, nInt, basisFunctionsIntTrans, divFlux, res, config);
5491}
5492
5493void CFEM_DG_EulerSolver::ADER_DG_NonAliasedPredictorResidual_3D(CConfig *config,
5494 CVolumeElementFEM *elem,
5495 const su2double *sol,
5496 const unsigned short nSimul,
5497 const unsigned short NPad,
5498 su2double *res,
5499 su2double *work) {
5500
5501 /* Set the pointers for solAndGradInt and divFlux to work. The same array
5502 can be used for both help arrays. */
5503 su2double *solAndGradInt = work;
5504 su2double *divFlux = work;
5505
5506 /*--- Get the necessary information from the standard element. ---*/
5507 const unsigned short ind = elem->indStandardElement;
5508 const unsigned short nInt = standardElementsSol[ind].GetNIntegration();
5509 const unsigned short nDOFs = elem->nDOFsSol;
5510 const su2double *matBasisInt = standardElementsSol[ind].GetMatBasisFunctionsIntegration();
5511 const su2double *basisFunctionsIntTrans = standardElementsSol[ind].GetBasisFunctionsIntegrationTrans();
5512 const su2double *weights = standardElementsSol[ind].GetWeightsIntegration();
5513
5514 /* Check if a body force is present and set it accordingly. */
5515 su2double bodyForceX = 0.0, bodyForceY = 0.0, bodyForceZ = 0.0;
5516 if( config->GetBody_Force() ) {
5517 const su2double *body_force_vector = config->GetBody_Force_Vector();
5518 bodyForceX = body_force_vector[0];
5519 bodyForceY = body_force_vector[1];
5520 bodyForceZ = body_force_vector[2];
5521 }
5522
5523 /* Determine the offset between the solution variables and the r-derivatives,
5524 which is also the offset between the r- and s-derivatives and the offset
5525 between s- and t-derivatives. */
5526 const unsigned short offDeriv = NPad*nInt;
5527
5528 /* Store the number of metric points per integration point for readability. */
5529 const unsigned short nMetricPerPoint = 10; /* nDim*nDim + 1. */
5530
5531 /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
5532 /*--- Compute the solution and the derivatives w.r.t. the parametric ---*/
5533 /*--- coordinates in the integration points. The first argument in ---*/
5534 /*--- the call to blasFunctions->gemm is nInt*(nDim+1). ---*/
5535 /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
5536
5537 blasFunctions->gemm(nInt*4, NPad, nDOFs, matBasisInt, sol, solAndGradInt, config);
5538
5539 /*--- Loop over the number of entities that are treated simultaneously. */
5540 for(unsigned short simul=0; simul<nSimul; ++simul) {
5541
5542 /* Set the pointers to the location where the solution and the divergence
5543 of the 1st DOF of this entity is stored, such that this offset does not
5544 need to be taken into account anymore in the loop over the integration
5545 points below. */
5546 const su2double *solAndGradEntity = solAndGradInt + simul*nVar;
5547 su2double *divFluxEntity = divFlux + simul*nVar;
5548
5549 /*--- Loop over the integration points. ---*/
5550 for(unsigned short i=0; i<nInt; ++i) {
5551
5552 /* Easier storage of the location where the solution and gradient data
5553 of this integration point starts. */
5554 const su2double *sol = solAndGradEntity + NPad*i;
5555 const su2double *solDr = sol + offDeriv;
5556 const su2double *solDs = solDr + offDeriv;
5557 const su2double *solDt = solDs + offDeriv;
5558 su2double *divFluxInt = divFluxEntity + NPad*i;
5559
5560 /*--- Compute the velocities, pressure and total enthalpy
5561 in this integration point. ---*/
5562 const su2double rho = sol[0];
5563 const su2double ru = sol[1];
5564 const su2double rv = sol[2];
5565 const su2double rw = sol[3];
5566 const su2double rE = sol[4];
5567
5568 const su2double rhoInv = 1.0/rho;
5569 const su2double u = rhoInv*ru;
5570 const su2double v = rhoInv*rv;
5571 const su2double w = rhoInv*rw;
5572 const su2double kinEnergy = 0.5*(u*u + v*v + w*w);
5573 const su2double StaticEnergy = rhoInv*rE - kinEnergy;
5574
5575 FluidModel->SetTDState_rhoe(rho, StaticEnergy);
5576 const su2double Pressure = FluidModel->GetPressure();
5577 const su2double Htot = rhoInv*(rE + Pressure);
5578
5579 /* Set the pointer to the grid velocities in this integration point.
5580 THIS IS A TEMPORARY IMPLEMENTATION. WHEN AN ACTUAL MOTION IS SPECIFIED,
5581 THE DATA FOR THIS SPATIAL INTEGRATION POINT FOR THE CURRENT TIME
5582 INTEGRATION POINT MUST BE TAKEN. */
5583 const su2double *gridVel = elem->gridVelocities.data() + 3*i; /* nDim*i. */
5584
5585 /* Easier storage of the metric terms in this integration point.
5586 THIS IS A TEMPORARY IMPLEMENTATION. WHEN AN ACTUAL MOTION IS SPECIFIED,
5587 THE DATA FOR THIS SPATIAL INTEGRATION POINT FOR THE CURRENT TIME
5588 INTEGRATION POINT MUST BE TAKEN. */
5589 const su2double *metricTerms = elem->metricTerms.data() + i*nMetricPerPoint;
5590
5591 const su2double drdx = metricTerms[1];
5592 const su2double drdy = metricTerms[2];
5593 const su2double drdz = metricTerms[3];
5594
5595 const su2double dsdx = metricTerms[4];
5596 const su2double dsdy = metricTerms[5];
5597 const su2double dsdz = metricTerms[6];
5598
5599 const su2double dtdx = metricTerms[7];
5600 const su2double dtdy = metricTerms[8];
5601 const su2double dtdz = metricTerms[9];
5602
5603 /* Compute the Cartesian gradients of the independent solution
5604 variables from the gradients in parametric coordinates and the
5605 metric terms in this integration point. Note that these gradients
5606 must be scaled with the Jacobian. This scaling is already present
5607 in the metric terms. */
5608 const su2double drhodx = solDr[0]*drdx + solDs[0]*dsdx + solDt[0]*dtdx;
5609 const su2double drudx = solDr[1]*drdx + solDs[1]*dsdx + solDt[1]*dtdx;
5610 const su2double drvdx = solDr[2]*drdx + solDs[2]*dsdx + solDt[2]*dtdx;
5611 const su2double drwdx = solDr[3]*drdx + solDs[3]*dsdx + solDt[3]*dtdx;
5612 const su2double drEdx = solDr[4]*drdx + solDs[4]*dsdx + solDt[4]*dtdx;
5613
5614 const su2double drhody = solDr[0]*drdy + solDs[0]*dsdy + solDs[0]*dtdy;
5615 const su2double drudy = solDr[1]*drdy + solDs[1]*dsdy + solDs[1]*dtdy;
5616 const su2double drvdy = solDr[2]*drdy + solDs[2]*dsdy + solDs[2]*dtdy;
5617 const su2double drwdy = solDr[3]*drdy + solDs[3]*dsdy + solDs[3]*dtdy;
5618 const su2double drEdy = solDr[4]*drdy + solDs[4]*dsdy + solDs[4]*dtdy;
5619
5620 const su2double drhodz = solDr[0]*drdz + solDs[0]*dsdz + solDs[0]*dtdz;
5621 const su2double drudz = solDr[1]*drdz + solDs[1]*dsdz + solDs[1]*dtdz;
5622 const su2double drvdz = solDr[2]*drdz + solDs[2]*dsdz + solDs[2]*dtdz;
5623 const su2double drwdz = solDr[3]*drdz + solDs[3]*dsdz + solDs[3]*dtdz;
5624 const su2double drEdz = solDr[4]*drdz + solDs[4]*dsdz + solDs[4]*dtdz;
5625
5626 /*--- Compute the divergence of the grid velocity.
5627 SET TO ZERO FOR NOW. THIS IS NOT CORRECT!!!!. ---*/
5628 const su2double divGridVel = 0.0; // Must be multiplied by the Jacobian.
5629
5630 /* Compute the Cartesian gradients of the pressure, scaled with
5631 the Jacobian. */
5632 const su2double dpdx = Gamma_Minus_One*(drEdx + kinEnergy*drhodx
5633 - u*drudx - v*drvdx - w*drwdx);
5634 const su2double dpdy = Gamma_Minus_One*(drEdy + kinEnergy*drhody
5635 - u*drudy - v*drvdy - w*drwdy);
5636 const su2double dpdz = Gamma_Minus_One*(drEdz + kinEnergy*drhodz
5637 - u*drudz - v*drvdz - w*drwdz);
5638
5639 /* Abbreviations, which make it easier to compute the divergence term. */
5640 const su2double abv1 = drudx + drvdy + drwdz;
5641 const su2double abv2 = u* drhodx + v*drhody + w*drhodz;
5642 const su2double abv3 = u*(drEdx + dpdx) + v*(drEdy + dpdy) + w*(drEdz + dpdz);
5643
5644 /* Compute the divergence terms for this integration point,
5645 multiplied by the integration weight. */
5646 divFluxInt[0] = weights[i]*(abv1 - rho*divGridVel
5647 - gridVel[0]*drhodx - gridVel[1]*drhody - gridVel[2]*drhodz);
5648 divFluxInt[1] = weights[i]*(dpdx + u*(abv1 - abv2 + drudx) + v*drudy + w*drudz
5649 - ru*divGridVel - gridVel[0]*drudx - gridVel[1]*drudy - gridVel[2]*drudz);
5650 divFluxInt[2] = weights[i]*(dpdy + v*(abv1 - abv2 + drvdy) + u*drvdx + w*drvdz
5651 - rv*divGridVel - gridVel[0]*drvdx - gridVel[1]*drvdy - gridVel[2]*drvdz);
5652 divFluxInt[3] = weights[i]*(dpdz + w*(abv1 - abv2 + drwdz) + u*drwdx + v*drwdy
5653 - rw*divGridVel - gridVel[0]*drwdx - gridVel[1]*drwdy - gridVel[2]*drwdz);
5654 divFluxInt[4] = weights[i]*(abv3 + Htot*(abv1 - abv2) - rE*divGridVel
5655 - gridVel[0]*drEdx - gridVel[1]*drEdy - gridVel[2]*drEdz);
5656
5657 /* Add the body force to the flux divergence for the momentum and energy
5658 equation. Note that the source terms are multiplied with minus the
5659 integration weight in order to be consistent with the formulation of
5660 the residual. Also note that for the energy source term the absolute
5661 velocity must be taken and not the relative. */
5662 const su2double weightJac = weights[i]*metricTerms[0];
5663
5664 divFluxInt[1] -= weightJac*bodyForceX;
5665 divFluxInt[2] -= weightJac*bodyForceY;
5666 divFluxInt[3] -= weightJac*bodyForceZ;
5667 divFluxInt[4] -= weightJac*(u*bodyForceX + v*bodyForceY + w*bodyForceZ);
5668 }
5669 }
5670
5671 /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
5672 /*--- Add the source terms of the manufactured solution to the divergence---*/
5673 /*--- of the fluxes, if a manufactured solution is used. ---*/
5674 /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
5675
5676 if( VerificationSolution ) {
5677 if( VerificationSolution->IsManufacturedSolution() ) {
5678
5679 /*--- Loop over the number of entities that are treated simultaneously. */
5680 for(unsigned short simul=0; simul<nSimul; ++simul) {
5681
5682 /*--- Loop over the integration points of the element. ---*/
5683 for(unsigned short i=0; i<nInt; ++i) {
5684
5685 /* Set the pointers for this integration point. */
5686 const unsigned short offInt = i*NPad + simul*nVar;
5687 su2double *divFluxInt = divFlux + offInt;
5688
5689 /* Set the pointer to the coordinates in this integration point.
5690 THIS IS A TEMPORARY IMPLEMENTATION. WHEN AN ACTUAL MOTION IS SPECIFIED,
5691 THE DATA FOR THIS DOF FOR THE CURRENT TIME INTEGRATION POINT MUST
5692 BE TAKEN. */
5693 const su2double *coor = elem->coorIntegrationPoints.data() + i*nDim;
5694
5695 /* Easier storage of the metric terms in this integration point.
5696 THIS IS A TEMPORARY IMPLEMENTATION. WHEN AN ACTUAL MOTION IS SPECIFIED,
5697 THE DATA FOR THIS DOF FOR THE CURRENT TIME INTEGRATION POINT MUST
5698 BE TAKEN. */
5699 const su2double *metricTerms = elem->metricTerms.data() + i*nMetricPerPoint;
5700 const su2double weightJac = weights[i]*metricTerms[0];
5701
5702 /* Compute the source terms of the manufactured solution.
5703 THIS IS A TEMPORARY IMPLEMENTATION. FOR AN ACTUAL TIME ACCURATE
5704 SIMULATION THE CORRECT TIME MUST BE GIVEN TO THIS FUNCTION. */
5705 su2double sourceMan[5];
5706 VerificationSolution->GetMMSSourceTerm(coor, 0.0, sourceMan);
5707
5708 /* Add the source terms to the flux divergence. Note that the source
5709 terms are multiplied with minus the integration weight in order
5710 to be consistent with the formulation of the residual. */
5711 divFluxInt[0] -= weightJac*sourceMan[0];
5712 divFluxInt[1] -= weightJac*sourceMan[1];
5713 divFluxInt[2] -= weightJac*sourceMan[2];
5714 divFluxInt[3] -= weightJac*sourceMan[3];
5715 divFluxInt[4] -= weightJac*sourceMan[4];
5716 }
5717 }
5718 }
5719 }
5720
5721 /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
5722 /*--- Compute the residual in the DOFs, which is the matrix product of ---*/
5723 /*--- basisFunctionsIntTrans and divFlux. ---*/
5724 /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
5725
5726 blasFunctions->gemm(nDOFs, NPad, nInt, basisFunctionsIntTrans, divFlux, res, config);
5727}
5728
5729void CFEM_DG_EulerSolver::ADER_DG_TimeInterpolatePredictorSol(CConfig *config,
5730 const unsigned short iTime,
5731 const unsigned long elemBeg,
5732 const unsigned long elemEnd,
5733 const unsigned long nAdjElem,
5734 const unsigned long *adjElem,
5735 const bool secondPartTimeInt,
5736 su2double *solTimeLevel) {
5737
5738 /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
5739 /*--- Step 1: Interpolate the solution to the given integration point ---*/
5740 /*--- for the element range elemBeg to elemEnd. These elements ---*/
5741 /*--- belong to the time level considered (not needed to know ---*/
5742 /*--- the actual value in this function) and are therefore ---*/
5743 /*--- continuous in memory. ---*/
5744 /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
5745
5746 /* Easier storage of the interpolation coefficients for the current time
5747 integration point (iTime) for the elements of this time interval. */
5748 const unsigned short nTimeDOFs = config->GetnTimeDOFsADER_DG();
5749 const su2double *DOFToThisTimeInt = timeInterpolDOFToIntegrationADER_DG
5750 + iTime*nTimeDOFs;
5751
5752 /* Loop over the element range of this time level. */
5753 for(unsigned long l=elemBeg; l<elemEnd; ++l) {
5754
5755 /* Determine the number of solution variables for this element and
5756 set the pointer where the solution variables for this element must be
5757 stored in solTimeLevel. */
5758 const unsigned short nSolVar = nVar*volElem[l].nDOFsSol;
5759 su2double *solDOFs = solTimeLevel + nVar*volElem[l].offsetDOFsSolThisTimeLevel;
5760
5761 /* Initialize the solution to zero. */
5762 for(unsigned short i=0; i<nSolVar; ++i) solDOFs[i] = 0.0;
5763
5764 /* Loop over the time DOFs, for which the predictor solution is present. */
5765 for(unsigned short j=0; j<nTimeDOFs; ++j) {
5766
5767 /* Add the contribution of this predictor solution to the interpolated solution. */
5768 const su2double *solPred = VecSolDOFsPredictorADER.data()
5769 + nVar*(j*nDOFsLocTot + volElem[l].offsetDOFsSolLocal);
5770 for(unsigned short i=0; i<nSolVar; ++i)
5771 solDOFs[i] += DOFToThisTimeInt[j]*solPred[i];
5772 }
5773 }
5774
5775 /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
5776 /*--- Step 2: Interpolate the solution to the given integration point ---*/
5777 /*--- for the elements of the next time level, which are ---*/
5778 /*--- adjacent to elements of the current time level. Note that ---*/
5779 /*--- these elements are not contiguous in memory. ---*/
5780 /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
5781
5782 /* For the faces with adjacent elements of a higher time level, the time
5783 integration takes place with twice the number of time integration points
5784 from the perspective of the higher time level. Hence the integration points
5785 iTime must be corrected if the state to be interpolated corresponds to the
5786 second part of the time integration interval. Perform this correction and
5787 determine the corresponding interpolation coefficients. */
5788 unsigned short iiTime = iTime;
5789 if( secondPartTimeInt ) iiTime += config->GetnTimeIntegrationADER_DG();
5790
5791 DOFToThisTimeInt = timeInterpolAdjDOFToIntegrationADER_DG + iiTime*nTimeDOFs;
5792
5793 /* Loop over the adjacent elements. */
5794 for(unsigned long l=0; l<nAdjElem; ++l) {
5795 const unsigned long ll = adjElem[l];
5796
5797 /* Determine the number of solution variables for this element and
5798 set the pointer where the solution variables for this element must be
5799 stored in solTimeLevel. */
5800 const unsigned short nSolVar = nVar*volElem[ll].nDOFsSol;
5801 su2double *solDOFs = solTimeLevel + nVar*volElem[ll].offsetDOFsSolPrevTimeLevel;
5802
5803 /* Initialize the solution to zero. */
5804 for(unsigned short i=0; i<nSolVar; ++i) solDOFs[i] = 0.0;
5805
5806 /* Loop over the time DOFs, for which the predictor solution is present. */
5807 for(unsigned short j=0; j<nTimeDOFs; ++j) {
5808
5809 /* Add the contribution of this predictor solution to the interpolated solution. */
5810 const su2double *solPred = VecSolDOFsPredictorADER.data()
5811 + nVar*(j*nDOFsLocTot + volElem[ll].offsetDOFsSolLocal);
5812 for(unsigned short i=0; i<nSolVar; ++i)
5813 solDOFs[i] += DOFToThisTimeInt[j]*solPred[i];
5814 }
5815 }
5816}
5817
5818void CFEM_DG_EulerSolver::Shock_Capturing_DG(CConfig *config,
5819 const unsigned long elemBeg,
5820 const unsigned long elemEnd,
5821 su2double *workArray) {
5822
5823 /*--- Run shock capturing algorithm ---*/
5824 switch( config->GetKind_FEM_DG_Shock() ) {
5825 case FEM_SHOCK_CAPTURING_DG::NONE:
5826 break;
5827 case FEM_SHOCK_CAPTURING_DG::PERSSON:
5828 // to be done
5829 //Shock_Capturing_DG_Persson(elemBeg, elemEnd, workArray);
5830 break;
5831 }
5832}
5833
5834void CFEM_DG_EulerSolver::Volume_Residual(CConfig *config,
5835 const unsigned long elemBeg,
5836 const unsigned long elemEnd,
5837 su2double *workArray) {
5838
5839 /*--- Determine whether a body force term is present. ---*/
5840 bool body_force = config->GetBody_Force();
5841 const su2double *body_force_vector = body_force ? config->GetBody_Force_Vector() : nullptr;
5842
5843 /*--- Get the physical time for MMS if necessary. ---*/
5844 su2double time = 0.0;
5845 if (config->GetTime_Marching() != TIME_MARCHING::STEADY) time = config->GetPhysicalTime();
5846
5847 /* Determine the number of elements that are treated simultaneously
5848 in the matrix products to obtain good gemm performance. */
5849 const unsigned short nPadInput = config->GetSizeMatMulPadding();
5850 const unsigned short nElemSimul = nPadInput/nVar;
5851
5852 /* Determine the minimum padded size in the matrix multiplications, which
5853 corresponds to 64 byte alignment. */
5854 const unsigned short nPadMin = 64/sizeof(passivedouble);
5855
5856 /* Store the number of metric points per integration point, which depends
5857 on the number of dimensions. */
5858 const unsigned short nMetricPerPoint = nDim*nDim + 1;
5859
5860 /*--- Loop over the given element range to compute the contribution of the
5861 volume integral in the DG FEM formulation to the residual. Multiple
5862 elements are treated simultaneously to improve the performance
5863 of the matrix multiplications. As a consequence, the update of the
5864 counter l happens at the end of this loop section. ---*/
5865 for(unsigned long l=elemBeg; l<elemEnd;) {
5866
5867 /* Determine the end index for this chunk of elements and the padded
5868 N value in the gemm computations. */
5869 unsigned long lEnd;
5870 unsigned short ind, llEnd, NPad;
5871
5872 MetaDataChunkOfElem(volElem, l, elemEnd, nElemSimul, nPadMin, lEnd, ind, llEnd, NPad);
5873
5874 /* Get the required data from the corresponding standard element. */
5875 const unsigned short nInt = standardElementsSol[ind].GetNIntegration();
5876 const unsigned short nDOFs = volElem[l].nDOFsSol;
5877 const su2double *matBasisInt = standardElementsSol[ind].GetMatBasisFunctionsIntegration();
5878 const su2double *matBasisIntTrans = standardElementsSol[ind].GetBasisFunctionsIntegrationTrans();
5879 const su2double *matDerBasisIntTrans = standardElementsSol[ind].GetDerMatBasisFunctionsIntTrans();
5880 const su2double *weights = standardElementsSol[ind].GetWeightsIntegration();
5881
5882 /*--- Set the pointers for the local arrays. ---*/
5883 su2double *solDOFs = workArray;
5884 su2double *sources = solDOFs + nDOFs*NPad;
5885 su2double *solInt = sources + nInt *NPad;
5886 su2double *fluxes = solInt + nInt *NPad;
5887
5888 /*------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
5889 /*--- Step 1: Interpolate the solution to the integration points of ---*/
5890 /*--- the element. ---*/
5891 /*------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
5892
5893 /* Copy the solution of the DOFs into solDOFs for this chunk of elements. */
5894 for(unsigned short ll=0; ll<llEnd; ++ll) {
5895
5896 /* Easier storage of the solution variables for this element. */
5897 const unsigned long lInd = l + ll;
5898 const unsigned short timeLevel = volElem[lInd].timeLevel;
5899 const su2double *solDOFsElem = VecWorkSolDOFs[timeLevel].data()
5900 + nVar*volElem[lInd].offsetDOFsSolThisTimeLevel;
5901
5902 /* Loop over the DOFs and copy the data. */
5903 const unsigned short llNVar = ll*nVar;
5904 for(unsigned short i=0; i<nDOFs; ++i)
5905 for(unsigned short mm=0; mm<nVar; ++mm)
5906 solDOFs[i*NPad+llNVar+mm] = solDOFsElem[i*nVar+mm];
5907 }
5908
5909 /* Call the general function to carry out the matrix product to determine
5910 the solution in the integration points of the chunk of elements. */
5911 blasFunctions->gemm(nInt, NPad, nDOFs, matBasisInt, solDOFs, solInt, config);
5912
5913 /*------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
5914 /*--- Step 2: Compute the inviscid fluxes, multiplied by minus the ---*/
5915 /*--- integration weight, in the integration points. ---*/
5916 /*--- If needed, also the source terms are computed. ---*/
5917 /*------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
5918
5919 /* Make a distinction between two and three space dimensions
5920 in order to have the most efficient code. */
5921 switch( nDim ) {
5922
5923 case 2: {
5924
5925 /* 2D simulation. Loop over the chunk of elements and loop over the
5926 integration points of the elements to compute the fluxes. */
5927 for(unsigned short ll=0; ll<llEnd; ++ll) {
5928 const unsigned short llNVar = ll*nVar;
5929 const unsigned long lInd = l + ll;
5930
5931 for(unsigned short i=0; i<nInt; ++i) {
5932 const unsigned short iNPad = i*NPad;
5933
5934 /* Easier storage of the metric terms and grid velocities
5935 in this integration point. */
5936 const su2double *metricTerms = volElem[lInd].metricTerms.data()
5937 + i*nMetricPerPoint;
5938 const su2double Jac = metricTerms[0];
5939 const su2double *gridVel = volElem[lInd].gridVelocities.data() + i*nDim;
5940
5941 /* Compute the metric terms multiplied by minus the integration weight.
5942 The minus sign comes from the integration by parts in the weak
5943 formulation. */
5944 const su2double wDrdx = -weights[i]*metricTerms[1];
5945 const su2double wDrdy = -weights[i]*metricTerms[2];
5946
5947 const su2double wDsdx = -weights[i]*metricTerms[3];
5948 const su2double wDsdy = -weights[i]*metricTerms[4];
5949
5950 /* Easier storage of the location where the solution data of this
5951 integration point starts. */
5952 const su2double *sol = solInt + iNPad + llNVar;
5953
5954 /*--- Compute the velocities and static energy in this integration point. ---*/
5955 const su2double rhoInv = 1.0/sol[0];
5956 const su2double u = sol[1]*rhoInv;
5957 const su2double v = sol[2]*rhoInv;
5958 const su2double TotalEnergy = sol[3]*rhoInv;
5959 const su2double StaticEnergy = TotalEnergy - 0.5*(u*u + v*v);
5960
5961 /*--- Compute the pressure. ---*/
5962 FluidModel->SetTDState_rhoe(sol[0], StaticEnergy);
5963 const su2double Pressure = FluidModel->GetPressure();
5964
5965 /* Compute the relative velocities w.r.t. the grid. */
5966 const su2double uRel = u - gridVel[0];
5967 const su2double vRel = v - gridVel[1];
5968
5969 /* Set the pointer for the fluxes in this integration point. */
5970 su2double *flux = fluxes + nDim*iNPad + llNVar;
5971
5972 /*--- Fluxes in r-direction. */
5973 const su2double Ur = uRel*wDrdx + vRel*wDrdy;
5974
5975 flux[0] = sol[0]*Ur;
5976 flux[1] = sol[1]*Ur + Pressure*wDrdx;
5977 flux[2] = sol[2]*Ur + Pressure*wDrdy;
5978 flux[3] = sol[3]*Ur + Pressure*(u*wDrdx + v*wDrdy);
5979
5980 /*--- Fluxes in s-direction. */
5981 flux = flux + NPad;
5982 const su2double Us = uRel*wDsdx + vRel*wDsdy;
5983
5984 flux[0] = sol[0]*Us;
5985 flux[1] = sol[1]*Us + Pressure*wDsdx;
5986 flux[2] = sol[2]*Us + Pressure*wDsdy;
5987 flux[3] = sol[3]*Us + Pressure*(u*wDsdx + v*wDsdy);
5988
5989 /*--- If needed, compute the body forces in this integration point.
5990 Note that the source terms are multiplied with minus the
5991 integration weight in order to be consistent with the
5992 formulation of the residual. Note that for the energy source
5993 term the absolute velocity must be taken and not the
5994 relative. ---*/
5995 if( body_force ) {
5996 su2double *source = sources + iNPad + llNVar;
5997 const su2double weightJac = weights[i]*Jac;
5998
5999 source[0] = 0.0;
6000 source[1] = -weightJac*body_force_vector[0];
6001 source[2] = -weightJac*body_force_vector[1];
6002 source[3] = -weightJac*(u*body_force_vector[0] + v*body_force_vector[1]);
6003 }
6004 }
6005 }
6006
6007 break;
6008 }
6009
6010 /*----------------------------------------------------------------------*/
6011
6012 case 3: {
6013
6014 /* 3D simulation. Loop over the chunk of elements and loop over the
6015 integration points of the elements to compute the fluxes. */
6016 for(unsigned short ll=0; ll<llEnd; ++ll) {
6017 const unsigned short llNVar = ll*nVar;
6018 const unsigned long lInd = l + ll;
6019 for(unsigned short i=0; i<nInt; ++i) {
6020 const unsigned short iNPad = i*NPad;
6021
6022 /* Easier storage of the metric terms and grid velocities
6023 in this integration point. */
6024 const su2double *metricTerms = volElem[lInd].metricTerms.data()
6025 + i*nMetricPerPoint;
6026 const su2double Jac = metricTerms[0];
6027 const su2double *gridVel = volElem[lInd].gridVelocities.data() + i*nDim;
6028
6029 /* Compute the metric terms multiplied by minus the integration weight.
6030 The minus sign comes from the integration by parts in the weak
6031 formulation. */
6032 const su2double wDrdx = -weights[i]*metricTerms[1];
6033 const su2double wDrdy = -weights[i]*metricTerms[2];
6034 const su2double wDrdz = -weights[i]*metricTerms[3];
6035
6036 const su2double wDsdx = -weights[i]*metricTerms[4];
6037 const su2double wDsdy = -weights[i]*metricTerms[5];
6038 const su2double wDsdz = -weights[i]*metricTerms[6];
6039
6040 const su2double wDtdx = -weights[i]*metricTerms[7];
6041 const su2double wDtdy = -weights[i]*metricTerms[8];
6042 const su2double wDtdz = -weights[i]*metricTerms[9];
6043
6044 /* Easier storage of the location where the solution data of this
6045 integration point starts. */
6046 const su2double *sol = solInt + iNPad + llNVar;
6047
6048 /*--- Compute the velocities and static energy in this integration point. ---*/
6049 const su2double rhoInv = 1.0/sol[0];
6050 const su2double u = sol[1]*rhoInv;
6051 const su2double v = sol[2]*rhoInv;
6052 const su2double w = sol[3]*rhoInv;
6053 const su2double TotalEnergy = sol[4]*rhoInv;
6054 const su2double StaticEnergy = TotalEnergy - 0.5*(u*u + v*v + w*w);
6055
6056 /*--- Compute the pressure. ---*/
6057 FluidModel->SetTDState_rhoe(sol[0], StaticEnergy);
6058 const su2double Pressure = FluidModel->GetPressure();
6059
6060 /* Compute the relative velocities w.r.t. the grid. */
6061 const su2double uRel = u - gridVel[0];
6062 const su2double vRel = v - gridVel[1];
6063 const su2double wRel = w - gridVel[2];
6064
6065 /* Set the pointer for the fluxes in this integration point. */
6066 su2double *flux = fluxes + nDim*iNPad + llNVar;
6067
6068 /*--- Fluxes in r-direction. */
6069 const su2double Ur = uRel*wDrdx + vRel*wDrdy + wRel*wDrdz;
6070
6071 flux[0] = sol[0]*Ur;
6072 flux[1] = sol[1]*Ur + Pressure*wDrdx;
6073 flux[2] = sol[2]*Ur + Pressure*wDrdy;
6074 flux[3] = sol[3]*Ur + Pressure*wDrdz;
6075 flux[4] = sol[4]*Ur + Pressure*(u*wDrdx + v*wDrdy + w*wDrdz);
6076
6077 /*--- Fluxes in s-direction. */
6078 flux = flux + NPad;
6079 const su2double Us = uRel*wDsdx + vRel*wDsdy + wRel*wDsdz;
6080
6081 flux[0] = sol[0]*Us;
6082 flux[1] = sol[1]*Us + Pressure*wDsdx;
6083 flux[2] = sol[2]*Us + Pressure*wDsdy;
6084 flux[3] = sol[3]*Us + Pressure*wDsdz;
6085 flux[4] = sol[4]*Us + Pressure*(u*wDsdx + v*wDsdy + w*wDsdz);
6086
6087 /*--- Fluxes in t-direction. */
6088 flux = flux + NPad;
6089 const su2double Ut = uRel*wDtdx + vRel*wDtdy + wRel*wDtdz;
6090
6091 flux[0] = sol[0]*Ut;
6092 flux[1] = sol[1]*Ut + Pressure*wDtdx;
6093 flux[2] = sol[2]*Ut + Pressure*wDtdy;
6094 flux[3] = sol[3]*Ut + Pressure*wDtdz;
6095 flux[4] = sol[4]*Ut + Pressure*(u*wDtdx + v*wDtdy + w*wDtdz);
6096
6097 /*--- If needed, compute the body forces in this integration point.
6098 Note that the source terms are multiplied with minus the
6099 integration weight in order to be consistent with the
6100 formulation of the residual. Note that for the energy source
6101 term the absolute velocity must be taken and not the
6102 relative. ---*/
6103 if( body_force ) {
6104 su2double *source = sources + iNPad + llNVar;
6105 const su2double weightJac = weights[i]*Jac;
6106
6107 source[0] = 0.0;
6108 source[1] = -weightJac*body_force_vector[0];
6109 source[2] = -weightJac*body_force_vector[1];
6110 source[3] = -weightJac*body_force_vector[2];
6111 source[4] = -weightJac*(u*body_force_vector[0] + v*body_force_vector[1]
6112 + w*body_force_vector[2]);
6113 }
6114 }
6115 }
6116
6117 break;
6118 }
6119 }
6120
6121 /* Initialize addSourceTerms to body_force. The value of addSourceTerms
6122 is set to true when a manufactured solution is computed. */
6123 bool addSourceTerms = body_force;
6124
6125 /* Check whether or not a manufactured solution is used. */
6126 if( VerificationSolution ) {
6127 if( VerificationSolution->IsManufacturedSolution() ) {
6128
6129 /*--- For the manufactured solutions a source term must be added. If a
6130 standard source term has not been specified, initialize the source
6131 terms to zero and set addSourceTerms to true. ---*/
6132 addSourceTerms = true;
6133 if( !body_force ) {
6134 for(unsigned short i=0; i<(nInt*NPad); ++i)
6135 sources[i] = 0.0;
6136 }
6137
6138 /*--- Loop over the chunk of elements and its integration points. ---*/
6139 for(unsigned short ll=0; ll<llEnd; ++ll) {
6140 const unsigned short llNVar = ll*nVar;
6141 const unsigned long lInd = l + ll;
6142 for(unsigned short i=0; i<nInt; ++i) {
6143 const unsigned short iNPad = i*NPad;
6144
6145 /* Determine the integration weight multiplied by the Jacobian. */
6146 const su2double *metricTerms = volElem[lInd].metricTerms.data()
6147 + i*nMetricPerPoint;
6148 const su2double weightJac = weights[i]*metricTerms[0];
6149
6150 /* Set the pointer to the coordinates in this integration point and
6151 call the function to compute the source terms for the manufactured
6152 solution. */
6153 const su2double *coor = volElem[lInd].coorIntegrationPoints.data() + i*nDim;
6154
6155 su2double sourceMan[5];
6156
6157 VerificationSolution->GetMMSSourceTerm(coor, time, sourceMan);
6158
6159 /*--- Subtract the source term of the manufactured solution, multiplied
6160 by the appropriate weight, from the possibly earlier computed
6161 source term. It is subtracted in order to be consistent with
6162 the definition of the residual used in this code. ---*/
6163 su2double *source = sources + iNPad + llNVar;
6164 for(unsigned short k=0; k<nVar; ++k)
6165 source[k] -= weightJac*sourceMan[k];
6166 }
6167 }
6168 }
6169 }
6170
6171 /*------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
6172 /*--- Step 3: Compute the contribution to the residuals from the ---*/
6173 /*--- integration over the volume element. ---*/
6174 /*------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
6175
6176 /* Call the general function to carry out the matrix product.
6177 Use solDOFs as a temporary storage for the matrix product. */
6178 blasFunctions->gemm(nDOFs, NPad, nInt*nDim, matDerBasisIntTrans, fluxes, solDOFs, config);
6179
6180 /* Add the contribution from the source terms, if needed. Use solInt
6181 as temporary storage for the matrix product. */
6182 if( addSourceTerms ) {
6183
6184 /* Call the general function to carry out the matrix product. */
6185 blasFunctions->gemm(nDOFs, NPad, nInt, matBasisIntTrans, sources, solInt, config);
6186
6187 /* Add the residuals due to source terms to the volume residuals */
6188 for(unsigned short i=0; i<(nDOFs*NPad); ++i)
6189 solDOFs[i] += solInt[i];
6190 }
6191
6192 /* Loop over the elements in this chunk to store the residuals
6193 in the appropriate locations. */
6194 for(unsigned short ll=0; ll<llEnd; ++ll) {
6195 const unsigned short llNVar = ll*nVar;
6196 const unsigned long lInd = l + ll;
6197
6198 /* Easier storage of the residuals for this volume element. */
6199 su2double *res = VecResDOFs.data() + nVar*volElem[lInd].offsetDOFsSolLocal;
6200
6201 /* Loop over the DOFs and copy the data. */
6202 for(unsigned short i=0; i<nDOFs; ++i)
6203 for(unsigned short mm=0; mm<nVar; ++mm)
6204 res[i*nVar+mm] = solDOFs[i*NPad+llNVar+mm];
6205 }
6206
6207 /* Update the value of the counter l to the end index of the
6208 current chunk. */
6209 l = lEnd;
6210 }
6211}
6212
6213void CFEM_DG_EulerSolver::Boundary_Conditions(const unsigned short timeLevel,
6214 CConfig *config,
6215 CNumerics **numerics,
6216 const bool haloInfoNeededForBC,
6217 su2double *workArray){
6218
6219 /* Loop over all boundaries. */
6220 for (unsigned short iMarker = 0; iMarker < config->GetnMarker_All(); iMarker++) {
6221
6222 /* Check if this boundary marker must be treated at all. */
6223 if(boundaries[iMarker].haloInfoNeededForBC == haloInfoNeededForBC) {
6224
6225 /* Determine the range of faces for this time level and test if any
6226 surface element for this marker must be treated at all. */
6227 const unsigned long surfElemBeg = boundaries[iMarker].nSurfElem[timeLevel];
6228 const unsigned long surfElemEnd = boundaries[iMarker].nSurfElem[timeLevel+1];
6229
6230 if(surfElemEnd > surfElemBeg) {
6231
6232 /* Set the starting position in the vector for the face residuals for
6233 this boundary marker and time level and set the pointer to the boundary
6234 faces for this boundary marker. */
6235 su2double *resFaces = VecResFaces.data()
6236 + nVar*startLocResFacesMarkers[iMarker][timeLevel];
6237
6238 const CSurfaceElementFEM *surfElem = boundaries[iMarker].surfElem.data();
6239
6240 /* Apply the appropriate boundary condition. */
6241 switch (config->GetMarker_All_KindBC(iMarker)) {
6242 case EULER_WALL:
6243 BC_Euler_Wall(config, surfElemBeg, surfElemEnd, surfElem, resFaces,
6244 numerics[CONV_BOUND_TERM], workArray);
6245 break;
6246 case FAR_FIELD:
6247 BC_Far_Field(config, surfElemBeg, surfElemEnd, surfElem, resFaces,
6248 numerics[CONV_BOUND_TERM], workArray);
6249 break;
6250 case SYMMETRY_PLANE:
6251 BC_Sym_Plane(config, surfElemBeg, surfElemEnd, surfElem, resFaces,
6252 numerics[CONV_BOUND_TERM], workArray);
6253 break;
6254 case SUPERSONIC_INLET: /* Use far field for this. When a more detailed state
6255 needs to be specified, use a Riemann boundary. */
6256 BC_Far_Field(config, surfElemBeg, surfElemEnd, surfElem, resFaces,
6257 numerics[CONV_BOUND_TERM], workArray);
6258 break;
6259 case SUPERSONIC_OUTLET:
6260 BC_Supersonic_Outlet(config, surfElemBeg, surfElemEnd, surfElem, resFaces,
6261 numerics[CONV_BOUND_TERM], workArray);
6262 break;
6263 case INLET_FLOW:
6264 BC_Inlet(config, surfElemBeg, surfElemEnd, surfElem, resFaces,
6265 numerics[CONV_BOUND_TERM], iMarker, workArray);
6266 break;
6267 case OUTLET_FLOW:
6268 BC_Outlet(config, surfElemBeg, surfElemEnd, surfElem, resFaces,
6269 numerics[CONV_BOUND_TERM], iMarker, workArray);
6270 break;
6271 case ISOTHERMAL:
6272 BC_Isothermal_Wall(config, surfElemBeg, surfElemEnd, surfElem, resFaces,
6273 numerics[CONV_BOUND_TERM], iMarker, workArray);
6274 break;
6275 case HEAT_FLUX:
6276 BC_HeatFlux_Wall(config, surfElemBeg, surfElemEnd, surfElem, resFaces,
6277 numerics[CONV_BOUND_TERM], iMarker, workArray);
6278 break;
6279 case RIEMANN_BOUNDARY:
6280 BC_Riemann(config, surfElemBeg, surfElemEnd, surfElem, resFaces,
6281 numerics[CONV_BOUND_TERM], iMarker, workArray);
6282 break;
6283 case CUSTOM_BOUNDARY:
6284 BC_Custom(config, surfElemBeg, surfElemEnd, surfElem, resFaces,
6285 numerics[CONV_BOUND_TERM], workArray);
6286 break;
6287 case PERIODIC_BOUNDARY: // Nothing to be done for a periodic boundary.
6288 break;
6289 default:
6290 SU2_MPI::Error("BC not implemented.", CURRENT_FUNCTION);
6291 }
6292 }
6293 }
6294 }
6295}
6296
6297void CFEM_DG_EulerSolver::ResidualFaces(CConfig *config,
6298 const unsigned long indFaceBeg,
6299 const unsigned long indFaceEnd,
6300 unsigned long &indResFaces,
6301 CNumerics *numerics,
6302 su2double *workArray) {
6303
6304 /* Determine the number of faces that are treated simultaneously
6305 in the matrix products to obtain good gemm performance. */
6306 const unsigned short nPadInput = config->GetSizeMatMulPadding();
6307 const unsigned short nFaceSimul = nPadInput/nVar;
6308
6309 /* Determine the minimum padded size in the matrix multiplications, which
6310 corresponds to 64 byte alignment. */
6311 const unsigned short nPadMin = 64/sizeof(passivedouble);
6312
6313 /*--- Loop over the requested range of matching faces. Multiple faces
6314 are treated simultaneously to improve the performance of the matrix
6315 multiplications. As a consequence, the update of the counter l
6316 happens at the end of this loop section. ---*/
6317 for(unsigned long l=indFaceBeg; l<indFaceEnd;) {
6318
6319 /* Determine the end index for this chunk of faces and the padded
6320 N value in the gemm computations. */
6321 unsigned long lEnd;
6322 unsigned short ind, llEnd, NPad;
6323
6324 MetaDataChunkOfElem(matchingInternalFaces, l, indFaceEnd, nFaceSimul,
6325 nPadMin, lEnd, ind, llEnd, NPad);
6326
6327 /* Get the necessary data from the standard face. */
6328 const unsigned short nInt = standardMatchingFacesSol[ind].GetNIntegration();
6329 const su2double *weights = standardMatchingFacesSol[ind].GetWeightsIntegration();
6330
6331 const unsigned short nDOFsFace0 = standardMatchingFacesSol[ind].GetNDOFsFaceSide0();
6332 const unsigned short nDOFsFace1 = standardMatchingFacesSol[ind].GetNDOFsFaceSide1();
6333
6334 /*--- Set the pointers for the local arrays. ---*/
6335 su2double *solIntL = workArray;
6336 su2double *solIntR = solIntL + NPad*max(nInt, nDOFsFace0);
6337 su2double *fluxes = solIntR + NPad*max(nInt, nDOFsFace1);
6338
6339 /*------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
6340 /*--- Step 1: Compute the inviscid fluxes in the integration points of ---*/
6341 /*--- this matching face multiplied by the integration weight. ---*/
6342 /*------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
6343
6344 /* Compute the inviscid fluxes in the integration points. */
6345 InviscidFluxesInternalMatchingFace(config, l, lEnd, NPad,
6346 solIntL, solIntR, fluxes, numerics);
6347
6348 /* Multiply the fluxes with the integration weight of the corresponding
6349 integration point. */
6350 for(unsigned short i=0; i<nInt; ++i) {
6351 su2double *flux = fluxes + i*NPad;
6352
6353 for(unsigned short j=0; j<NPad; ++j)
6354 flux[j] *= weights[i];
6355 }
6356
6357 /*------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
6358 /*--- Step 2: Compute the contribution to the residuals from the ---*/
6359 /*--- integration over this chunk of internal matching faces. ---*/
6360 /*------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
6361
6362 /* Get the correct form of the basis functions needed for the matrix
6363 multiplication to compute the residual. Use solIntL as a temporary
6364 buffer to store this product. */
6365 const su2double *basisFaceTrans = standardMatchingFacesSol[ind].GetBasisFaceIntegrationTransposeSide0();
6366 su2double *resSide0 = solIntL;
6367
6368 /* Call the general function to carry out the matrix product. */
6369 blasFunctions->gemm(nDOFsFace0, NPad, nInt, basisFaceTrans, fluxes, resSide0, config);
6370
6371 /* Check if the number of DOFs on both sides of the face is different.
6372 In that case also the matrix product with the basis functions on side 1
6373 must be carried out. Use solIntR as a temporary buffer to store
6374 this product. */
6375 su2double *resSide1 = solIntR;
6376 if(nDOFsFace1 != nDOFsFace0) {
6377 basisFaceTrans = standardMatchingFacesSol[ind].GetBasisFaceIntegrationTransposeSide1();
6378 blasFunctions->gemm(nDOFsFace1, NPad, nInt, basisFaceTrans, fluxes, resSide1, config);
6379 }
6380
6381 /* Loop over the number of faces in this chunk. */
6382 for(unsigned short ll=0; ll<llEnd; ++ll) {
6383
6384 /* Set the pointer in the residual array where the residual of side 0
6385 and side 1 of this face must be stored. Update the counter. */
6386 su2double *resFace0 = VecResFaces.data() + indResFaces*nVar;
6387 indResFaces += nDOFsFace0;
6388 su2double *resFace1 = VecResFaces.data() + indResFaces*nVar;
6389 indResFaces += nDOFsFace1;
6390
6391 /* Loop over the DOFs and copy the data for side 0. */
6392 for(unsigned short i=0; i<nDOFsFace0; ++i)
6393 for(unsigned short mm=0; mm<nVar; ++mm)
6394 resFace0[nVar*i+mm] = resSide0[NPad*i+nVar*ll+mm];
6395
6396 /* If the number of DOFs on both sides is the same, then the residual
6397 of side 1 is obtained by simply negating the residual of side 0.
6398 Otherwise a copy must be carried out and the residual negated,
6399 because the normal is pointing into the adjacent element for side 1. */
6400 if(nDOFsFace1 == nDOFsFace0) {
6401 for(unsigned short i=0; i<(nVar*nDOFsFace1); ++i)
6402 resFace1[i] = -resFace0[i];
6403 }
6404 else {
6405 for(unsigned short i=0; i<nDOFsFace1; ++i)
6406 for(unsigned short mm=0; mm<nVar; ++mm)
6407 resFace1[nVar*i+mm] = -resSide1[NPad*i+nVar*ll+mm];
6408 }
6409 }
6410
6411 /* Update the value of the counter l to the end index of the
6412 current chunk. */
6413 l = lEnd;
6414 }
6415}
6416
6417void CFEM_DG_EulerSolver::InviscidFluxesInternalMatchingFace(
6418 CConfig *config,
6419 const unsigned long lBeg,
6420 const unsigned long lEnd,
6421 const unsigned short NPad,
6422 su2double *solIntL,
6423 su2double *solIntR,
6424 su2double *fluxes,
6425 CNumerics *numerics) {
6426
6427 /* Set the pointer solFace to fluxes. This is just for readability, as the
6428 same memory can be used for the storage of the solution of the DOFs of
6429 the face and the fluxes. */
6430 su2double *solFace = fluxes;
6431
6432 /*------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
6433 /*--- Step 1: Interpolate the left state in the integration points of ---*/
6434 /*--- the face. ---*/
6435 /*------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
6436
6437 /* Get the required information from the corresponding standard face,
6438 which is the same for the chunk of faces considered. */
6439 const unsigned short ind = matchingInternalFaces[lBeg].indStandardElement;
6440 const unsigned short nInt = standardMatchingFacesSol[ind].GetNIntegration();
6441 const unsigned short nDOFsFace0 = standardMatchingFacesSol[ind].GetNDOFsFaceSide0();
6442 const su2double *basisFace0 = standardMatchingFacesSol[ind].GetBasisFaceIntegrationSide0();
6443
6444 /* Determine the number of faces treated simultaneously and define the arrays
6445 of pointers to be used later on in the call to ComputeInviscidFluxesFace. */
6446 const unsigned short llEnd = lEnd - lBeg;
6447 const su2double* arrNorm[SIZE_ARR_NORM];
6448 const su2double* arrGridVel[SIZE_ARR_NORM];
6449
6450 if(llEnd > SIZE_ARR_NORM)
6451 SU2_MPI::Error("SIZE_ARR_NORM is too small. Increase it or decrease ALIGNED_BYTES_MATMUL",
6452 CURRENT_FUNCTION);
6453
6454 /*--- Loop over the chunk of faces to copy the states in the DOFs
6455 of the faces in the correct sequence. ---*/
6456 for(unsigned long l=lBeg; l<lEnd; ++l) {
6457 const unsigned short ll = l-lBeg;
6458 const unsigned short llNVar = ll*nVar;
6459
6460 /* Store the pointer to the normal and grid velocity information of this
6461 face. This is used later on in the call to ComputeInviscidFluxesFace. */
6462 arrNorm[ll] = matchingInternalFaces[l].metricNormalsFace.data();
6463 arrGridVel[ll] = matchingInternalFaces[l].gridVelocities.data();
6464
6465 /* Determine the time level of the face. */
6466 const unsigned long elem0 = matchingInternalFaces[l].elemID0;
6467 const unsigned long elem1 = matchingInternalFaces[l].elemID1;
6468 const unsigned short timeLevelFace = min(volElem[elem0].timeLevel,
6469 volElem[elem1].timeLevel);
6470
6471 /* The numbering of the DOFs is given for the entire grid. However, in the
6472 working vectors for the solution a numbering per time level is used.
6473 Therefore an offset must be applied, which can be obtained from the
6474 corresponding volume element. Note that this offset is non-negative
6475 and depends whether or not the element belongs to the same time
6476 level as the face. */
6477 unsigned long offset;
6478 if(timeLevelFace == volElem[elem0].timeLevel)
6479 offset = volElem[elem0].offsetDOFsSolLocal - volElem[elem0].offsetDOFsSolThisTimeLevel;
6480 else
6481 offset = volElem[elem0].offsetDOFsSolLocal - volElem[elem0].offsetDOFsSolPrevTimeLevel;
6482
6483 /*--- Store the solution of the DOFs of side 0 of the face in contiguous
6484 memory, such that the function blasFunctions->gemm can be used to
6485 compute the left states in the integration points. ---*/
6486 const unsigned long *DOFs = matchingInternalFaces[l].DOFsSolFaceSide0.data();
6487 for(unsigned short i=0; i<nDOFsFace0; ++i) {
6488 const su2double *solDOF = VecWorkSolDOFs[timeLevelFace].data()
6489 + nVar*(DOFs[i] - offset);
6490 su2double *sol = solFace + NPad*i + llNVar;
6491 for(unsigned short mm=0; mm<nVar; ++mm)
6492 sol[mm] = solDOF[mm];
6493 }
6494 }
6495
6496 /* Compute the left states. Call the general function to
6497 carry out the matrix product. */
6498 blasFunctions->gemm(nInt, NPad, nDOFsFace0, basisFace0, solFace, solIntL, config);
6499
6500 /*------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
6501 /*--- Step 2: Interpolate the right state in the integration points of ---*/
6502 /*--- the face. ---*/
6503 /*------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
6504
6505 /* Get the required information from the corresponding standard face,
6506 which is the same for the chunk of faces considered. */
6507 const unsigned short nDOFsFace1 = standardMatchingFacesSol[ind].GetNDOFsFaceSide1();
6508 const su2double *basisFace1 = standardMatchingFacesSol[ind].GetBasisFaceIntegrationSide1();
6509
6510 /*--- Loop over the chunk of elements to copy the states in the DOFs
6511 of the faces in the correct sequence. ---*/
6512 for(unsigned long l=lBeg; l<lEnd; ++l) {
6513 const unsigned short ll = l-lBeg;
6514 const unsigned short llNVar = ll*nVar;
6515
6516 /* Determine the time level of the face. */
6517 const unsigned long elem0 = matchingInternalFaces[l].elemID0;
6518 const unsigned long elem1 = matchingInternalFaces[l].elemID1;
6519 const unsigned short timeLevelFace = min(volElem[elem0].timeLevel,
6520 volElem[elem1].timeLevel);
6521
6522 /* Determine the offset between the numbering used in the DOFs of the face
6523 and the numbering used in the working solution vectors, see above for a
6524 more detailed explanation. */
6525 unsigned long offset;
6526 if(timeLevelFace == volElem[elem1].timeLevel)
6527 offset = volElem[elem1].offsetDOFsSolLocal - volElem[elem1].offsetDOFsSolThisTimeLevel;
6528 else
6529 offset = volElem[elem1].offsetDOFsSolLocal - volElem[elem1].offsetDOFsSolPrevTimeLevel;
6530
6531 /*--- Store the solution of the DOFs of side 1 of the face in contiguous
6532 memory, such that the function blasFunctions->gemm can be used to
6533 compute the left states in the integration points. ---*/
6534 const unsigned long *DOFs = matchingInternalFaces[l].DOFsSolFaceSide1.data();
6535 for(unsigned short i=0; i<nDOFsFace1; ++i) {
6536 const su2double *solDOF = VecWorkSolDOFs[timeLevelFace].data()
6537 + nVar*(DOFs[i] - offset);
6538 su2double *sol = solFace + NPad*i + llNVar;
6539 for(unsigned short mm=0; mm<nVar; ++mm)
6540 sol[mm] = solDOF[mm];
6541 }
6542 }
6543
6544 /* Compute the right states. Call the general function to
6545 carry out the matrix product. */
6546 blasFunctions->gemm(nInt, NPad, nDOFsFace1, basisFace1, solFace, solIntR, config);
6547
6548 /*------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
6549 /*--- Step 3: Compute the fluxes in the integration points using the ---*/
6550 /*--- approximate Riemann solver. ---*/
6551 /*------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
6552
6553 /* General function to compute the fluxes in the integration points
6554 of the faces. */
6555 ComputeInviscidFluxesFace(config, llEnd, NPad, nInt, arrNorm, arrGridVel,
6556 solIntL, solIntR, fluxes, numerics);
6557}
6558
6559void CFEM_DG_EulerSolver::AccumulateSpaceTimeResidualADEROwnedElem(
6560 CConfig *config,
6561 const unsigned short timeLevel,
6562 const unsigned short intPoint) {
6563
6564 /* Compute half the integration weight. The reason for doing this is that the
6565 given integration weight is based on the normalized interval [-1..1], i.e.
6566 a length of two. Also compute a quarter of the weight, which is necessary
6567 to accumulate the face residuals of the DOFs of elements adjacent to
6568 element of a lower time level. */
6569 const su2double *timeIntegrationWeights = config->GetWeightsIntegrationADER_DG();
6570
6571 const su2double halfWeight = 0.5 *timeIntegrationWeights[intPoint];
6572 const su2double quartWeight = 0.25*timeIntegrationWeights[intPoint];
6573
6574 /* Determine the owned element range that must be considered. */
6575 const unsigned long elemBegOwned = nVolElemOwnedPerTimeLevel[timeLevel];
6576 const unsigned long elemEndOwned = nVolElemOwnedPerTimeLevel[timeLevel+1];
6577
6578 /* Add the residuals coming from the volume integral to VecTotResDOFsADER. */
6579 for(unsigned long l=elemBegOwned; l<elemEndOwned; ++l) {
6580 const unsigned long offset = nVar*volElem[l].offsetDOFsSolLocal;
6581 const su2double *res = VecResDOFs.data() + offset;
6582 su2double *resADER = VecTotResDOFsADER.data() + offset;
6583
6584 for(unsigned short i=0; i<(nVar*volElem[l].nDOFsSol); ++i)
6585 resADER[i] += halfWeight*res[i];
6586 }
6587
6588 /* Add the residuals coming from the surface integral to VecTotResDOFsADER.
6589 This part is from faces with the same time level as the element. */
6590 for(unsigned long l=elemBegOwned; l<elemEndOwned; ++l) {
6591 for(unsigned short i=0; i<volElem[l].nDOFsSol; ++i) {
6592 const unsigned long ii = volElem[l].offsetDOFsSolLocal + i;
6593 su2double *resADER = VecTotResDOFsADER.data() + nVar*ii;
6594
6595 for(unsigned long j=nEntriesResFaces[ii]; j<nEntriesResFaces[ii+1]; ++j) {
6596 const su2double *resFace = VecResFaces.data() + nVar*entriesResFaces[j];
6597 for(unsigned short k=0; k<nVar; ++k)
6598 resADER[k] += halfWeight*resFace[k];
6599 }
6600 }
6601 }
6602
6603 /* Check if this is not the last time level. */
6604 const unsigned short nTimeLevels = config->GetnLevels_TimeAccurateLTS();
6605 if(timeLevel < (nTimeLevels-1)) {
6606
6607 /* There may exist faces of this time level, which have a neighboring
6608 element of the next time level. The residuals of the DOFs of such
6609 elements must be updated with the face residuals of the current
6610 time level. However, on these elements the time step is twice as
6611 large. This is taken into account by multiplying the face residual
6612 with quartWeight when accumulating. */
6613 const unsigned long nAdjElem = ownedElemAdjLowTimeLevel[timeLevel+1].size();
6614 const unsigned long *adjElem = ownedElemAdjLowTimeLevel[timeLevel+1].data();
6615
6616 for(unsigned l=0; l<nAdjElem; ++l) {
6617 const unsigned long ll = adjElem[l];
6618 for(unsigned short i=0; i<volElem[ll].nDOFsSol; ++i) {
6619 const unsigned long ii = volElem[ll].offsetDOFsSolLocal + i;
6620 su2double *resADER = VecTotResDOFsADER.data() + nVar*ii;
6621
6622 for(unsigned long j=nEntriesResAdjFaces[ii]; j<nEntriesResAdjFaces[ii+1]; ++j) {
6623 const su2double *resFace = VecResFaces.data() + nVar*entriesResAdjFaces[j];
6624 for(unsigned short k=0; k<nVar; ++k)
6625 resADER[k] += quartWeight*resFace[k];
6626 }
6627 }
6628 }
6629 }
6630}
6631
6632void CFEM_DG_EulerSolver::AccumulateSpaceTimeResidualADERHaloElem(
6633 CConfig *config,
6634 const unsigned short timeLevel,
6635 const unsigned short intPoint) {
6636
6637 /* Compute half the integration weight. The reason for doing this is that the
6638 given integration weight is based on the normalized interval [-1..1], i.e.
6639 a length of two. Also compute a quarter of the weight, which is necessary
6640 to accumulate the face residuals of the DOFs of elements adjacent to
6641 element of a lower time level. */
6642 const su2double *timeIntegrationWeights = config->GetWeightsIntegrationADER_DG();
6643
6644 const su2double halfWeight = 0.5 *timeIntegrationWeights[intPoint];
6645 const su2double quartWeight = 0.25*timeIntegrationWeights[intPoint];
6646
6647 /* Determine the halo element range that must be considered. */
6648 const unsigned long elemBegHalo = nVolElemHaloPerTimeLevel[timeLevel];
6649 const unsigned long elemEndHalo = nVolElemHaloPerTimeLevel[timeLevel+1];
6650
6651 /* Add the residuals coming from the surface integral to VecTotResDOFsADER.
6652 This part is from faces with the same time level as the element. */
6653 for(unsigned long l=elemBegHalo; l<elemEndHalo; ++l) {
6654 for(unsigned short i=0; i<volElem[l].nDOFsSol; ++i) {
6655 const unsigned long ii = volElem[l].offsetDOFsSolLocal + i;
6656 su2double *resADER = VecTotResDOFsADER.data() + nVar*ii;
6657
6658 for(unsigned long j=nEntriesResFaces[ii]; j<nEntriesResFaces[ii+1]; ++j) {
6659 const su2double *resFace = VecResFaces.data() + nVar*entriesResFaces[j];
6660 for(unsigned short k=0; k<nVar; ++k)
6661 resADER[k] += halfWeight*resFace[k];
6662 }
6663 }
6664 }
6665
6666 /* Check if this is not the last time level. */
6667 const unsigned short nTimeLevels = config->GetnLevels_TimeAccurateLTS();
6668 if(timeLevel < (nTimeLevels-1)) {
6669
6670 /* There may exist faces of this time level, which have a neighboring
6671 element of the next time level. The residuals of the DOFs of such
6672 elements must be updated with the face residuals of the current
6673 time level. However, on these elements the time step is twice as
6674 large. This is taken into account by multiplying the face residual
6675 with quartWeight when accumulating. */
6676 const unsigned long nAdjElem = haloElemAdjLowTimeLevel[timeLevel+1].size();
6677 const unsigned long *adjElem = haloElemAdjLowTimeLevel[timeLevel+1].data();
6678
6679 for(unsigned l=0; l<nAdjElem; ++l) {
6680 const unsigned long ll = adjElem[l];
6681 for(unsigned short i=0; i<volElem[ll].nDOFsSol; ++i) {
6682 const unsigned long ii = volElem[ll].offsetDOFsSolLocal + i;
6683 su2double *resADER = VecTotResDOFsADER.data() + nVar*ii;
6684
6685 for(unsigned long j=nEntriesResAdjFaces[ii]; j<nEntriesResAdjFaces[ii+1]; ++j) {
6686 const su2double *resFace = VecResFaces.data() + nVar*entriesResAdjFaces[j];
6687 for(unsigned short k=0; k<nVar; ++k)
6688 resADER[k] += quartWeight*resFace[k];
6689 }
6690 }
6691 }
6692 }
6693}
6694
6695void CFEM_DG_EulerSolver::CreateFinalResidual(const unsigned short timeLevel,
6696 const bool ownedElements) {
6697
6698 /* Determine the element range for which the final residual must
6699 be created. */
6700 unsigned long elemStart, elemEnd;
6701 if( ownedElements ) {
6702 elemStart = nVolElemOwnedPerTimeLevel[0];
6703 elemEnd = nVolElemOwnedPerTimeLevel[timeLevel+1];
6704 }
6705 else {
6706 elemStart = nVolElemHaloPerTimeLevel[0];
6707 elemEnd = nVolElemHaloPerTimeLevel[timeLevel+1];
6708 }
6709
6710 /* For the halo elements the residual is initialized to zero. */
6711 if( !ownedElements ) {
6712
6713 for(unsigned long l=elemStart; l<elemEnd; ++l) {
6714 su2double *resDOFsElem = VecResDOFs.data() + nVar*volElem[l].offsetDOFsSolLocal;
6715 for(unsigned short i=0; i<(nVar*volElem[l].nDOFsSol); ++i)
6716 resDOFsElem[i] = 0.0;
6717 }
6718 }
6719
6720 /* Loop over the required element range. */
6721 for(unsigned long l=elemStart; l<elemEnd; ++l) {
6722
6723 /* Loop over the DOFs of this element. */
6724 for(unsigned long i=volElem[l].offsetDOFsSolLocal;
6725 i<(volElem[l].offsetDOFsSolLocal+volElem[l].nDOFsSol); ++i) {
6726
6727 /* Create the final residual by summing up all contributions. */
6728 su2double *resDOF = VecResDOFs.data() + nVar*i;
6729 for(unsigned long j=nEntriesResFaces[i]; j<nEntriesResFaces[i+1]; ++j) {
6730 const su2double *resFace = VecResFaces.data() + nVar*entriesResFaces[j];
6731 for(unsigned short k=0; k<nVar; ++k)
6732 resDOF[k] += resFace[k];
6733 }
6734 }
6735 }
6736}
6737
6738void CFEM_DG_EulerSolver::MultiplyResidualByInverseMassMatrix(
6739 CConfig *config,
6740 const bool useADER,
6741 const unsigned long elemBeg,
6742 const unsigned long elemEnd,
6743 su2double *workArray) {
6744
6745 /*--- Set the reference to the correct residual. This depends
6746 whether or not the ADER scheme is used. ---*/
6747 vector<su2double> &VecRes = useADER ? VecTotResDOFsADER : VecResDOFs;
6748
6749 /* Loop over the owned volume elements. */
6750 for(unsigned long l=elemBeg; l<elemEnd; ++l) {
6751
6752 /* Easier storage of the residuals for this volume element. */
6753 su2double *res = VecRes.data() + nVar*volElem[l].offsetDOFsSolLocal;
6754
6755 /* Check whether a multiplication must be carried out with the inverse of
6756 the lumped mass matrix or the full mass matrix. Note that it is crucial
6757 that the test is performed with the lumpedMassMatrix and not with
6758 massMatrix. The reason is that for implicit time stepping schemes
6759 both arrays may be in use. */
6760 if( !volElem[l].lumpedMassMatrix.empty() ) {
6761
6762 /* Multiply the residual with the inverse of the lumped mass matrix. */
6763 for(unsigned short i=0; i<volElem[l].nDOFsSol; ++i) {
6764
6765 su2double *resDOF = res + nVar*i;
6766 su2double lMInv = 1.0/volElem[l].lumpedMassMatrix[i];
6767 for(unsigned short k=0; k<nVar; ++k) resDOF[k] *= lMInv;
6768 }
6769 }
6770 else {
6771
6772 /* Multiply the residual with the inverse of the mass matrix.
6773 Use the array workArray as temporary storage. */
6774 for(unsigned short mm=0; mm<nVar*volElem[l].nDOFsSol; ++mm)
6775 workArray[mm] = res[mm];
6776
6777 blasFunctions->gemm(volElem[l].nDOFsSol, nVar, volElem[l].nDOFsSol,
6778 volElem[l].invMassMatrix.data(), workArray, res, config);
6779 }
6780 }
6781}
6782
6783void CFEM_DG_EulerSolver::Pressure_Forces(const CGeometry* geometry, const CConfig* config) {
6784
6785 /* Allocate the memory for the work array and initialize it to zero to avoid
6786 warnings in debug mode about uninitialized memory when padding is applied. */
6787 vector<su2double> workArrayVec(sizeWorkArray, 0.0);
6788 su2double *workArray = workArrayVec.data();
6789
6790 /* Determine the number of faces that are treated simultaneously
6791 in the matrix products to obtain good gemm performance. */
6792 const unsigned short nPadInput = config->GetSizeMatMulPadding();
6793 const unsigned short nFaceSimul = nPadInput/nVar;
6794
6795 /* Determine the minimum padded size in the matrix multiplications, which
6796 corresponds to 64 byte alignment. */
6797 const unsigned short nPadMin = 64/sizeof(passivedouble);
6798
6799 /*--- Get the information of the angle of attack, reference area, etc. ---*/
6800 const su2double Alpha = config->GetAoA()*PI_NUMBER/180.0;
6801 const su2double Beta = config->GetAoS()*PI_NUMBER/180.0;
6802 const su2double RefArea = config->GetRefArea();
6803 const su2double RefLength = config->GetRefLength();
6804 const su2double Gas_Constant = config->GetGas_ConstantND();
6805 auto Origin = config->GetRefOriginMoment(0);
6806 const bool grid_movement = config->GetGrid_Movement();
6807
6808 /*--- Evaluate reference values for non-dimensionalization.
6809 For dynamic meshes, use the motion Mach number as a reference value
6810 for computing the force coefficients. Otherwise, use the freestream
6811 values, which is the standard convention. ---*/
6812 const su2double RefTemp = Temperature_Inf;
6813 const su2double RefDensity = Density_Inf;
6814
6815 su2double RefVel2;
6816 if (grid_movement) {
6817 const su2double Mach2Vel = sqrt(Gamma*Gas_Constant*RefTemp);
6818 const su2double Mach_Motion = config->GetMach_Motion();
6819 RefVel2 = (Mach_Motion*Mach2Vel)*(Mach_Motion*Mach2Vel);
6820 }
6821 else {
6822 RefVel2 = 0.0;
6823 for(unsigned short iDim=0; iDim<nDim; ++iDim)
6824 RefVel2 += Velocity_Inf[iDim]*Velocity_Inf[iDim];
6825 }
6826
6827 AeroCoeffForceRef = 0.5 * RefDensity * RefArea * RefVel2;
6828 const su2double factor = 1.0 / AeroCoeffForceRef;
6829
6830 /*-- Variables initialization ---*/
6831 Total_CD = 0.0; Total_CL = 0.0; Total_CSF = 0.0; Total_CEff = 0.0;
6832 Total_CMx = 0.0; Total_CMy = 0.0; Total_CMz = 0.0;
6833 Total_CFx = 0.0; Total_CFy = 0.0; Total_CFz = 0.0;
6834
6835 AllBound_CD_Inv = 0.0; AllBound_CL_Inv = 0.0; AllBound_CSF_Inv = 0.0;
6836 AllBound_CMx_Inv = 0.0; AllBound_CMy_Inv = 0.0; AllBound_CMz_Inv = 0.0;
6837 AllBound_CFx_Inv = 0.0; AllBound_CFy_Inv = 0.0; AllBound_CFz_Inv = 0.0;
6838 AllBound_CEff_Inv = 0.0;
6839
6840 for(unsigned short iMarker_Monitoring=0; iMarker_Monitoring<config->GetnMarker_Monitoring(); ++iMarker_Monitoring) {
6841 Surface_CL_Inv[iMarker_Monitoring] = 0.0; Surface_CD_Inv[iMarker_Monitoring] = 0.0;
6842 Surface_CSF_Inv[iMarker_Monitoring] = 0.0; Surface_CEff_Inv[iMarker_Monitoring] = 0.0;
6843 Surface_CFx_Inv[iMarker_Monitoring] = 0.0; Surface_CFy_Inv[iMarker_Monitoring] = 0.0;
6844 Surface_CFz_Inv[iMarker_Monitoring] = 0.0; Surface_CMx_Inv[iMarker_Monitoring] = 0.0;
6845 Surface_CMy_Inv[iMarker_Monitoring] = 0.0; Surface_CMz_Inv[iMarker_Monitoring] = 0.0;
6846 Surface_CL[iMarker_Monitoring] = 0.0; Surface_CD[iMarker_Monitoring] = 0.0;
6847 Surface_CSF[iMarker_Monitoring] = 0.0; Surface_CEff[iMarker_Monitoring] = 0.0;
6848 Surface_CFx[iMarker_Monitoring] = 0.0; Surface_CFy[iMarker_Monitoring] = 0.0;
6849 Surface_CFz[iMarker_Monitoring] = 0.0; Surface_CMx[iMarker_Monitoring] = 0.0;
6850 Surface_CMy[iMarker_Monitoring] = 0.0; Surface_CMz[iMarker_Monitoring] = 0.0;
6851 }
6852
6853 /*--- Loop over the Euler and Navier-Stokes markers ---*/
6854 for(unsigned short iMarker=0; iMarker<nMarker; ++iMarker) {
6855
6856 /* Check if this boundary must be monitored. */
6857 const unsigned short Monitoring = config->GetMarker_All_Monitoring(iMarker);
6858 if(Monitoring == YES) {
6859
6860 /* Easier storage of the boundary condition. */
6861 const unsigned short Boundary = config->GetMarker_All_KindBC(iMarker);
6862
6863 /*--- Obtain the origin for the moment computation for a particular marker ---*/
6864 for(unsigned short iMarker_Monitoring=0; iMarker_Monitoring<config->GetnMarker_Monitoring();
6865 ++iMarker_Monitoring) {
6866 string Monitoring_Tag = config->GetMarker_Monitoring_TagBound(iMarker_Monitoring);
6867 string Marker_Tag = config->GetMarker_All_TagBound(iMarker);
6868 if (Marker_Tag == Monitoring_Tag)
6869 Origin = config->GetRefOriginMoment(iMarker_Monitoring);
6870 }
6871
6872 /* Check for a boundary for which the forces must be computed. */
6873 if((Boundary == EULER_WALL) || (Boundary == HEAT_FLUX) ||
6874 (Boundary == ISOTHERMAL)) {
6875
6876 /*--- Initialization for this marker ---*/
6877 CD_Inv[iMarker] = 0.0; CL_Inv[iMarker] = 0.0; CSF_Inv[iMarker] = 0.0;
6878 CMx_Inv[iMarker] = 0.0; CMy_Inv[iMarker] = 0.0; CMz_Inv[iMarker] = 0.0;
6879 CFx_Inv[iMarker] = 0.0; CFy_Inv[iMarker] = 0.0; CFz_Inv[iMarker] = 0.0;
6880 CEff_Inv[iMarker] = 0.0;
6881
6882 su2double ForceInviscid[] = {0.0, 0.0, 0.0};
6883 su2double MomentInviscid[] = {0.0, 0.0, 0.0};
6884
6885 /* Easier storage of the boundary faces for this boundary marker. */
6886 const unsigned long nSurfElem = boundaries[iMarker].surfElem.size();
6887 const CSurfaceElementFEM *surfElem = boundaries[iMarker].surfElem.data();
6888
6889 /*--- Loop over the faces of this boundary. Multiple faces are treated
6890 simultaneously to improve the performance of the matrix
6891 multiplications. As a consequence, the update of the counter l
6892 happens at the end of this loop section. ---*/
6893 for(unsigned long l=0; l<nSurfElem;) {
6894
6895 /* Determine the end index for this chunk of faces and the padded
6896 N value in the gemm computations. */
6897 unsigned long lEnd;
6898 unsigned short ind, llEnd, NPad;
6899
6900 MetaDataChunkOfElem(surfElem, l, nSurfElem, nFaceSimul,
6901 nPadMin, lEnd, ind, llEnd, NPad);
6902
6903 /* Get the required information from the corresponding standard face. */
6904 const unsigned short nInt = standardBoundaryFacesSol[ind].GetNIntegration();
6905 const unsigned short nDOFs = standardBoundaryFacesSol[ind].GetNDOFsFace();
6906 const su2double *basisFace = standardBoundaryFacesSol[ind].GetBasisFaceIntegration();
6907 const su2double *weights = standardBoundaryFacesSol[ind].GetWeightsIntegration();
6908
6909 /* Set the pointers for the local work arrays. */
6910 su2double *solInt = workArray;
6911 su2double *workArray = solInt + NPad*nInt;
6912
6913 /* Loop over the faces that are treated simultaneously. */
6914 for(unsigned short ll=0; ll<llEnd; ++ll) {
6915 const unsigned short llNVar = ll*nVar;
6916
6917 /* Easier storage of the DOFs of the face. */
6918 const unsigned long *DOFs = surfElem[l+ll].DOFsSolFace.data();
6919
6920 /* Copy the solution of the DOFs of the face such that it is
6921 contiguous in memory. */
6922 for(unsigned short i=0; i<nDOFs; ++i) {
6923 const su2double *solDOF = VecSolDOFs.data() + nVar*DOFs[i];
6924 su2double *sol = workArray + NPad*i + llNVar;
6925 for(unsigned short mm=0; mm<nVar; ++mm)
6926 sol[mm] = solDOF[mm];
6927 }
6928 }
6929
6930 /* Call the general function to carry out the matrix product to determine
6931 the solution in the integration points. */
6932 blasFunctions->gemm(nInt, NPad, nDOFs, basisFace, workArray, solInt, config);
6933
6934 /* Make a distinction between two and three space dimensions
6935 in order to have the most efficient code. */
6936 switch( nDim ) {
6937
6938 case 2: {
6939
6940 /* Two dimensional simulation. Loop over the number of faces treated
6941 simultaneously. */
6942 for(unsigned short ll=0; ll<llEnd; ++ll) {
6943 const unsigned short llNVar = ll*nVar;
6944 const unsigned long lll = l + ll;
6945
6946 /* Loop over the integration points of this surface element. */
6947 for(unsigned short i=0; i<nInt; ++i) {
6948
6949 /* Easier storage of the solution, the normals and the coordinates
6950 for this integration point. */
6951 const su2double *sol = solInt + i*NPad + llNVar;
6952 const su2double *normals = surfElem[lll].metricNormalsFace.data()
6953 + i*(nDim+1);
6954 const su2double *Coord = surfElem[lll].coorIntegrationPoints.data()
6955 + i*nDim;
6956
6957 /*--- Compute the pressure in this integration point. ---*/
6958 const su2double DensityInv = 1.0/sol[0];
6959 const su2double u = sol[1]*DensityInv;
6960 const su2double v = sol[2]*DensityInv;
6961 const su2double StaticEnergy = sol[3]*DensityInv - 0.5*(u*u + v*v);
6962
6963 FluidModel->SetTDState_rhoe(sol[0], StaticEnergy);
6964 const su2double Pressure = FluidModel->GetPressure();
6965
6966 /*-- Compute the vector from the reference point to the integration
6967 point and update the inviscid force. Note that the normal points
6968 into the geometry, hence no minus sign. ---*/
6969 const su2double DistX = Coord[0] - Origin[0];
6970 const su2double DistY = Coord[1] - Origin[1];
6971
6972 const su2double ForceMag = (Pressure - Pressure_Inf)*weights[i]
6973 * normals[nDim]*factor;
6974 const su2double ForceX = ForceMag*normals[0];
6975 const su2double ForceY = ForceMag*normals[1];
6976
6977 ForceInviscid[0] += ForceX;
6978 ForceInviscid[1] += ForceY;
6979
6980 /*--- Update the inviscid moment. ---*/
6981 MomentInviscid[2] += (ForceY*DistX - ForceX*DistY)/RefLength;
6982 }
6983 }
6984
6985 break;
6986 }
6987
6988 /*----------------------------------------------------------------*/
6989
6990 case 3: {
6991
6992 /* Three dimensional simulation. Loop over the number of faces treated
6993 simultaneously. */
6994 for(unsigned short ll=0; ll<llEnd; ++ll) {
6995 const unsigned short llNVar = ll*nVar;
6996 const unsigned long lll = l + ll;
6997
6998 /* Loop over the integration points of this surface element. */
6999 for(unsigned short i=0; i<nInt; ++i) {
7000
7001 /* Easier storage of the solution, the normals and the coordinates
7002 for this integration point. */
7003 const su2double *sol = solInt + i*NPad + llNVar;
7004 const su2double *normals = surfElem[lll].metricNormalsFace.data()
7005 + i*(nDim+1);
7006 const su2double *Coord = surfElem[lll].coorIntegrationPoints.data()
7007 + i*nDim;
7008
7009 /*--- Compute the pressure in this integration point. ---*/
7010 const su2double DensityInv = 1.0/sol[0];
7011 const su2double u = sol[1]*DensityInv;
7012 const su2double v = sol[2]*DensityInv;
7013 const su2double w = sol[3]*DensityInv;
7014 const su2double StaticEnergy = sol[4]*DensityInv - 0.5*(u*u + v*v + w*w);
7015
7016 FluidModel->SetTDState_rhoe(sol[0], StaticEnergy);
7017 const su2double Pressure = FluidModel->GetPressure();
7018
7019 /*-- Compute the vector from the reference point to the integration
7020 point and update the inviscid force. Note that the normal points
7021 into the geometry, hence no minus sign. ---*/
7022 const su2double DistX = Coord[0] - Origin[0];
7023 const su2double DistY = Coord[1] - Origin[1];
7024 const su2double DistZ = Coord[2] - Origin[2];
7025
7026 const su2double ForceMag = (Pressure - Pressure_Inf)*weights[i]
7027 * normals[nDim]*factor;
7028 const su2double ForceX = ForceMag*normals[0];
7029 const su2double ForceY = ForceMag*normals[1];
7030 const su2double ForceZ = ForceMag*normals[2];
7031
7032 ForceInviscid[0] += ForceX;
7033 ForceInviscid[1] += ForceY;
7034 ForceInviscid[2] += ForceZ;
7035
7036 /*--- Update the inviscid moment. ---*/
7037 MomentInviscid[0] += (ForceZ*DistY - ForceY*DistZ)/RefLength;
7038 MomentInviscid[1] += (ForceX*DistZ - ForceZ*DistX)/RefLength;
7039 MomentInviscid[2] += (ForceY*DistX - ForceX*DistY)/RefLength;
7040 }
7041 }
7042
7043 break;
7044 }
7045 }
7046
7047 /* Update the value of the counter l to the end index of the
7048 current chunk. */
7049 l = lEnd;
7050 }
7051
7052 /*--- Project forces and store the non-dimensional coefficients ---*/
7053 if(nDim == 2) {
7054 CD_Inv[iMarker] = ForceInviscid[0]*cos(Alpha) + ForceInviscid[1]*sin(Alpha);
7055 CL_Inv[iMarker] = -ForceInviscid[0]*sin(Alpha) + ForceInviscid[1]*cos(Alpha);
7056 CEff_Inv[iMarker] = CL_Inv[iMarker] / (CD_Inv[iMarker]+EPS);
7057 CMz_Inv[iMarker] = MomentInviscid[2];
7058 CFx_Inv[iMarker] = ForceInviscid[0];
7059 CFy_Inv[iMarker] = ForceInviscid[1];
7060 }
7061 if(nDim == 3) {
7062 CD_Inv[iMarker] = ForceInviscid[0]*cos(Alpha)*cos(Beta)
7063 + ForceInviscid[1]*sin(Beta)
7064 + ForceInviscid[2]*sin(Alpha)*cos(Beta);
7065 CL_Inv[iMarker] = -ForceInviscid[0]*sin(Alpha) + ForceInviscid[2]*cos(Alpha);
7066 CSF_Inv[iMarker] = -ForceInviscid[0]*sin(Beta)*cos(Alpha)
7067 + ForceInviscid[1]*cos(Beta)
7068 - ForceInviscid[2]*sin(Beta)*sin(Alpha);
7069 CEff_Inv[iMarker] = CL_Inv[iMarker] / (CD_Inv[iMarker] + EPS);
7070 CMx_Inv[iMarker] = MomentInviscid[0];
7071 CMy_Inv[iMarker] = MomentInviscid[1];
7072 CMz_Inv[iMarker] = MomentInviscid[2];
7073 CFx_Inv[iMarker] = ForceInviscid[0];
7074 CFy_Inv[iMarker] = ForceInviscid[1];
7075 CFz_Inv[iMarker] = ForceInviscid[2];
7076 }
7077
7078 AllBound_CD_Inv += CD_Inv[iMarker];
7079 AllBound_CL_Inv += CL_Inv[iMarker];
7080 AllBound_CSF_Inv += CSF_Inv[iMarker];
7081 AllBound_CEff_Inv = AllBound_CL_Inv / (AllBound_CD_Inv + EPS);
7082 AllBound_CMx_Inv += CMx_Inv[iMarker];
7083 AllBound_CMy_Inv += CMy_Inv[iMarker];
7084 AllBound_CMz_Inv += CMz_Inv[iMarker];
7085 AllBound_CFx_Inv += CFx_Inv[iMarker];
7086 AllBound_CFy_Inv += CFy_Inv[iMarker];
7087 AllBound_CFz_Inv += CFz_Inv[iMarker];
7088
7089 /*--- Compute the coefficients per surface ---*/
7090 for(unsigned short iMarker_Monitoring=0; iMarker_Monitoring<config->GetnMarker_Monitoring();
7091 ++iMarker_Monitoring) {
7092 string Monitoring_Tag = config->GetMarker_Monitoring_TagBound(iMarker_Monitoring);
7093 string Marker_Tag = config->GetMarker_All_TagBound(iMarker);
7094 if (Marker_Tag == Monitoring_Tag) {
7095 Surface_CL_Inv[iMarker_Monitoring] += CL_Inv[iMarker];
7096 Surface_CD_Inv[iMarker_Monitoring] += CD_Inv[iMarker];
7097 Surface_CSF_Inv[iMarker_Monitoring] += CSF_Inv[iMarker];
7098 Surface_CEff_Inv[iMarker_Monitoring] = Surface_CL_Inv[iMarker_Monitoring]
7099 / (Surface_CD_Inv[iMarker_Monitoring] + EPS);
7100 Surface_CFx_Inv[iMarker_Monitoring] += CFx_Inv[iMarker];
7101 Surface_CFy_Inv[iMarker_Monitoring] += CFy_Inv[iMarker];
7102 Surface_CFz_Inv[iMarker_Monitoring] += CFz_Inv[iMarker];
7103 Surface_CMx_Inv[iMarker_Monitoring] += CMx_Inv[iMarker];
7104 Surface_CMy_Inv[iMarker_Monitoring] += CMy_Inv[iMarker];
7105 Surface_CMz_Inv[iMarker_Monitoring] += CMz_Inv[iMarker];
7106 }
7107 }
7108 }
7109 }
7110 }
7111
7112#ifdef HAVE_MPI
7113
7114 /*--- Parallel mode. The data from all ranks must be gathered.
7115 Determine the size of the communication buffer. ---*/
7116 const unsigned long nCommSize = 9*config->GetnMarker_Monitoring() + 9;
7117
7118 /*--- Define the communication buffers and store to local data in
7119 the local buffer. ---*/
7120 vector<su2double> locBuf(nCommSize), globBuf(nCommSize);
7121
7122 unsigned long ii = 0;
7123 locBuf[ii++] = AllBound_CD_Inv; locBuf[ii++] = AllBound_CL_Inv;
7124 locBuf[ii++] = AllBound_CSF_Inv; locBuf[ii++] = AllBound_CMx_Inv;
7125 locBuf[ii++] = AllBound_CMy_Inv; locBuf[ii++] = AllBound_CMz_Inv;
7126 locBuf[ii++] = AllBound_CFx_Inv; locBuf[ii++] = AllBound_CFy_Inv;
7127 locBuf[ii++] = AllBound_CFz_Inv;
7128
7129 for(unsigned short i=0; i<config->GetnMarker_Monitoring(); ++i) {
7130 locBuf[ii++] = Surface_CL_Inv[i]; locBuf[ii++] = Surface_CD_Inv[i];
7131 locBuf[ii++] = Surface_CSF_Inv[i]; locBuf[ii++] = Surface_CFx_Inv[i];
7132 locBuf[ii++] = Surface_CFy_Inv[i]; locBuf[ii++] = Surface_CFz_Inv[i];
7133 locBuf[ii++] = Surface_CMx_Inv[i]; locBuf[ii++] = Surface_CMy_Inv[i];
7134 locBuf[ii++] = Surface_CMz_Inv[i];
7135 }
7136
7137 /* Sum up all the data from all ranks. The result will be available on all ranks. */
7138 if (config->GetComm_Level() == COMM_FULL) {
7139 SU2_MPI::Allreduce(locBuf.data(), globBuf.data(), nCommSize, MPI_DOUBLE,
7140 MPI_SUM, SU2_MPI::GetComm());
7141 }
7142
7143 /*--- Copy the data back from globBuf into the required variables. ---*/
7144 ii = 0;
7145 AllBound_CD_Inv = globBuf[ii++]; AllBound_CL_Inv = globBuf[ii++];
7146 AllBound_CSF_Inv = globBuf[ii++]; AllBound_CMx_Inv = globBuf[ii++];
7147 AllBound_CMy_Inv = globBuf[ii++]; AllBound_CMz_Inv = globBuf[ii++];
7148 AllBound_CFx_Inv = globBuf[ii++]; AllBound_CFy_Inv = globBuf[ii++];
7149 AllBound_CFz_Inv = globBuf[ii++];
7150
7151 AllBound_CEff_Inv = AllBound_CL_Inv/(AllBound_CD_Inv + EPS);
7152
7153 for(unsigned short i=0; i<config->GetnMarker_Monitoring(); ++i) {
7154 Surface_CL_Inv[i] = globBuf[ii++]; Surface_CD_Inv[i] = globBuf[ii++];
7155 Surface_CSF_Inv[i] = globBuf[ii++]; Surface_CFx_Inv[i] = globBuf[ii++];
7156 Surface_CFy_Inv[i] = globBuf[ii++]; Surface_CFz_Inv[i] = globBuf[ii++];
7157 Surface_CMx_Inv[i] = globBuf[ii++]; Surface_CMy_Inv[i] = globBuf[ii++];
7158 Surface_CMz_Inv[i] = globBuf[ii++];
7159
7160 Surface_CEff_Inv[i] = Surface_CL_Inv[i]/(Surface_CD_Inv[i] + EPS);
7161 }
7162
7163#endif
7164
7165 /*--- Update the total coefficients (note that all the nodes have the same value) ---*/
7166 Total_CD = AllBound_CD_Inv;
7167 Total_CL = AllBound_CL_Inv;
7168 Total_CSF = AllBound_CSF_Inv;
7169 Total_CEff = Total_CL / (Total_CD + EPS);
7170 Total_CMx = AllBound_CMx_Inv;
7171 Total_CMy = AllBound_CMy_Inv;
7172 Total_CMz = AllBound_CMz_Inv;
7173 Total_CFx = AllBound_CFx_Inv;
7174 Total_CFy = AllBound_CFy_Inv;
7175 Total_CFz = AllBound_CFz_Inv;
7176
7177 /*--- Update the total coefficients per surface (note that all the nodes have the same value)---*/
7178 for(unsigned short iMarker_Monitoring=0; iMarker_Monitoring<config->GetnMarker_Monitoring();
7179 ++iMarker_Monitoring) {
7180 Surface_CL[iMarker_Monitoring] = Surface_CL_Inv[iMarker_Monitoring];
7181 Surface_CD[iMarker_Monitoring] = Surface_CD_Inv[iMarker_Monitoring];
7182 Surface_CSF[iMarker_Monitoring] = Surface_CSF_Inv[iMarker_Monitoring];
7183 Surface_CEff[iMarker_Monitoring] = Surface_CL_Inv[iMarker_Monitoring]
7184 / (Surface_CD_Inv[iMarker_Monitoring] + EPS);
7185 Surface_CFx[iMarker_Monitoring] = Surface_CFx_Inv[iMarker_Monitoring];
7186 Surface_CFy[iMarker_Monitoring] = Surface_CFy_Inv[iMarker_Monitoring];
7187 Surface_CFz[iMarker_Monitoring] = Surface_CFz_Inv[iMarker_Monitoring];
7188 Surface_CMx[iMarker_Monitoring] = Surface_CMx_Inv[iMarker_Monitoring];
7189 Surface_CMy[iMarker_Monitoring] = Surface_CMy_Inv[iMarker_Monitoring];
7190 Surface_CMz[iMarker_Monitoring] = Surface_CMz_Inv[iMarker_Monitoring];
7191 }
7192}
7193
7194void CFEM_DG_EulerSolver::ExplicitRK_Iteration(CGeometry *geometry, CSolver **solver_container,
7195 CConfig *config, unsigned short iRKStep) {
7196
7197 const su2double RK_AlphaCoeff = config->Get_Alpha_RKStep(iRKStep);
7198 const unsigned short nRKStages = config->GetnRKStep();
7199
7200 SetResToZero();
7201
7202 /* Set the pointer to the array where the new state vector must be stored.
7203 If this is the last RK step, the solution should be stored in
7204 VecSolDOFs, such that a new time step can be taken. Otherwise, the
7205 solution should be stored in the first time level of the working vectors
7206 for the solution. Note that only one working vector will be present for a
7207 RK scheme, because time accurate local time stepping is not possible yet
7208 with RK schemes. */
7209 su2double *solNew;
7210 if(iRKStep == (nRKStages-1)) solNew = VecSolDOFs.data();
7211 else solNew = VecWorkSolDOFs[0].data();
7212
7213 /*--- Update the solution by looping over the owned volume elements. ---*/
7214 for(unsigned long l=0; l<nVolElemOwned; ++l) {
7215
7216 /* Set the pointers for the residual and solution for this element. */
7217 const unsigned long offset = nVar*volElem[l].offsetDOFsSolLocal;
7218 const su2double *res = VecResDOFs.data() + offset;
7219 const su2double *solDOFsOld = VecSolDOFs.data() + offset;
7220 su2double *solDOFs = solNew + offset;
7221
7222 /* Loop over the DOFs for this element and update the solution. */
7223 const su2double tmp = RK_AlphaCoeff*VecDeltaTime[l];
7224 const unsigned short nVarNDOFs = nVar*volElem[l].nDOFsSol;
7225
7226 for(unsigned short j=0; j<nVarNDOFs; ++j)
7227 solDOFs[j] = solDOFsOld[j] - tmp*res[j];
7228 }
7229
7230 /*--- Test for the last RK step. ---*/
7231 if(iRKStep == (nRKStages-1)) {
7232
7233 /*--- Compute the root mean square residual. Note that the SetResidual_RMS
7234 function of CSolver cannot be used, because that is for the FV solver. ---*/
7235 SetResidual_RMS_FEM(geometry, config);
7236
7237 /*--- For verification cases, compute the global error metrics. ---*/
7238 ComputeVerificationError(geometry, config);
7239 }
7240}
7241
7242void CFEM_DG_EulerSolver::ClassicalRK4_Iteration(CGeometry *geometry, CSolver **solver_container,
7243 CConfig *config, unsigned short iRKStep) {
7244
7245 /*--- Hard-coded classical RK4 coefficients. Will be added to config. ---*/
