7246 su2double RK_FuncCoeff[4] = {1.0/6.0, 1.0/3.0, 1.0/3.0, 1.0/6.0};
7247 su2double RK_TimeCoeff[4] = {0.5, 0.5, 1.0, 1.0};
7248
7249 SetResToZero();
7250
7251 /*--- Update the solution by looping over the owned volume elements. ---*/
7252 for(unsigned long l=0; l<nVolElemOwned; ++l) {
7253
7254 /* Set the pointers for the residual and solution for this element. */
7255 const unsigned long offset = nVar*volElem[l].offsetDOFsSolLocal;
7256 const su2double *res = VecResDOFs.data() + offset;
7257 const su2double *solDOFsOld = VecSolDOFs.data() + offset;
7258 su2double *solDOFsNew = VecSolDOFsNew.data() + offset;
7259
7260 su2double *solDOFs;
7261 if(iRKStep < 3) solDOFs = VecWorkSolDOFs[0].data() + offset;
7262 else solDOFs = VecSolDOFs.data() + offset;
7263
7264 /* Loop over the DOFs for this element and update the solution and the L2 norm. */
7265 const su2double tmp_time = -1.0*RK_TimeCoeff[iRKStep]*VecDeltaTime[l];
7266 const su2double tmp_func = -1.0*RK_FuncCoeff[iRKStep]*VecDeltaTime[l];
7267
7268 const unsigned short nVarNDOFs = nVar*volElem[l].nDOFsSol;
7269
7270 if (iRKStep < 3) {
7271 for(unsigned short j=0; j<nVarNDOFs; ++j) {
7272 solDOFsNew[j] += tmp_func*res[j];
7273 solDOFs[j] = solDOFsOld[j] + tmp_time*res[j];
7274 }
7275 }
7276 else {
7277 for(unsigned short j=0; j<nVarNDOFs; ++j)
7278 solDOFs[j] = solDOFsNew[j] + tmp_func*res[j];
7279 }
7280 }
7281
7282 /*--- Test for the last RK step. ---*/
7283 if(iRKStep == 3) {
7284
7285 /*--- Compute the root mean square residual. Note that the SetResidual_RMS
7286 function of CSolver cannot be used, because that is for the FV solver. ---*/
7287 SetResidual_RMS_FEM(geometry, config);
7288
7289 /*--- For verification cases, compute the global error metrics. ---*/
7290 ComputeVerificationError(geometry, config);
7291 }
7292}
7293
7294void CFEM_DG_EulerSolver::SetResidual_RMS_FEM(CGeometry *geometry,
7295 CConfig *config) {
7296
7297 /* Initialize the residuals to zero. */
7298 SetResToZero();
7299
7300 /*--- Loop over the owned elements. It is not possible to loop directly over the owned
7301 DOFs, because the coordinates of the DOFs are only known in the volume class. ---*/
7302 for(unsigned long l=0; l<nVolElemOwned; ++l) {
7303
7304 /* Set the pointer for the residual for this element. */
7305 const unsigned long offset = nVar*volElem[l].offsetDOFsSolLocal;
7306 const su2double *res = VecResDOFs.data() + offset;
7307
7308 /* Loop over the DOFs for this element and update the norms. */
7309 unsigned int i = 0;
7310 for(unsigned short j=0; j<volElem[l].nDOFsSol; ++j) {
7311 const unsigned long globalIndex = volElem[l].offsetDOFsSolGlobal + j;
7312 const su2double *coor = volElem[l].coorSolDOFs.data() + j*nDim;
7313
7314 for(unsigned short iVar=0; iVar<nVar; ++iVar, ++i) {
7315
7316 Residual_RMS[iVar] += res[i]*res[i];
7317 AddRes_Max(iVar, fabs(res[i]), globalIndex, coor);
7318 }
7319 }
7320 }
7321
7322#ifdef HAVE_MPI
7323 /* Parallel mode. Disable the reduce for the residual to avoid overhead if requested. */
7324 if (config->GetComm_Level() == COMM_FULL) {
7325
7326 /*--- The local L2 norms must be added to obtain the
7327 global value. Also check for divergence. ---*/
7328 vector<su2double> rbufRes(nVar);
7329 SU2_MPI::Allreduce(Residual_RMS.data(), rbufRes.data(), nVar, MPI_DOUBLE, MPI_SUM, SU2_MPI::GetComm());
7330
7331 for(unsigned short iVar=0; iVar<nVar; ++iVar) {
7332 if (rbufRes[iVar] != rbufRes[iVar])
7333 SU2_MPI::Error("SU2 has diverged. (NaN detected)", CURRENT_FUNCTION);
7334
7335 Residual_RMS[iVar] = max(EPS*EPS, sqrt(rbufRes[iVar]/nDOFsGlobal));
7336 }
7337
7338 /*--- The global maximum norms must be obtained. ---*/
7339 rbufRes.resize(nVar*size);
7340 SU2_MPI::Allgather(Residual_Max.data(), nVar, MPI_DOUBLE, rbufRes.data(),
7341 nVar, MPI_DOUBLE, SU2_MPI::GetComm());
7342
7343 vector<unsigned long> rbufPoint(nVar*size);
7344 SU2_MPI::Allgather(Point_Max.data(), nVar, MPI_UNSIGNED_LONG, rbufPoint.data(),
7345 nVar, MPI_UNSIGNED_LONG, SU2_MPI::GetComm());
7346
7347 vector<su2double> sbufCoor(nDim*nVar);
7348 for(unsigned short iVar=0; iVar<nVar; ++iVar) {
7349 for(unsigned short iDim=0; iDim<nDim; ++iDim)
7350 sbufCoor[iVar*nDim+iDim] = Point_Max_Coord[iVar][iDim];
7351 }
7352
7353 vector<su2double> rbufCoor(nDim*nVar*size);
7354 SU2_MPI::Allgather(sbufCoor.data(), nVar*nDim, MPI_DOUBLE, rbufCoor.data(),
7355 nVar*nDim, MPI_DOUBLE, SU2_MPI::GetComm());
7356
7357 for(unsigned short iVar=0; iVar<nVar; ++iVar) {
7358 for(int proc=0; proc<size; ++proc)
7359 AddRes_Max(iVar, rbufRes[proc*nVar+iVar], rbufPoint[proc*nVar+iVar],
7360 &rbufCoor[proc*nVar*nDim+iVar*nDim]);
7361 }
7362 }
7363
7364#else
7365 /*--- Sequential mode. Check for a divergence of the solver and compute
7366 the L2-norm of the residuals. ---*/
7367 for(unsigned short iVar=0; iVar<nVar; ++iVar) {
7368
7369 if(GetRes_RMS(iVar) != GetRes_RMS(iVar))
7370 SU2_MPI::Error("SU2 has diverged. (NaN detected)", CURRENT_FUNCTION);
7371
7372 Residual_RMS[iVar] = max(EPS*EPS, sqrt(GetRes_RMS(iVar)/nDOFsGlobal));
7373 }
7374
7375#endif
7376}
7377
7378void CFEM_DG_EulerSolver::ComputeVerificationError(CGeometry *geometry,
7379 CConfig *config) {
7380
7381 /*--- The errors only need to be computed on the finest grid. ---*/
7382 if(MGLevel != MESH_0) return;
7383
7384 /*--- If this is a verification case, we can compute the global
7385 error metrics by using the difference between the local error
7386 and the known solution at each DOF. This is then collected into
7387 RMS (L2) and maximum (Linf) global error norms. From these
7388 global measures, one can compute the order of accuracy. ---*/
7389
7390 bool write_heads = ((((config->GetTimeIter() % (config->GetScreen_Wrt_Freq(2)*40)) == 0)
7391 && (config->GetTimeIter()!= 0))
7392 || (config->GetTimeIter() == 1));
7393 if( !write_heads ) return;
7394
7395 /*--- Check if there actually is an exact solution for this
7396 verification case, if computed at all. ---*/
7397 if (VerificationSolution) {
7398 if (VerificationSolution->ExactSolutionKnown()) {
7399
7400 /*--- Get the physical time if necessary. ---*/
7401 su2double time = 0.0;
7402 if (config->GetTime_Marching() != TIME_MARCHING::STEADY) time = config->GetPhysicalTime();
7403
7404 /*--- Reset the global error measures to zero. ---*/
7405 for (unsigned short iVar = 0; iVar < nVar; iVar++) {
7406 VerificationSolution->SetError_RMS(iVar, 0.0);
7407 VerificationSolution->SetError_Max(iVar, 0.0, 0);
7408 }
7409
7410 /*--- Loop over the owned elements. It is not possible to loop directly over the owned
7411 DOFs, because the coordinates of the DOFs are only known in the volume element class. ---*/
7412 for(unsigned long l=0; l<nVolElemOwned; ++l) {
7413
7414 /* Set the pointer for the solution for this element. */
7415 const unsigned long offset = nVar*volElem[l].offsetDOFsSolLocal;
7416 const su2double *solDOFs = VecSolDOFs.data() + offset;
7417
7418 /* Loop over the DOFs for this element. */
7419 for(unsigned short j=0; j<volElem[l].nDOFsSol; ++j) {
7420 const unsigned long globalIndex = volElem[l].offsetDOFsSolGlobal + j;
7421 const su2double *solDOF = solDOFs + j*nVar;
7422 su2double *coor = volElem[l].coorSolDOFs.data() + j*nDim;
7423
7424 /* Get local error from the verification solution class. */
7425 vector<su2double> error(nVar,0.0);
7426 VerificationSolution->GetLocalError(coor, time, solDOF, error.data());
7427
7428 /* Increment the global error measures */
7429 for (unsigned short iVar = 0; iVar < nVar; iVar++) {
7430 VerificationSolution->AddError_RMS(iVar, error[iVar]*error[iVar]);
7431 VerificationSolution->AddError_Max(iVar, fabs(error[iVar]), globalIndex, coor);
7432 }
7433 }
7434 }
7435
7436 /* Finalize the calculation of the global error measures. */
7437 VerificationSolution->SetVerificationError(nDOFsGlobal, config);
7438
7439 /*--- Screen output of the error metrics. This can be improved
7440 once the new output classes are in place. ---*/
7441
7442 if (rank == MASTER_NODE) {
7443
7444 cout.precision(5);
7445 cout.setf(ios::scientific, ios::floatfield);
7446
7447 if (!config->GetDiscrete_Adjoint()) {
7448
7449 cout << endl << "------------------------ Global Error Analysis --------------------------" << endl;
7450
7451 cout << setw(20) << "RMS Error [Rho]: " << setw(12) << VerificationSolution->GetError_RMS(0) << " | ";
7452 cout << setw(20) << "Max Error [Rho]: " << setw(12) << VerificationSolution->GetError_Max(0);
7453 cout << endl;
7454
7455 cout << setw(20) << "RMS Error [RhoU]: " << setw(12) << VerificationSolution->GetError_RMS(1) << " | ";
7456 cout << setw(20) << "Max Error [RhoU]: " << setw(12) << VerificationSolution->GetError_Max(1);
7457 cout << endl;
7458
7459 cout << setw(20) << "RMS Error [RhoV]: " << setw(12) << VerificationSolution->GetError_RMS(2) << " | ";
7460 cout << setw(20) << "Max Error [RhoV]: " << setw(12) << VerificationSolution->GetError_Max(2);
7461 cout << endl;
7462
7463 if (nDim == 3) {
7464 cout << setw(20) << "RMS Error [RhoW]: " << setw(12) << VerificationSolution->GetError_RMS(3) << " | ";
7465 cout << setw(20) << "Max Error [RhoW]: " << setw(12) << VerificationSolution->GetError_Max(3);
7466 cout << endl;
7467 }
7468
7469 cout << setw(20) << "RMS Error [RhoE]: " << setw(12) << VerificationSolution->GetError_RMS(nDim+1) << " | ";
7470 cout << setw(20) << "Max Error [RhoE]: " << setw(12) << VerificationSolution->GetError_Max(nDim+1);
7471 cout << endl;
7472
7473 cout << "-------------------------------------------------------------------------" << endl << endl;
7474 cout.unsetf(ios_base::floatfield);
7475
7476 }
7477 }
7478 }
7479 }
7480}
7481
7482void CFEM_DG_EulerSolver::ADER_DG_Iteration(const unsigned long elemBeg,
7483 const unsigned long elemEnd) {
7484
7485 /*--- Update the solution by looping over the given range
7486 of volume elements. ---*/
7487 for(unsigned long l=elemBeg; l<elemEnd; ++l) {
7488
7489 /* Set the pointers for the residual and solution for this element. */
7490 const unsigned long offset = nVar*volElem[l].offsetDOFsSolLocal;
7491 su2double *res = VecTotResDOFsADER.data() + offset;
7492 su2double *solDOFs = VecSolDOFs.data() + offset;
7493
7494 /* Loop over the DOFs for this element and update the solution.
7495 Initialize the residual to zero afterwards. */
7496 for(unsigned short i=0; i<(nVar*volElem[l].nDOFsSol); ++i) {
7497 solDOFs[i] -= VecDeltaTime[l]*res[i];
7498 res[i] = 0.0;
7499 }
7500 }
7501}
7502
7503void CFEM_DG_EulerSolver::BoundaryStates_Euler_Wall(CConfig *config,
7504 const unsigned short nFaceSimul,
7505 const unsigned short NPad,
7506 const CSurfaceElementFEM *surfElem,
7507 const su2double *solIntL,
7508 su2double *solIntR) {
7509
7510 /*--- Apply the inviscid wall boundary conditions to compute the right
7511 state in the integration points. There are two options. Either the
7512 normal velocity is negated or the normal velocity is set to zero,
7513 relative to the grid motion. Some experiments are needed to see which
7514 formulation gives better results. ---*/
7515
7516 /* Get the required information from the standard element, which is the
7517 same for all simultaneously treated faces. */
7518 const unsigned short ind = surfElem[0].indStandardElement;
7519 const unsigned short nInt = standardBoundaryFacesSol[ind].GetNIntegration();
7520
7521 /* Loop over the faces that are treated simultaneously. */
7522 for(unsigned short l=0; l<nFaceSimul; ++l) {
7523 const unsigned short llNVar = l*nVar;
7524
7525 /* Loop over the integration points of the face. */
7526 for(unsigned short i=0; i<nInt; ++i) {
7527
7528 /* Easier storage of the left and right solution, the normals and the
7529 grid velocity for this integration point. */
7530 const su2double *UL = solIntL + i*NPad + llNVar;
7531 su2double *UR = solIntR + i*NPad + llNVar;
7532 const su2double *normals = surfElem[l].metricNormalsFace.data() + i*(nDim+1);
7533 const su2double *gridVel = surfElem[l].gridVelocities.data() + i*nDim;
7534
7535 /* Compute the normal component of the momentum variables, relative
7536 to the grid motion. */
7537 su2double rVn = 0.0;
7538 for(unsigned short iDim=0; iDim<nDim; ++iDim)
7539 rVn += (UL[iDim+1]-UL[0]*gridVel[iDim])*normals[iDim];
7540
7541 /* If the normal velocity must be mirrored instead of set to zero,
7542 the normal component that must be subtracted must be doubled. If the
7543 normal velocity must be set to zero, simply comment this line. */
7544 //rVn *= 2.0;
7545
7546 /* Set the right state. The initial value of the total energy is the
7547 energy of the left state. */
7548 UR[0] = UL[0];
7549 UR[nDim+1] = UL[nDim+1];
7550 for(unsigned short iDim=0; iDim<nDim; ++iDim)
7551 UR[iDim+1] = UL[iDim+1] - rVn*normals[iDim];
7552
7553 /*--- Actually, only the internal energy of UR is equal to UL. If the
7554 kinetic energy differs for UL and UR, the difference must be
7555 subtracted from the total energy of UR to obtain the correct
7556 value. ---*/
7557 su2double DensityInv = 1.0/UL[0];
7558 su2double diffKin = 0;
7559 for(unsigned short iDim=1; iDim<=nDim; ++iDim) {
7560 const su2double velL = DensityInv*UL[iDim];
7561 const su2double velR = DensityInv*UR[iDim];
7562 diffKin += velL*velL - velR*velR;
7563 }
7564
7565 UR[nDim+1] -= 0.5*UL[0]*diffKin;
7566 }
7567 }
7568}
7569
7570void CFEM_DG_EulerSolver::BoundaryStates_Inlet(CConfig *config,
7571 const unsigned short nFaceSimul,
7572 const unsigned short NPad,
7573 const CSurfaceElementFEM *surfElem,
7574 unsigned short val_marker,
7575 const su2double *solIntL,
7576 su2double *solIntR) {
7577
7578 /*--- Retrieve the specified total conditions for this inlet. ---*/
7579 string Marker_Tag = config->GetMarker_All_TagBound(val_marker);
7580
7581 su2double P_Total = config->GetInlet_Ptotal(Marker_Tag);
7582 su2double T_Total = config->GetInlet_Ttotal(Marker_Tag);
7583 auto Flow_Dir = config->GetInlet_FlowDir(Marker_Tag);
7584
7585 /*--- Non-dim. the inputs if necessary, and compute the total enthalpy. ---*/
7586 P_Total /= config->GetPressure_Ref();
7587 T_Total /= config->GetTemperature_Ref();
7588
7589 su2double Gas_Constant = config->GetGas_ConstantND();
7590 su2double H_Total = (Gamma*Gas_Constant/Gamma_Minus_One)*T_Total;
7591
7592 /* Get the required information from the standard element, which is the
7593 same for all simultaneously treated faces. */
7594 const unsigned short ind = surfElem[0].indStandardElement;
7595 const unsigned short nInt = standardBoundaryFacesSol[ind].GetNIntegration();
7596
7597 /* Loop over the faces that are treated simultaneously. */
7598 for(unsigned short l=0; l<nFaceSimul; ++l) {
7599 const unsigned short llNVar = l*nVar;
7600
7601 /* Loop over the integration points of the face. */
7602 for(unsigned short i=0; i<nInt; ++i) {
7603
7604 /* Easier storage of the left and right solution and the normals
7605 for this integration point. */
7606 const su2double *UL = solIntL + i*NPad + llNVar;
7607 su2double *UR = solIntR + i*NPad + llNVar;
7608 const su2double *normals = surfElem[l].metricNormalsFace.data() + i*(nDim+1);
7609
7610 /*--- Compute the normal velocity, the speed of sound squared and
7611 the pressure in this integration point. ---*/
7612 const su2double DensityInv = 1.0/UL[0];
7613 su2double VelocityNormal = 0.0, Velocity2 = 0.0;
7614 for(unsigned short iDim=0; iDim<nDim; ++iDim) {
7615 const su2double vel = UL[iDim+1]*DensityInv;
7616 VelocityNormal += vel*normals[iDim];
7617 Velocity2 += vel*vel;
7618 }
7619
7620 su2double StaticEnergy = UL[nDim+1]*DensityInv - 0.5*Velocity2;
7621
7622 FluidModel->SetTDState_rhoe(UL[0], StaticEnergy);
7623 su2double SoundSpeed2 = FluidModel->GetSoundSpeed2();
7624 su2double Pressure = FluidModel->GetPressure();
7625
7626 /*--- Compute the Riemann invariant to be extrapolated. ---*/
7627 const su2double Riemann = 2.0*sqrt(SoundSpeed2)/Gamma_Minus_One + VelocityNormal;
7628
7629 /*--- Total speed of sound. The expression below is also valid for variable cp,
7630 although a linearization around the value of the left state is performed. ---*/
7631 const su2double SoundSpeed_Total2 = Gamma_Minus_One*(H_Total - DensityInv*(UL[nDim+1] + Pressure)
7632 + 0.5*Velocity2) + SoundSpeed2;
7633
7634 /*--- Dot product of normal and flow direction. This should be
7635 negative due to outward facing boundary normal convention. ---*/
7636 su2double alpha = 0.0;
7637 for(unsigned short iDim=0; iDim<nDim; ++iDim)
7638 alpha += normals[iDim]*Flow_Dir[iDim];
7639
7640 /*--- Coefficients in the quadratic equation for the magnitude of the velocity. ---*/
7641 const su2double aa = 1.0 + 0.5*Gamma_Minus_One*alpha*alpha;
7642 const su2double bb = -1.0*Gamma_Minus_One*alpha*Riemann;
7643 const su2double cc = 0.5*Gamma_Minus_One*Riemann*Riemann
7644 - 2.0*SoundSpeed_Total2/Gamma_Minus_One;
7645
7646 /*--- Solve the equation for the magnitude of the velocity. As this value
7647 must be positive and both aa and bb are positive (alpha is negative and
7648 Riemann is positive up till Mach = 5.0 or so, which is not really subsonic
7649 anymore), it is clear which of the two possible solutions must be taken.
7650 Some clipping is present, but this is normally not active. ---*/
7651 su2double dd = bb*bb - 4.0*aa*cc; dd = sqrt(max(0.0, dd));
7652 su2double Vel_Mag = (-bb + dd)/(2.0*aa); Vel_Mag = max(0.0, Vel_Mag);
7653 Velocity2 = Vel_Mag*Vel_Mag;
7654
7655 /*--- Compute speed of sound from total speed of sound eqn. ---*/
7656 SoundSpeed2 = SoundSpeed_Total2 - 0.5*Gamma_Minus_One*Velocity2;
7657
7658 /*--- Mach squared (cut between 0-1), use to adapt velocity ---*/
7659 su2double Mach2 = Velocity2/SoundSpeed2; Mach2 = min(1.0, Mach2);
7660
7661 Velocity2 = Mach2*SoundSpeed2;
7662 Vel_Mag = sqrt(Velocity2);
7663
7664 /*--- Static temperature from the speed of sound relation. ---*/
7665 SoundSpeed2 = SoundSpeed_Total2 - 0.5*Gamma_Minus_One*Velocity2;
7666
7667 const su2double Temperature = SoundSpeed2/(Gamma*Gas_Constant);
7668
7669 /*--- Static pressure using isentropic relation at a point ---*/
7670 Pressure = P_Total*pow((Temperature/T_Total), Gamma/Gamma_Minus_One);
7671
7672 /*--- Density at the inlet from the gas law ---*/
7673 const su2double Density = Pressure/(Gas_Constant*Temperature);
7674
7675 /*--- Store the conservative variables in UR. ---*/
7676 UR[0] = Density;
7677 UR[nDim+1] = Pressure/Gamma_Minus_One + 0.5*Density*Velocity2;
7678
7679 for(unsigned short iDim=0; iDim<nDim; ++iDim)
7680 UR[iDim+1] = Density*Vel_Mag*Flow_Dir[iDim];
7681 }
7682 }
7683}
7684
7685void CFEM_DG_EulerSolver::BoundaryStates_Outlet(CConfig *config,
7686 const unsigned short nFaceSimul,
7687 const unsigned short NPad,
7688 const CSurfaceElementFEM *surfElem,
7689 unsigned short val_marker,
7690 const su2double *solIntL,
7691 su2double *solIntR) {
7692
7693 /*--- Retrieve the specified back pressure for this outlet.
7694 Nondimensionalize, if necessary. ---*/
7695 string Marker_Tag = config->GetMarker_All_TagBound(val_marker);
7696
7697 su2double P_Exit = config->GetOutlet_Pressure(Marker_Tag);
7698 P_Exit = P_Exit/config->GetPressure_Ref();
7699
7700 /* Get the required information from the standard element, which is the
7701 same for all simultaneously treated faces. */
7702 const unsigned short ind = surfElem[0].indStandardElement;
7703 const unsigned short nInt = standardBoundaryFacesSol[ind].GetNIntegration();
7704
7705 /* Loop over the faces that are treated simultaneously. */
7706 for(unsigned short l=0; l<nFaceSimul; ++l) {
7707 const unsigned short llNVar = l*nVar;
7708
7709 /* Loop over the integration points of the face. */
7710 for(unsigned short i=0; i<nInt; ++i) {
7711
7712 /* Easier storage of the left and right solution and the normals
7713 for this integration point. */
7714 const su2double *UL = solIntL + i*NPad + llNVar;
7715 su2double *UR = solIntR + i*NPad + llNVar;
7716 const su2double *normals = surfElem[l].metricNormalsFace.data() + i*(nDim+1);
7717
7718 /*--- Compute the normal velocity, the speed of sound squared and
7719 the pressure in this integration point. ---*/
7720 const su2double DensityInv = 1.0/UL[0];
7721 su2double VelocityNormal = 0.0, Velocity2 = 0.0;
7722 for(unsigned short iDim=0; iDim<nDim; ++iDim) {
7723 const su2double vel = UL[iDim+1]*DensityInv;
7724 VelocityNormal += vel*normals[iDim];
7725 Velocity2 += vel*vel;
7726 }
7727
7728 su2double StaticEnergy = UL[nDim+1]*DensityInv - 0.5*Velocity2;
7729
7730 FluidModel->SetTDState_rhoe(UL[0], StaticEnergy);
7731 su2double SoundSpeed2 = FluidModel->GetSoundSpeed2();
7732 su2double Pressure = FluidModel->GetPressure();
7733
7734 /*--- Subsonic exit flow: there is one incoming characteristic,
7735 therefore one variable can be specified (back pressure) and is used
7736 to update the conservative variables. Compute the entropy and the
7737 acoustic Riemann variable. These invariants, as well as the
7738 tangential velocity components, are extrapolated. ---*/
7739 const su2double Entropy = Pressure*pow(DensityInv, Gamma);
7740 const su2double Riemann = 2.0*sqrt(SoundSpeed2)/Gamma_Minus_One + VelocityNormal;
7741
7742 /*--- Compute the density and normal velocity of the right state. ---*/
7743 const su2double Density = pow(P_Exit/Entropy,1.0/Gamma);
7744 const su2double SoundSpeed = sqrt(Gamma*P_Exit/Density);
7745 const su2double Vn_Exit = Riemann - 2.0*SoundSpeed/Gamma_Minus_One;
7746
7747 /*--- Store the conservative variables in UR. ---*/
7748 Velocity2 = 0.0;
7749 for(unsigned short iDim=0; iDim<nDim; ++iDim) {
7750 const su2double vel = UL[iDim+1]*DensityInv
7751 + (Vn_Exit-VelocityNormal)*normals[iDim];
7752 Velocity2 += vel*vel;
7753 UR[iDim+1] = Density*vel;
7754 }
7755
7756 UR[0] = Density;
7757 UR[nDim+1] = Pressure/Gamma_Minus_One + 0.5*Density*Velocity2;
7758 }
7759 }
7760}
7761
7762void CFEM_DG_EulerSolver::BoundaryStates_Riemann(CConfig *config,
7763 const unsigned short nFaceSimul,
7764 const unsigned short NPad,
7765 const CSurfaceElementFEM *surfElem,
7766 unsigned short val_marker,
7767 const su2double *solIntL,
7768 su2double *solIntR) {
7769
7770 /* Retrieve the corresponding string for this marker. */
7771 string Marker_Tag = config->GetMarker_All_TagBound(val_marker);
7772
7773 /* Determine the number of integration points for the face, which is
7774 the same for all simultaneously treated faces. */
7775 const unsigned short ind = surfElem[0].indStandardElement;
7776 const unsigned short nInt = standardBoundaryFacesSol[ind].GetNIntegration();
7777
7778 /*--- Make a distinction between the different type of boundary conditions
7779 and set the initial guess of the right states in the integration
7780 points of the face. ---*/
7781 switch( config->GetKind_Data_Riemann(Marker_Tag) ) {
7782 case TOTAL_CONDITIONS_PT: {
7783
7784 /* Total conditions specified. Retrieve the non-dimensional total
7785 pressure and temperature as well as the flow direction. */
7786 su2double P_Total = config->GetRiemann_Var1(Marker_Tag);
7787 su2double T_Total = config->GetRiemann_Var2(Marker_Tag);
7788 auto Flow_Dir = config->GetRiemann_FlowDir(Marker_Tag);
7789
7790 P_Total /= config->GetPressure_Ref();
7791 T_Total /= config->GetTemperature_Ref();
7792
7793 /* Compute the total enthalpy and entropy from these values. */
7794 FluidModel->SetTDState_PT(P_Total, T_Total);
7795
7796 const su2double Enthalpy_e = FluidModel->GetStaticEnergy()
7797 + FluidModel->GetPressure()/FluidModel->GetDensity();
7798 const su2double Entropy_e = FluidModel->GetEntropy();
7799
7800 /* Loop over the faces that are treated simultaneously. */
7801 for(unsigned short l=0; l<nFaceSimul; ++l) {
7802 const unsigned short llNVar = l*nVar;
7803
7804 /* Loop over the integration points of the face. */
7805 for(unsigned short i=0; i<nInt; ++i) {
7806
7807 /* Easier storage of the left and right solution
7808 for this integration point. */
7809 const su2double *UL = solIntL + i*NPad + llNVar;
7810 su2double *UR = solIntR + i*NPad + llNVar;
7811
7812 /* Compute the velocity squared of the left point. This value is
7813 extrapolated and is therefore also the velocity of the right point. */
7814 const su2double DensityInv = 1.0/UL[0];
7815 su2double Velocity2_e = 0.0;
7816 for(unsigned short iDim=1; iDim<=nDim; ++iDim) {
7817 const su2double vel = UL[iDim]*DensityInv;
7818 Velocity2_e += vel*vel;
7819 }
7820
7821 /* Determine the static enthalpy, the density and the internal
7822 and total energy per unit mass for the right state. */
7823 const su2double StaticEnthalpy_e = Enthalpy_e - 0.5*Velocity2_e;
7824
7825 FluidModel->SetTDState_hs(StaticEnthalpy_e, Entropy_e);
7826 const su2double Density_e = FluidModel->GetDensity();
7827 const su2double StaticEnergy_e = FluidModel->GetStaticEnergy();
7828 const su2double Energy_e = StaticEnergy_e + 0.5*Velocity2_e;
7829
7830 /* Set the conservative variables of the right state. */
7831 UR[0] = Density_e;
7832 UR[nDim+1] = Density_e*Energy_e;
7833
7834 const su2double momTot = Density_e*sqrt(Velocity2_e);
7835 for(unsigned short iDim=0; iDim<nDim; ++iDim)
7836 UR[iDim+1] = momTot*Flow_Dir[iDim];
7837 }
7838 }
7839
7840 break;
7841 }
7842
7843 case STATIC_SUPERSONIC_INFLOW_PT: {
7844
7845 /* Supersonic inlet with specified pressure, temperature and Mach
7846 number. Retrieve the non-dimensional static pressure and
7847 temperature as well as the three components of the Mach number. */
7848 su2double P_static = config->GetRiemann_Var1(Marker_Tag);
7849 su2double T_static = config->GetRiemann_Var2(Marker_Tag);
7850 auto Mach = config->GetRiemann_FlowDir(Marker_Tag);
7851
7852 P_static /= config->GetPressure_Ref();
7853 T_static /= config->GetTemperature_Ref();
7854
7855 /* Compute the prescribed density, static energy per unit mass
7856 and speed of sound. */
7857 FluidModel->SetTDState_PT(P_static, T_static);
7858 const su2double Density_e = FluidModel->GetDensity();
7859 const su2double StaticEnergy_e = FluidModel->GetStaticEnergy();
7860 const su2double SoundSpeed = FluidModel->GetSoundSpeed();
7861
7862 /* Determine the magnitude of the Mach number. */
7863 su2double MachMag = 0.0;
7864 for(unsigned short iDim=0; iDim<nDim; ++iDim)
7865 MachMag += Mach[iDim]*Mach[iDim];
7866 MachMag = sqrt(MachMag);
7867
7868 /* Determine the magnitude of the velocity and the prescribed
7869 conservative variables. */
7870 const su2double VelMag = MachMag*SoundSpeed;
7871
7872 su2double UCons[5];
7873 UCons[0] = Density_e;
7874 UCons[nDim+1] = Density_e*(StaticEnergy_e + 0.5*VelMag*VelMag);
7875
7876 for(unsigned short iDim=0; iDim<nDim; ++iDim)
7877 UCons[iDim+1] = Density_e*Mach[iDim]*SoundSpeed;
7878
7879 /* Loop over the number of faces that are treated simultaneously. */
7880 for(unsigned short l=0; l<nFaceSimul; ++l) {
7881 const unsigned short llNVar = l*nVar;
7882
7883 /* Loop over the integration points and set the right state. */
7884 for(unsigned short i=0; i<nInt; ++i) {
7885 su2double *UR = solIntR + i*NPad + llNVar;
7886 for(unsigned short mm=0; mm<nVar; ++mm)
7887 UR[mm] = UCons[mm];
7888 }
7889 }
7890
7891 break;
7892 }
7893
7894 case STATIC_SUPERSONIC_INFLOW_PD: {
7895
7896 /* Supersonic inlet with specified pressure, temperature and Mach
7897 number. Retrieve the non-dimensional static pressure and
7898 temperature as well as the three components of the Mach number. */
7899 su2double P_static = config->GetRiemann_Var1(Marker_Tag);
7900 su2double Rho_static = config->GetRiemann_Var2(Marker_Tag);
7901 auto Mach = config->GetRiemann_FlowDir(Marker_Tag);
7902
7903 P_static /= config->GetPressure_Ref();
7904 Rho_static /= config->GetDensity_Ref();
7905
7906 /* Compute the prescribed pressure, static energy per unit mass
7907 and speed of sound. */
7908 FluidModel->SetTDState_Prho(P_static, Rho_static);
7909 const su2double Density_e = FluidModel->GetDensity();
7910 const su2double StaticEnergy_e = FluidModel->GetStaticEnergy();
7911 const su2double SoundSpeed = FluidModel->GetSoundSpeed();
7912
7913 /* Determine the magnitude of the Mach number. */
7914 su2double MachMag = 0.0;
7915 for(unsigned short iDim=0; iDim<nDim; ++iDim)
7916 MachMag += Mach[iDim]*Mach[iDim];
7917 MachMag = sqrt(MachMag);
7918
7919 /* Determine the magnitude of the velocity and the prescribed
7920 conservative variables. */
7921 const su2double VelMag = MachMag*SoundSpeed;
7922
7923 su2double UCons[5];
7924 UCons[0] = Density_e;
7925 UCons[nDim+1] = Density_e*(StaticEnergy_e + 0.5*VelMag*VelMag);
7926
7927 for(unsigned short iDim=0; iDim<nDim; ++iDim)
7928 UCons[iDim+1] = Density_e*Mach[iDim]*SoundSpeed;
7929
7930 /* Loop over the number of faces that are treated simultaneously. */
7931 for(unsigned short l=0; l<nFaceSimul; ++l) {
7932 const unsigned short llNVar = l*nVar;
7933
7934 /* Loop over the integration points and set the right state. */
7935 for(unsigned short i=0; i<nInt; ++i) {
7936 su2double *UR = solIntR + i*NPad + llNVar;
7937 for(unsigned short mm=0; mm<nVar; ++mm)
7938 UR[mm] = UCons[mm];
7939 }
7940 }
7941
7942 break;
7943 }
7944
7945 case DENSITY_VELOCITY: {
7946
7947 /* Subsonic inlet with specified density, velocity magnitude and
7948 flow direction. Retrieve the non-dimensional data. */
7949 su2double Density_e = config->GetRiemann_Var1(Marker_Tag);
7950 su2double VelMag_e = config->GetRiemann_Var2(Marker_Tag);
7951 auto Flow_Dir = config->GetRiemann_FlowDir(Marker_Tag);
7952
7953 Density_e /= config->GetDensity_Ref();
7954 VelMag_e /= config->GetVelocity_Ref();
7955
7956 /* Loop over the faces that are treated simultaneously. */
7957 for(unsigned short l=0; l<nFaceSimul; ++l) {
7958 const unsigned short llNVar = l*nVar;
7959
7960 /* Loop over the integration points of the face. */
7961 for(unsigned short i=0; i<nInt; ++i) {
7962
7963 /* Easier storage of the left and right solution
7964 for this integration point. */
7965 const su2double *UL = solIntL + i*NPad + llNVar;
7966 su2double *UR = solIntR + i*NPad + llNVar;
7967
7968 /* Compute the total energy per unit mass, which is extrapolated. */
7969 const su2double Energy_e = UL[nDim+1]/UL[0];
7970
7971 /* Set the conservative variables of the right state. */
7972 UR[0] = Density_e;
7973 UR[nDim+1] = Density_e*Energy_e;
7974
7975 const su2double momTot = Density_e*VelMag_e;
7976 for(unsigned short iDim=0; iDim<nDim; ++iDim)
7977 UR[iDim+1] = momTot*Flow_Dir[iDim];
7978 }
7979 }
7980
7981 break;
7982 }
7983
7984 case STATIC_PRESSURE: {
7985
7986 /* Subsonic outlet with specified pressure.
7987 Retrieve the non-dimensional data. */
7988 const su2double Pressure_e = config->GetRiemann_Var1(Marker_Tag)
7989 / config->GetPressure_Ref();
7990
7991 /* Loop over the faces that are treated simultaneously. */
7992 for(unsigned short l=0; l<nFaceSimul; ++l) {
7993 const unsigned short llNVar = l*nVar;
7994
7995 /* Loop over the integration points of the face. */
7996 for(unsigned short i=0; i<nInt; ++i) {
7997
7998 /* Easier storage of the left and right solution
7999 for this integration point. */
8000 const su2double *UL = solIntL + i*NPad + llNVar;
8001 su2double *UR = solIntR + i*NPad + llNVar;
8002
8003 /* Extrapolate the density and set the thermodynamic state. */
8004 UR[0] = UL[0];
8005 FluidModel->SetTDState_Prho(Pressure_e, UR[0]);
8006
8007 /* Extrapolate the velocity. As the density is also extrapolated,
8008 this means that the momentum variables are identical for UL and UR.
8009 Also determine the velocity squared. */
8010 const su2double DensityInv = 1.0/UL[0];
8011 su2double Velocity2_e = 0.0;
8012 for(unsigned short iDim=1; iDim<=nDim; ++iDim) {
8013 UR[iDim] = UL[iDim];
8014
8015 const su2double vel = UL[iDim]*DensityInv;
8016 Velocity2_e += vel*vel;
8017 }
8018
8019 /* Compute the total energy per unit volume. */
8020 UR[nDim+1] = UR[0]*(FluidModel->GetStaticEnergy() + 0.5*Velocity2_e);
8021 }
8022 }
8023
8024 break;
8025 }
8026
8027 default: {
8028 SU2_MPI::Error("Invalid Riemann input!", CURRENT_FUNCTION);
8029 }
8030 }
8031
8032 /***************************************************************************/
8033 /* Correction of the boundary state using a characteristic reconstruction. */
8034 /***************************************************************************/
8035
8036 /* Make a distinction between 2D and 3D. */
8037 switch( nDim ) {
8038 case 2: {
8039
8040 /* Two-dimensional simulation.
8041 Loop over the faces that are treated simultaneously. */
8042 for(unsigned short l=0; l<nFaceSimul; ++l) {
8043 const unsigned short llNVar = l*nVar;
8044
8045 /* Loop over the integration points of the face. */
8046 for(unsigned short i=0; i<nInt; ++i) {
8047
8048 /* Easier storage of the left and right solution and the normals
8049 for this integration point. */
8050 const su2double *UL = solIntL + i*NPad + llNVar;
8051 su2double *UR = solIntR + i*NPad + llNVar;
8052 const su2double *normals = surfElem[l].metricNormalsFace.data() + i*(nDim+1);
8053
8054 /* Compute the difference in conservative variables. */
8055 const su2double dr = UR[0] - UL[0];
8056 const su2double dru = UR[1] - UL[1];
8057 const su2double drv = UR[2] - UL[2];
8058 const su2double drE = UR[3] - UL[3];
8059
8060 /* Compute the primitive variables of the left state. */
8061 const su2double tmp = 1.0/UL[0];
8062 const su2double vxL = tmp*UL[1];
8063 const su2double vyL = tmp*UL[2];
8064 const su2double alphaL = 0.5*(vxL*vxL + vyL*vyL);
8065 const su2double eL = tmp*UL[3] - alphaL;
8066
8067 const su2double nx = normals[0];
8068 const su2double ny = normals[1];
8069 const su2double vnL = vxL*nx + vyL*ny;
8070
8071 FluidModel->SetTDState_rhoe(UL[0], eL);
8072
8073 const su2double aL = FluidModel->GetSoundSpeed();
8074 const su2double a2L = aL*aL;
8075 const su2double pL = FluidModel->GetPressure();
8076 const su2double HL = (UL[3] + pL)*tmp;
8077
8078 const su2double ovaL = 1.0/aL;
8079 const su2double ova2L = 1.0/a2L;
8080
8081 /* Compute the eigenvalues. */
8082 su2double lam1 = vnL + aL;
8083 su2double lam2 = vnL - aL;
8084 su2double lam3 = vnL;
8085
8086 /* For the characteristic reconstruction, only the outgoing
8087 characteristics (negative eigenvalues) must be taken into account.
8088 Set the eigenvalues accordingly. */
8089 lam1 = (lam1 < 0.0) ? 1.0 : 0.0;
8090 lam2 = (lam2 < 0.0) ? 1.0 : 0.0;
8091 lam3 = (lam3 < 0.0) ? 1.0 : 0.0;
8092
8093 /* Some abbreviations, which occur quite often in the reconstruction. */
8094 const su2double abv1 = 0.5*(lam1 + lam2);
8095 const su2double abv2 = 0.5*(lam1 - lam2);
8096 const su2double abv3 = abv1 - lam3;
8097
8098 const su2double abv4 = Gamma_Minus_One*(alphaL*dr - vxL*dru - vyL*drv + drE);
8099 const su2double abv5 = nx*dru + ny*drv - vnL*dr;
8100 const su2double abv6 = abv3*abv4*ova2L + abv2*abv5*ovaL;
8101 const su2double abv7 = abv2*abv4*ovaL + abv3*abv5;
8102
8103 /* Compute the right state. */
8104 UR[0] = UL[0] + lam3*dr + abv6;
8105 UR[1] = UL[1] + lam3*dru + vxL*abv6 + nx*abv7;
8106 UR[2] = UL[2] + lam3*drv + vyL*abv6 + ny*abv7;
8107 UR[3] = UL[3] + lam3*drE + HL*abv6 + vnL*abv7;
8108 }
8109 }
8110
8111 break;
8112 }
8113
8114 case 3: {
8115
8116 /* Three-dimensional simulation.
8117 Loop over the faces that are treated simultaneously. */
8118 for(unsigned short l=0; l<nFaceSimul; ++l) {
8119 const unsigned short llNVar = l*nVar;
8120
8121 /* Loop over the integration points of the face. */
8122 for(unsigned short i=0; i<nInt; ++i) {
8123
8124 /* Easier storage of the left and right solution and the normals
8125 for this integration point. */
8126 const su2double *UL = solIntL + i*NPad + llNVar;
8127 su2double *UR = solIntR + i*NPad + llNVar;
8128 const su2double *normals = surfElem[l].metricNormalsFace.data() + i*(nDim+1);
8129
8130 /* Compute the difference in conservative variables. */
8131 const su2double dr = UR[0] - UL[0];
8132 const su2double dru = UR[1] - UL[1];
8133 const su2double drv = UR[2] - UL[2];
8134 const su2double drw = UR[3] - UL[3];
8135 const su2double drE = UR[4] - UL[4];
8136
8137 /* Compute the primitive variables of the left state. */
8138 const su2double tmp = 1.0/UL[0];
8139 const su2double vxL = tmp*UL[1];
8140 const su2double vyL = tmp*UL[2];
8141 const su2double vzL = tmp*UL[3];
8142 const su2double alphaL = 0.5*(vxL*vxL + vyL*vyL + vzL*vzL);
8143 const su2double eL = tmp*UL[4] - alphaL;
8144
8145 const su2double nx = normals[0];
8146 const su2double ny = normals[1];
8147 const su2double nz = normals[2];
8148 const su2double vnL = vxL*nx + vyL*ny + vzL*nz;
8149
8150 FluidModel->SetTDState_rhoe(UL[0], eL);
8151
8152 const su2double aL = FluidModel->GetSoundSpeed();
8153 const su2double a2L = aL*aL;
8154 const su2double pL = FluidModel->GetPressure();
8155 const su2double HL = (UL[4] + pL)*tmp;
8156
8157 const su2double ovaL = 1.0/aL;
8158 const su2double ova2L = 1.0/a2L;
8159
8160 /* Compute the eigenvalues. */
8161 su2double lam1 = vnL + aL;
8162 su2double lam2 = vnL - aL;
8163 su2double lam3 = vnL;
8164
8165 /* For the characteristic reconstruction, only the outgoing
8166 characteristics (negative eigenvalues) must be taken into account.
8167 Set the eigenvalues accordingly. */
8168 lam1 = (lam1 < 0.0) ? 1.0 : 0.0;
8169 lam2 = (lam2 < 0.0) ? 1.0 : 0.0;
8170 lam3 = (lam3 < 0.0) ? 1.0 : 0.0;
8171
8172 /* Some abbreviations, which occur quite often in the reconstruction. */
8173 const su2double abv1 = 0.5*(lam1 + lam2);
8174 const su2double abv2 = 0.5*(lam1 - lam2);
8175 const su2double abv3 = abv1 - lam3;
8176
8177 const su2double abv4 = Gamma_Minus_One*(alphaL*dr - vxL*dru - vyL*drv - vzL*drw + drE);
8178 const su2double abv5 = nx*dru + ny*drv + nz*drw - vnL*dr;
8179 const su2double abv6 = abv3*abv4*ova2L + abv2*abv5*ovaL;
8180 const su2double abv7 = abv2*abv4*ovaL + abv3*abv5;
8181
8182 /* Compute the right state. */
8183 UR[0] = UL[0] + lam3*dr + abv6;
8184 UR[1] = UL[1] + lam3*dru + vxL*abv6 + nx*abv7;
8185 UR[2] = UL[2] + lam3*drv + vyL*abv6 + ny*abv7;
8186 UR[3] = UL[3] + lam3*drw + vzL*abv6 + nz*abv7;
8187 UR[4] = UL[4] + lam3*drE + HL*abv6 + vnL*abv7;
8188 }
8189 }
8190
8191 break;
8192 }
8193 }
8194}
8195
8196void CFEM_DG_EulerSolver::BC_Euler_Wall(CConfig *config,
8197 const unsigned long surfElemBeg,
8198 const unsigned long surfElemEnd,
8199 const CSurfaceElementFEM *surfElem,
8200 su2double *resFaces,
8201 CNumerics *conv_numerics,
8202 su2double *workArray) {
8203
8204 /* Initialization of the counter in resFaces. */
8205 unsigned long indResFaces = 0;
8206
8207 /* Determine the number of faces that are treated simultaneously
8208 in the matrix products to obtain good gemm performance. */
8209 const unsigned short nPadInput = config->GetSizeMatMulPadding();
8210 const unsigned short nFaceSimul = nPadInput/nVar;
8211
8212 /* Determine the minimum padded size in the matrix multiplications, which
8213 corresponds to 64 byte alignment. */
8214 const unsigned short nPadMin = 64/sizeof(passivedouble);
8215
8216 /*--- Loop over the requested range of surface faces. Multiple faces
8217 are treated simultaneously to improve the performance of the matrix
8218 multiplications. As a consequence, the update of the counter l
8219 happens at the end of this loop section. ---*/
8220 for(unsigned long l=surfElemBeg; l<surfElemEnd;) {
8221
8222 /* Determine the end index for this chunk of faces and the padded
8223 N value in the gemm computations. */
8224 unsigned long lEnd;
8225 unsigned short ind, llEnd, NPad;
8226
8227 MetaDataChunkOfElem(surfElem, l, surfElemEnd, nFaceSimul,
8228 nPadMin, lEnd, ind, llEnd, NPad);
8229
8230 /* Get the necessary data from the standard face. */
8231 const unsigned short nInt = standardBoundaryFacesSol[ind].GetNIntegration();
8232
8233 /*--- Set the pointers for the local arrays. ---*/
8234 su2double *solIntL = workArray;
8235 su2double *solIntR = solIntL + NPad*nInt;
8236 su2double *work = solIntR + NPad*nInt;
8237
8238 /* Compute the left states in the integration points of the chunk of
8239 faces. The array work is used as temporary storage inside the
8240 function LeftStatesIntegrationPointsBoundaryFace. */
8241 LeftStatesIntegrationPointsBoundaryFace(config, llEnd, NPad, &surfElem[l],
8242 work, solIntL);
8243
8244 /* Compute the right state by applying the inviscid wall BC's. */
8245 BoundaryStates_Euler_Wall(config, llEnd, NPad, &surfElem[l],
8246 solIntL, solIntR);
8247
8248 /* The remainder of the contribution of ths boundary faces to the residual
8249 is the same for all boundary conditions. Hence a generic function can
8250 be used to carry out this task. */
8251 ResidualInviscidBoundaryFace(config, llEnd, NPad, conv_numerics, &surfElem[l],
8252 solIntL, solIntR, work, resFaces, indResFaces);
8253
8254 /* Update the value of the counter l to the end index of the
8255 current chunk. */
8256 l = lEnd;
8257 }
8258}
8259
8260void CFEM_DG_EulerSolver::BC_Far_Field(CConfig *config,
8261 const unsigned long surfElemBeg,
8262 const unsigned long surfElemEnd,
8263 const CSurfaceElementFEM *surfElem,
8264 su2double *resFaces,
8265 CNumerics *conv_numerics,
8266 su2double *workArray) {
8267
8268 /* Initialization of the counter in resFaces. */
8269 unsigned long indResFaces = 0;
8270
8271 /* Determine the number of faces that are treated simultaneously
8272 in the matrix products to obtain good gemm performance. */
8273 const unsigned short nPadInput = config->GetSizeMatMulPadding();
8274 const unsigned short nFaceSimul = nPadInput/nVar;
8275
8276 /* Determine the minimum padded size in the matrix multiplications, which
8277 corresponds to 64 byte alignment. */
8278 const unsigned short nPadMin = 64/sizeof(passivedouble);
8279
8280 /*--- Loop over the requested range of surface faces. Multiple faces
8281 are treated simultaneously to improve the performance of the matrix
8282 multiplications. As a consequence, the update of the counter l
8283 happens at the end of this loop section. ---*/
8284 for(unsigned long l=surfElemBeg; l<surfElemEnd;) {
8285
8286 /* Determine the end index for this chunk of faces and the padded
8287 N value in the gemm computations. */
8288 unsigned long lEnd;
8289 unsigned short ind, llEnd, NPad;
8290
8291 MetaDataChunkOfElem(surfElem, l, surfElemEnd, nFaceSimul,
8292 nPadMin, lEnd, ind, llEnd, NPad);
8293
8294 /* Get the necessary data from the standard face. */
8295 const unsigned short nInt = standardBoundaryFacesSol[ind].GetNIntegration();
8296
8297 /*--- Set the pointers for the local arrays. ---*/
8298 su2double *solIntL = workArray;
8299 su2double *solIntR = solIntL + NPad*nInt;
8300 su2double *work = solIntR + NPad*nInt;
8301
8302 /* Compute the left states in the integration points of the chunk of
8303 faces. The array work is used as temporary storage inside the
8304 function LeftStatesIntegrationPointsBoundaryFace. */
8305 LeftStatesIntegrationPointsBoundaryFace(config, llEnd, NPad, &surfElem[l],
8306 work, solIntL);
8307
8308 /* Set the right state in the integration points to the free stream value. */
8309 for(unsigned short ll=0; ll<llEnd; ++ll) {
8310 const unsigned short llNVar = ll*nVar;
8311 for(unsigned short i=0; i<nInt; ++i) {
8312 su2double *UR = solIntR + i*NPad + llNVar;
8313 for(unsigned short j=0; j<nVar; ++j)
8314 UR[j] = ConsVarFreeStream[j];
8315 }
8316 }
8317
8318 /* The remainder of the contribution of this boundary face to the residual
8319 is the same for all boundary conditions. Hence a generic function can
8320 be used to carry out this task. */
8321 ResidualInviscidBoundaryFace(config, llEnd, NPad, conv_numerics, &surfElem[l],
8322 solIntL, solIntR, work, resFaces, indResFaces);
8323
8324 /* Update the value of the counter l to the end index of the
8325 current chunk. */
8326 l = lEnd;
8327 }
8328}
8329
8330void CFEM_DG_EulerSolver::BC_Sym_Plane(CConfig *config,
8331 const unsigned long surfElemBeg,
8332 const unsigned long surfElemEnd,
8333 const CSurfaceElementFEM *surfElem,
8334 su2double *resFaces,
8335 CNumerics *conv_numerics,
8336 su2double *workArray) {
8337
8338 /* Initialization of the counter in resFaces. */
8339 unsigned long indResFaces = 0;
8340
8341 /* Determine the number of faces that are treated simultaneously
8342 in the matrix products to obtain good gemm performance. */
8343 const unsigned short nPadInput = config->GetSizeMatMulPadding();
8344 const unsigned short nFaceSimul = nPadInput/nVar;
8345
8346 /* Determine the minimum padded size in the matrix multiplications, which
8347 corresponds to 64 byte alignment. */
8348 const unsigned short nPadMin = 64/sizeof(passivedouble);
8349
8350 /*--- Loop over the requested range of surface faces. Multiple faces
8351 are treated simultaneously to improve the performance of the matrix
8352 multiplications. As a consequence, the update of the counter l
8353 happens at the end of this loop section. ---*/
8354 for(unsigned long l=surfElemBeg; l<surfElemEnd;) {
8355
8356 /* Determine the end index for this chunk of faces and the padded
8357 N value in the gemm computations. */
8358 unsigned long lEnd;
8359 unsigned short ind, llEnd, NPad;
8360
8361 MetaDataChunkOfElem(surfElem, l, surfElemEnd, nFaceSimul,
8362 nPadMin, lEnd, ind, llEnd, NPad);
8363
8364 /* Get the necessary data from the standard face. */
8365 const unsigned short nInt = standardBoundaryFacesSol[ind].GetNIntegration();
8366
8367 /*--- Set the pointers for the local arrays. ---*/
8368 su2double *solIntL = workArray;
8369 su2double *solIntR = solIntL + NPad*nInt;
8370 su2double *work = solIntR + NPad*nInt;
8371
8372 /* Compute the left states in the integration points of the chunk of
8373 faces. The array work is used as temporary storage inside the
8374 function LeftStatesIntegrationPointsBoundaryFace. */
8375 LeftStatesIntegrationPointsBoundaryFace(config, llEnd, NPad, &surfElem[l],
8376 work, solIntL);
8377
8378 /* Make a distinction between two and three space dimensions
8379 in order to have the most efficient code. */
8380 switch( nDim ) {
8381
8382 case 2: {
8383
8384 /* 2D simulation. Loop over the faces that are treated simultaneously
8385 and the integration points to apply the symmetry condition. */
8386 for(unsigned short ll=0; ll<llEnd; ++ll) {
8387 const unsigned short llNVar = ll*nVar;
8388 for(unsigned short i=0; i<nInt; ++i) {
8389
8390 /* Easier storage of the left and right solution and the normals
8391 for this integration point. */
8392 const su2double *UL = solIntL + NPad*i + llNVar;
8393 su2double *UR = solIntR + NPad*i + llNVar;
8394 const su2double *normals = surfElem[ll+l].metricNormalsFace.data() + i*(nDim+1);
8395
8396 /* Compute twice the normal component of the momentum variables. The
8397 factor 2 comes from the fact that the velocity must be mirrored. */
8398 const su2double rVn = 2.0*(UL[1]*normals[0] + UL[2]*normals[1]);
8399
8400 /* Set the right state. Note that the total energy of the right state is
8401 identical to the left state, because the magnitude of the velocity
8402 remains the same. */
8403 UR[0] = UL[0];
8404 UR[1] = UL[1] - rVn*normals[0];
8405 UR[2] = UL[2] - rVn*normals[1];
8406 UR[3] = UL[3];
8407 }
8408 }
8409
8410 break;
8411 }
8412
8413 /*----------------------------------------------------------------------*/
8414
8415 case 3: {
8416
8417 /* 3D simulation. Loop over the faces that are treated simultaneously
8418 and the integration points to apply the symmetry condition. */
8419 for(unsigned short ll=0; ll<llEnd; ++ll) {
8420 const unsigned short llNVar = ll*nVar;
8421 for(unsigned short i=0; i<nInt; ++i) {
8422
8423 /* Easier storage of the left and right solution and the normals
8424 for this integration point. */
8425 const su2double *UL = solIntL + NPad*i + llNVar;
8426 su2double *UR = solIntR + NPad*i + llNVar;
8427 const su2double *normals = surfElem[ll+l].metricNormalsFace.data() + i*(nDim+1);
8428
8429 /* Compute twice the normal component of the momentum variables. The
8430 factor 2 comes from the fact that the velocity must be mirrored. */
8431 const su2double rVn = 2.0*(UL[1]*normals[0] + UL[2]*normals[1] + UL[3]*normals[2]);
8432
8433 /* Set the right state. Note that the total energy of the right state is
8434 identical to the left state, because the magnitude of the velocity
8435 remains the same. */
8436 UR[0] = UL[0];
8437 UR[1] = UL[1] - rVn*normals[0];
8438 UR[2] = UL[2] - rVn*normals[1];
8439 UR[3] = UL[3] - rVn*normals[2];
8440 UR[4] = UL[4];
8441 }
8442 }
8443
8444 break;
8445 }
8446 }
8447
8448 /* The remainder of the contribution of this boundary face to the residual
8449 is the same for all boundary conditions. Hence a generic function can
8450 be used to carry out this task. */
8451 ResidualInviscidBoundaryFace(config, llEnd, NPad, conv_numerics, &surfElem[l],
8452 solIntL, solIntR, work, resFaces, indResFaces);
8453
8454 /* Update the value of the counter l to the end index of the
8455 current chunk. */
8456 l = lEnd;
8457 }
8458}
8459
8460void CFEM_DG_EulerSolver::BC_Supersonic_Outlet(CConfig *config,
8461 const unsigned long surfElemBeg,
8462 const unsigned long surfElemEnd,
8463 const CSurfaceElementFEM *surfElem,
8464 su2double *resFaces,
8465 CNumerics *conv_numerics,
8466 su2double *workArray) {
8467
8468 /* Initialization of the counter in resFaces. */
8469 unsigned long indResFaces = 0;
8470
8471 /* Determine the number of faces that are treated simultaneously
8472 in the matrix products to obtain good gemm performance. */
8473 const unsigned short nPadInput = config->GetSizeMatMulPadding();
8474 const unsigned short nFaceSimul = nPadInput/nVar;
8475
8476 /* Determine the minimum padded size in the matrix multiplications, which
8477 corresponds to 64 byte alignment. */
8478 const unsigned short nPadMin = 64/sizeof(passivedouble);
8479
8480 /*--- Loop over the requested range of surface faces. Multiple faces
8481 are treated simultaneously to improve the performance of the matrix
8482 multiplications. As a consequence, the update of the counter l
8483 happens at the end of this loop section. ---*/
8484 for(unsigned long l=surfElemBeg; l<surfElemEnd;) {
8485
8486 /* Determine the end index for this chunk of faces and the padded
8487 N value in the gemm computations. */
8488 unsigned long lEnd;
8489 unsigned short ind, llEnd, NPad;
8490
8491 MetaDataChunkOfElem(surfElem, l, surfElemEnd, nFaceSimul,
8492 nPadMin, lEnd, ind, llEnd, NPad);
8493
8494 /* Get the necessary data from the standard face. */
8495 const unsigned short nInt = standardBoundaryFacesSol[ind].GetNIntegration();
8496
8497 /*--- Set the pointers for the local arrays. ---*/
8498 su2double *solIntL = workArray;
8499 su2double *solIntR = solIntL + NPad*nInt;
8500 su2double *work = solIntR + NPad*nInt;
8501
8502 /* Compute the left states in the integration points of the chunk of
8503 faces. The array work is used as temporary storage inside the
8504 function LeftStatesIntegrationPointsBoundaryFace. */
8505 LeftStatesIntegrationPointsBoundaryFace(config, llEnd, NPad, &surfElem[l],
8506 work, solIntL);
8507
8508 /* Set the right state in the integration points to the left state, i.e.
8509 no boundary condition is applied for a supersonic outlet. */
8510 for(unsigned short mm=0; mm<NPad*nInt; ++mm)
8511 solIntR[mm] = solIntL[mm];
8512
8513 /* The remainder of the contribution of this boundary face to the residual
8514 is the same for all boundary conditions. Hence a generic function can
8515 be used to carry out this task. */
8516 ResidualInviscidBoundaryFace(config, llEnd, NPad, conv_numerics, &surfElem[l],
8517 solIntL, solIntR, work, resFaces, indResFaces);
8518
8519 /* Update the value of the counter l to the end index of the
8520 current chunk. */
8521 l = lEnd;
8522 }
8523}
8524
8525void CFEM_DG_EulerSolver::BC_Inlet(CConfig *config,
8526 const unsigned long surfElemBeg,
8527 const unsigned long surfElemEnd,
8528 const CSurfaceElementFEM *surfElem,
8529 su2double *resFaces,
8530 CNumerics *conv_numerics,
8531 unsigned short val_marker,
8532 su2double *workArray) {
8533
8534 /* Initialization of the counter in resFaces. */
8535 unsigned long indResFaces = 0;
8536
8537 /* Determine the number of faces that are treated simultaneously
8538 in the matrix products to obtain good gemm performance. */
8539 const unsigned short nPadInput = config->GetSizeMatMulPadding();
8540 const unsigned short nFaceSimul = nPadInput/nVar;
8541
8542 /* Determine the minimum padded size in the matrix multiplications, which
8543 corresponds to 64 byte alignment. */
8544 const unsigned short nPadMin = 64/sizeof(passivedouble);
8545
8546 /*--- Loop over the requested range of surface faces. Multiple faces
8547 are treated simultaneously to improve the performance of the matrix
8548 multiplications. As a consequence, the update of the counter l
8549 happens at the end of this loop section. ---*/
8550 for(unsigned long l=surfElemBeg; l<surfElemEnd;) {
8551
8552 /* Determine the end index for this chunk of faces and the padded
8553 N value in the gemm computations. */
8554 unsigned long lEnd;
8555 unsigned short ind, llEnd, NPad;
8556
8557 MetaDataChunkOfElem(surfElem, l, surfElemEnd, nFaceSimul,
8558 nPadMin, lEnd, ind, llEnd, NPad);
8559
8560 /* Get the necessary data from the standard face. */
8561 const unsigned short nInt = standardBoundaryFacesSol[ind].GetNIntegration();
8562
8563 /*--- Set the pointers for the local arrays. ---*/
8564 su2double *solIntL = workArray;
8565 su2double *solIntR = solIntL + NPad*nInt;
8566 su2double *work = solIntR + NPad*nInt;
8567
8568 /* Compute the left states in the integration points of the chunk of
8569 faces. The array work is used as temporary storage inside the
8570 function LeftStatesIntegrationPointsBoundaryFace. */
8571 LeftStatesIntegrationPointsBoundaryFace(config, llEnd, NPad, &surfElem[l],
8572 work, solIntL);
8573
8574 /* Compute the right state by applying the subsonic inlet BC's. */
8575 BoundaryStates_Inlet(config, llEnd, NPad, &surfElem[l], val_marker, solIntL, solIntR);
8576
8577 /* The remainder of the contribution of this boundary face to the residual
8578 is the same for all boundary conditions. Hence a generic function can
8579 be used to carry out this task. */
8580 ResidualInviscidBoundaryFace(config, llEnd, NPad, conv_numerics, &surfElem[l],
8581 solIntL, solIntR, work, resFaces, indResFaces);
8582
8583 /* Update the value of the counter l to the end index of the
8584 current chunk. */
8585 l = lEnd;
8586 }
8587}
8588
8589void CFEM_DG_EulerSolver::BC_Outlet(CConfig *config,
8590 const unsigned long surfElemBeg,
8591 const unsigned long surfElemEnd,
8592 const CSurfaceElementFEM *surfElem,
8593 su2double *resFaces,
8594 CNumerics *conv_numerics,
8595 unsigned short val_marker,
8596 su2double *workArray) {
8597
8598 /* Initialization of the counter in resFaces. */
8599 unsigned long indResFaces = 0;
8600
8601 /* Determine the number of faces that are treated simultaneously
8602 in the matrix products to obtain good gemm performance. */
8603 const unsigned short nPadInput = config->GetSizeMatMulPadding();
8604 const unsigned short nFaceSimul = nPadInput/nVar;
8605
8606 /* Determine the minimum padded size in the matrix multiplications, which
8607 corresponds to 64 byte alignment. */
8608 const unsigned short nPadMin = 64/sizeof(passivedouble);
8609
8610 /*--- Loop over the requested range of surface faces. Multiple faces
8611 are treated simultaneously to improve the performance of the matrix
8612 multiplications. As a consequence, the update of the counter l
8613 happens at the end of this loop section. ---*/
8614 for(unsigned long l=surfElemBeg; l<surfElemEnd;) {
8615
8616 /* Determine the end index for this chunk of faces and the padded
8617 N value in the gemm computations. */
8618 unsigned long lEnd;
8619 unsigned short ind, llEnd, NPad;
8620
8621 MetaDataChunkOfElem(surfElem, l, surfElemEnd, nFaceSimul,
8622 nPadMin, lEnd, ind, llEnd, NPad);
8623
8624 /* Get the necessary data from the standard face. */
8625 const unsigned short nInt = standardBoundaryFacesSol[ind].GetNIntegration();
8626
8627 /*--- Set the pointers for the local arrays. ---*/
8628 su2double *solIntL = workArray;
8629 su2double *solIntR = solIntL + NPad*nInt;
8630 su2double *work = solIntR + NPad*nInt;
8631
8632 /* Compute the left states in the integration points of the chunk of
8633 faces. The array work is used as temporary storage inside the
8634 function LeftStatesIntegrationPointsBoundaryFace. */
8635 LeftStatesIntegrationPointsBoundaryFace(config, llEnd, NPad, &surfElem[l],
8636 work, solIntL);
8637
8638 /* Compute the right state by applying the subsonic inlet BC's. */
8639 BoundaryStates_Outlet(config, llEnd, NPad, &surfElem[l], val_marker, solIntL, solIntR);
8640
8641 /* The remainder of the contribution of this boundary face to the residual
8642 is the same for all boundary conditions. Hence a generic function can
8643 be used to carry out this task. */
8644 ResidualInviscidBoundaryFace(config, llEnd, NPad, conv_numerics, &surfElem[l],
8645 solIntL, solIntR, work, resFaces, indResFaces);
8646
8647 /* Update the value of the counter l to the end index of the
8648 current chunk. */
8649 l = lEnd;
8650 }
8651}
8652
8653void CFEM_DG_EulerSolver::BC_Riemann(CConfig *config,
8654 const unsigned long surfElemBeg,
8655 const unsigned long surfElemEnd,
8656 const CSurfaceElementFEM *surfElem,
8657 su2double *resFaces,
8658 CNumerics *conv_numerics,
8659 unsigned short val_marker,
8660 su2double *workArray) {
8661
8662 /* Initialization of the counter in resFaces. */
8663 unsigned long indResFaces = 0;
8664
8665 /* Determine the number of faces that are treated simultaneously
8666 in the matrix products to obtain good gemm performance. */
8667 const unsigned short nPadInput = config->GetSizeMatMulPadding();
8668 const unsigned short nFaceSimul = nPadInput/nVar;
8669
8670 /* Determine the minimum padded size in the matrix multiplications, which
8671 corresponds to 64 byte alignment. */
8672 const unsigned short nPadMin = 64/sizeof(passivedouble);
8673
8674 /*--- Loop over the requested range of surface faces. Multiple faces
8675 are treated simultaneously to improve the performance of the matrix
8676 multiplications. As a consequence, the update of the counter l
8677 happens at the end of this loop section. ---*/
8678 for(unsigned long l=surfElemBeg; l<surfElemEnd;) {
8679
8680 /* Determine the end index for this chunk of faces and the padded
8681 N value in the gemm computations. */
8682 unsigned long lEnd;
8683 unsigned short ind, llEnd, NPad;
8684
8685 MetaDataChunkOfElem(surfElem, l, surfElemEnd, nFaceSimul,
8686 nPadMin, lEnd, ind, llEnd, NPad);
8687
8688 /* Get the necessary data from the standard face. */
8689 const unsigned short nInt = standardBoundaryFacesSol[ind].GetNIntegration();
8690
8691 /*--- Set the pointers for the local arrays. ---*/
8692 su2double *solIntL = workArray;
8693 su2double *solIntR = solIntL + NPad*nInt;
8694 su2double *work = solIntR + NPad*nInt;
8695
8696 /* Compute the left states in the integration points of the chunk of
8697 faces. The array work is used as temporary storage inside the
8698 function LeftStatesIntegrationPointsBoundaryFace. */
8699 LeftStatesIntegrationPointsBoundaryFace(config, llEnd, NPad, &surfElem[l],
8700 work, solIntL);
8701
8702 /* Compute the right state by applying the subsonic inlet BC's. */
8703 BoundaryStates_Riemann(config, llEnd, NPad, &surfElem[l], val_marker, solIntL, solIntR);
8704
8705 /* The remainder of the contribution of this boundary face to the residual
8706 is the same for all boundary conditions. Hence a generic function can
8707 be used to carry out this task. */
8708 ResidualInviscidBoundaryFace(config, llEnd, NPad, conv_numerics, &surfElem[l],
8709 solIntL, solIntR, work, resFaces, indResFaces);
8710
8711 /* Update the value of the counter l to the end index of the
8712 current chunk. */
8713 l = lEnd;
8714 }
8715}
8716
8717void CFEM_DG_EulerSolver::BC_Custom(CConfig *config,
8718 const unsigned long surfElemBeg,
8719 const unsigned long surfElemEnd,
8720 const CSurfaceElementFEM *surfElem,
8721 su2double *resFaces,
8722 CNumerics *conv_numerics,
8723 su2double *workArray) {
8724
8725 /* Initialization of the counter in resFaces. */
8726 unsigned long indResFaces = 0;
8727
8728 /* Determine the number of faces that are treated simultaneously
8729 in the matrix products to obtain good gemm performance. */
8730 const unsigned short nPadInput = config->GetSizeMatMulPadding();
8731 const unsigned short nFaceSimul = nPadInput/nVar;
8732
8733 /* Determine the minimum padded size in the matrix multiplications, which
8734 corresponds to 64 byte alignment. */
8735 const unsigned short nPadMin = 64/sizeof(passivedouble);
8736
8737 /*--- Get the physical time if necessary. ---*/
8738 su2double time = 0.0;
8739 if (config->GetTime_Marching() != TIME_MARCHING::STEADY) time = config->GetPhysicalTime();
8740
8741 /*--- Loop over the requested range of surface faces. Multiple faces
8742 are treated simultaneously to improve the performance of the matrix
8743 multiplications. As a consequence, the update of the counter l
8744 happens at the end of this loop section. ---*/
8745 for(unsigned long l=surfElemBeg; l<surfElemEnd;) {
8746
8747 /* Determine the end index for this chunk of faces and the padded
8748 N value in the gemm computations. */
8749 unsigned long lEnd;
8750 unsigned short ind, llEnd, NPad;
8751
8752 MetaDataChunkOfElem(surfElem, l, surfElemEnd, nFaceSimul,
8753 nPadMin, lEnd, ind, llEnd, NPad);
8754
8755 /* Get the necessary data from the standard face. */
8756 const unsigned short nInt = standardBoundaryFacesSol[ind].GetNIntegration();
8757
8758 /*--- Set the pointers for the local arrays. ---*/
8759 su2double *solIntL = workArray;
8760 su2double *solIntR = solIntL + NPad*nInt;
8761 su2double *work = solIntR + NPad*nInt;
8762
8763 /* Compute the left states in the integration points of the chunk of
8764 faces. The array work is used as temporary storage inside the
8765 function LeftStatesIntegrationPointsBoundaryFace. */
8766 LeftStatesIntegrationPointsBoundaryFace(config, llEnd, NPad, &surfElem[l],
8767 work, solIntL);
8768
8769 /* Check for a verification solution. */
8770 if( VerificationSolution ) {
8771
8772 /*--- Loop over the number of simultaneously treated faces and integration points
8773 to compute the right state for the boundary conditions. ---*/
8774 for(unsigned short ll=0; ll<llEnd; ++ll) {
8775 for(unsigned short i=0; i<nInt; ++i) {
8776
8777 /* Determine the pointer to the coordinates of this integration
8778 point and the pointer to the solution and call the function
8779 GetBCState to determine the actual boundary state. */
8780 const su2double *coor = surfElem[ll+l].coorIntegrationPoints.data() + i*nDim;
8781 su2double *UR = solIntR + NPad*i + ll*nVar;
8782
8783 VerificationSolution->GetBCState(coor, time, UR);
8784 }
8785 }
8786 }
8787 else {
8788
8789 /* The user must specify the custom BC's here. */
8790 SU2_MPI::Error("Implement customized boundary conditions here.", CURRENT_FUNCTION);
8791 }
8792
8793 /* The remainder of the contribution of this boundary face to the residual
8794 is the same for all boundary conditions. Hence a generic function can
8795 be used to carry out this task. */
8796 ResidualInviscidBoundaryFace(config, llEnd, NPad, conv_numerics, &surfElem[l],
8797 solIntL, solIntR, work, resFaces, indResFaces);
8798
8799 /* Update the value of the counter l to the end index of the
8800 current chunk. */
8801 l = lEnd;
8802 }
8803}
8804
8805void CFEM_DG_EulerSolver::ResidualInviscidBoundaryFace(
8806 CConfig *config,
8807 const unsigned short nFaceSimul,
8808 const unsigned short NPad,
8809 CNumerics *conv_numerics,
8810 const CSurfaceElementFEM *surfElem,
8811 su2double *solInt0,
8812 su2double *solInt1,
8813 su2double *fluxes,
8814 su2double *resFaces,
8815 unsigned long &indResFaces) {
8816
8817 /*--- Get the required information from the standard face, which is the
8818 same for all faces considered. ---*/
8819 const unsigned short ind = surfElem[0].indStandardElement;
8820 const unsigned short nInt = standardBoundaryFacesSol[ind].GetNIntegration();
8821 const unsigned short nDOFs = standardBoundaryFacesSol[ind].GetNDOFsFace();
8822 const su2double *weights = standardBoundaryFacesSol[ind].GetWeightsIntegration();
8823
8824 /*------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
8825 /*--- Step 1: Compute the fluxes in the integration points using the ---*/
8826 /*--- approximate Riemann solver. ---*/
8827 /*------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
8828
8829 /* Store the normals and grid velocities of the faces in an array of
8830 pointers to be used in the call to ComputeInviscidFluxesFace. */
8831 const su2double* arrNorm[SIZE_ARR_NORM];
8832 const su2double* arrGridVel[SIZE_ARR_NORM];
8833
8834 if(nFaceSimul > SIZE_ARR_NORM)
8835 SU2_MPI::Error("SIZE_ARR_NORM is too small. Increase it or decrease ALIGNED_BYTES_MATMUL",
8836 CURRENT_FUNCTION);
8837
8838 for(unsigned short l=0; l<nFaceSimul; ++l) {
8839 arrNorm[l] = surfElem[l].metricNormalsFace.data();
8840 arrGridVel[l] = surfElem[l].gridVelocities.data();
8841 }
8842
8843 /* General function to compute the inviscid fluxes, using an approximate
8844 Riemann solver in the integration points. */
8845 ComputeInviscidFluxesFace(config, nFaceSimul, NPad, nInt, arrNorm, arrGridVel,
8846 solInt0, solInt1, fluxes, conv_numerics);
8847
8848 /* Multiply the fluxes with the integration weight of the corresponding
8849 integration point. */
8850 for(unsigned short i=0; i<nInt; ++i) {
8851 su2double *flux = fluxes + i*NPad;
8852
8853 for(unsigned short j=0; j<NPad; ++j)
8854 flux[j] *= weights[i];
8855 }
8856
8857 /*------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
8858 /*--- Step 2: Compute the contribution to the residuals from the ---*/
8859 /*--- integration over the surface element. ---*/
8860 /*------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
8861
8862 /* Get the correct form of the basis functions needed for the matrix
8863 multiplication to compute the residual. */
8864 const su2double *basisFaceTrans = standardBoundaryFacesSol[ind].GetBasisFaceIntegrationTranspose();
8865
8866 /* Call the general function to carry out the matrix product. Use solint0
8867 as temporary storage for the result. */
8868 blasFunctions->gemm(nDOFs, NPad, nInt, basisFaceTrans, fluxes, solInt0, config);
8869
8870 /* Loop over the number of simultaneously treated faces to store the
8871 residual in the correct locations in resFaces. */
8872 for(unsigned short l=0; l<nFaceSimul; ++l) {
8873 const unsigned short llNVar = l*nVar;
8874
8875 /* Easier storage of the position in the residual array for this face
8876 and update the corresponding counter. */
8877 su2double *resFace = resFaces + indResFaces*nVar;
8878 indResFaces += nDOFs;
8879
8880 /* Loop over the DOFs and copy the data. */
8881 for(unsigned short i=0; i<nDOFs; ++i)
8882 for(unsigned short mm=0; mm<nVar; ++mm)
8883 resFace[nVar*i+mm] = solInt0[NPad*i+llNVar+mm];
8884 }
8885}
8886
8887void CFEM_DG_EulerSolver::LeftStatesIntegrationPointsBoundaryFace(
8888 CConfig *config,
8889 const unsigned short nFaceSimul,
8890 const unsigned short NPad,
8891 const CSurfaceElementFEM *surfElem,
8892 su2double *solFace,
8893 su2double *solIntL) {
8894
8895 /* Get the required information from the corresponding standard face, which is the
8896 same for all simultaneously treated faces. */
8897 const unsigned short ind = surfElem[0].indStandardElement;
8898 const unsigned short nInt = standardBoundaryFacesSol[ind].GetNIntegration();
8899 const unsigned short nDOFs = standardBoundaryFacesSol[ind].GetNDOFsFace();
8900 const su2double *basisFace = standardBoundaryFacesSol[ind].GetBasisFaceIntegration();
8901
8902 /* Loop over the faces that are treated simultaneously. */
8903 for(unsigned short l=0; l<nFaceSimul; ++l) {
8904 const unsigned short llNVar = l*nVar;
8905
8906 /* Easier storage of the DOFs of the face. */
8907 const unsigned long *DOFs = surfElem[l].DOFsSolFace.data();
8908
8909 /* The numbering of the DOFs is given for the entire grid. However, in the
8910 working vectors for the solution a numbering per time level is used.
8911 Therefore an offset must be applied, which can be obtained from the
8912 corresponding volume element. Note that this offset is non-negative. */
8913 const unsigned long volID = surfElem[l].volElemID;
8914 const unsigned short timeLevel = volElem[volID].timeLevel;
8915 const unsigned long offset = volElem[volID].offsetDOFsSolLocal
8916 - volElem[volID].offsetDOFsSolThisTimeLevel;
8917
8918 /* Copy the solution of the DOFs of the face such that it is contiguous
8919 in memory. */
8920 for(unsigned short i=0; i<nDOFs; ++i) {
8921
8922 const su2double *solDOF = VecWorkSolDOFs[timeLevel].data() + nVar*(DOFs[i]-offset);
8923 su2double *sol = solFace + NPad*i + llNVar;
8924 for(unsigned short mm=0; mm<nVar; ++mm)
8925 sol[mm] = solDOF[mm];
8926 }
8927 }
8928
8929 /* Call the general function to carry out the matrix product. */
8930 blasFunctions->gemm(nInt, NPad, nDOFs, basisFace, solFace, solIntL, config);
8931}
8932
8933void CFEM_DG_EulerSolver::ComputeInviscidFluxesFace(CConfig *config,
8934 const unsigned short nFaceSimul,
8935 const unsigned short NPad,
8936 const unsigned long nPoints,
8937 const su2double *normalsFace[],
8938 const su2double *gridVelsFace[],
8939 const su2double *solL,
8940 const su2double *solR,
8941 su2double *fluxes,
8942 CNumerics *numerics) {
8943
8944 /* Easier storage of the specific heat ratio. */
8945 const su2double gm1 = Gamma_Minus_One;
8946
8947 /* Make a distinction between the several Riemann solvers. */
8948 switch( config->GetRiemann_Solver_FEM() ) {
8949
8950 case UPWIND::ROE: {
8951
8952 /* Roe's approximate Riemann solver. Easier storage of the cut off
8953 value for the entropy correction. */
8954 const su2double Delta = config->GetEntropyFix_Coeff();
8955
8956 /* Make a distinction between two and three space dimensions
8957 in order to have the most efficient code. */
8958 switch( nDim ) {
8959
8960 case 2: {
8961
8962 /* Two dimensional simulation. Loop over the number of faces treated
8963 simultaneously. */
8964 for(unsigned short l=0; l<nFaceSimul; ++l) {
8965
8966 /* Easier storage for some variables of this face. */
8967 const su2double *normals = normalsFace[l];
8968 const su2double *gridVels = gridVelsFace[l];
8969 const unsigned short lNVar = l*nVar;
8970
8971 /* Loop over the number of points for this face. */
8972 for(unsigned long i=0; i<nPoints; ++i) {
8973
8974 /* Easier storage of the left and right solution, the face normals,
8975 the grid velocities and the flux vector for this point. */
8976 const unsigned long offPointer = i*NPad + lNVar;
8977
8978 const su2double *UL = solL + offPointer;
8979 const su2double *UR = solR + offPointer;
8980 const su2double *norm = normals + i*(nDim+1);
8981 const su2double *gridVel = gridVels + i*nDim;
8982 su2double *flux = fluxes + offPointer;
8983
8984 const su2double nx = norm[0], ny = norm[1], halfArea = 0.5*norm[2];
8985
8986 /* Compute the normal grid velocity. */
8987 const su2double gridVelNorm = gridVel[0]*nx + gridVel[1]*ny;
8988
8989 /*--- Compute the primitive variables of the left and right state. ---*/
8990 su2double tmp = 1.0/UL[0];
8991 const su2double vxL = tmp*UL[1];
8992 const su2double vyL = tmp*UL[2];
8993 const su2double pL = gm1*(UL[3] - 0.5*(vxL*UL[1] + vyL*UL[2]));
8994
8995 tmp = 1.0/UR[0];
8996 const su2double vxR = tmp*UR[1];
8997 const su2double vyR = tmp*UR[2];
8998 const su2double pR = gm1*(UR[3] - 0.5*(vxR*UR[1] + vyR*UR[2]));
8999
9000 /*--- Compute the difference of the conservative mean flow variables. ---*/
9001 const su2double dr = UR[0] - UL[0];
9002 const su2double dru = UR[1] - UL[1];
9003 const su2double drv = UR[2] - UL[2];
9004 const su2double drE = UR[3] - UL[3];
9005
9006 /*--- Compute the Roe average state. ---*/
9007 const su2double zL = sqrt(UL[0]);
9008 const su2double zR = sqrt(UR[0]);
9009 tmp = 1.0/(zL + zR);
9010
9011 const su2double rHL = UL[3] + pL;
9012 const su2double rHR = UR[3] + pR;
9013
9014 const su2double uAvg = tmp*(zL*vxL + zR*vxR);
9015 const su2double vAvg = tmp*(zL*vyL + zR*vyR);
9016 const su2double HAvg = tmp*(rHL/zL + rHR/zR);
9017
9018 /*--- Compute from the Roe average state some variables, which occur
9019 quite often in the matrix vector product to be computed. ---*/
9020 const su2double alphaAvg = 0.5*(uAvg*uAvg + vAvg*vAvg);
9021 tmp = gm1*(HAvg - alphaAvg);
9022 const su2double a2Avg = fabs(tmp);
9023 const su2double aAvg = sqrt(a2Avg);
9024 const su2double vnAvg = uAvg*nx + vAvg*ny;
9025 const su2double unAvg = vnAvg - gridVelNorm;
9026 const su2double ovaAvg = 1.0/aAvg;
9027 const su2double ova2Avg = 1.0/a2Avg;
9028
9029 /*--- Compute the absolute values of the three eigenvalues and
9030 apply the entropy correction. ---*/
9031 su2double lam1 = fabs(unAvg + aAvg);
9032 su2double lam2 = fabs(unAvg - aAvg);
9033 su2double lam3 = fabs(unAvg);
9034
9035 tmp = Delta*max(lam1, lam2);
9036 lam1 = max(lam1, tmp);
9037 lam2 = max(lam2, tmp);
9038 lam3 = max(lam3, tmp);
9039
9040 /*--- Some abbreviations, which occur quite often in the dissipation terms. ---*/
9041 const su2double abv1 = 0.5*(lam1 + lam2);
9042 const su2double abv2 = 0.5*(lam1 - lam2);
9043 const su2double abv3 = abv1 - lam3;
9044
9045 const su2double abv4 = gm1*(alphaAvg*dr - uAvg*dru - vAvg*drv + drE);
9046 const su2double abv5 = nx*dru + ny*drv - vnAvg*dr;
9047 const su2double abv6 = abv3*abv4*ova2Avg + abv2*abv5*ovaAvg;
9048 const su2double abv7 = abv2*abv4*ovaAvg + abv3*abv5;
9049
9050 /*--- Compute the Roe flux vector, which is 0.5*(FL + FR - |A|(UR-UL)). ---*/
9051 const su2double vnL = vxL*nx + vyL*ny;
9052 const su2double vnR = vxR*nx + vyR*ny;
9053 const su2double unL = vnL - gridVelNorm;
9054 const su2double unR = vnR - gridVelNorm;
9055 const su2double pa = pL + pR;
9056
9057 flux[0] = halfArea*(UL[0]*unL + UR[0]*unR - (lam3*dr + abv6));
9058 flux[1] = halfArea*(UL[1]*unL + UR[1]*unR + pa*nx
9059 - (lam3*dru + uAvg*abv6 + nx*abv7));
9060 flux[2] = halfArea*(UL[2]*unL + UR[2]*unR + pa*ny
9061 - (lam3*drv + vAvg*abv6 + ny*abv7));
9062 flux[3] = halfArea*(UL[3]*unL + UR[3]*unR + pL*vnL + pR*vnR
9063 - (lam3*drE + HAvg*abv6 + vnAvg*abv7));
9064 }
9065 }
9066
9067 break;
9068 }
9069
9070 /*--------------------------------------------------------------------*/
9071
9072 case 3: {
9073
9074 /* Three dimensional simulation. Loop over the number of faces treated
9075 simultaneously. */
9076 for(unsigned short l=0; l<nFaceSimul; ++l) {
9077
9078 /* Easier storage for some variables of this face. */
9079 const su2double *normals = normalsFace[l];
9080 const su2double *gridVels = gridVelsFace[l];
9081 const unsigned short lNVar = l*nVar;
9082
9083 /* Loop over the number of points for this face. */
9084 for(unsigned long i=0; i<nPoints; ++i) {
9085
9086 /* Easier storage of the left and right solution, the face normals,
9087 the grid velocities and the flux vector for this point. */
9088 const unsigned long offPointer = i*NPad + lNVar;
9089
9090 const su2double *UL = solL + offPointer;
9091 const su2double *UR = solR + offPointer;
9092 const su2double *norm = normals + i*(nDim+1);
9093 const su2double *gridVel = gridVels + i*nDim;
9094 su2double *flux = fluxes + offPointer;
9095
9096 const su2double nx = norm[0], ny = norm[1], nz = norm[2];
9097 const su2double halfArea = 0.5*norm[3];
9098
9099 /* Compute the normal grid velocity. */
9100 const su2double gridVelNorm = gridVel[0]*nx + gridVel[1]*ny + gridVel[2]*nz;
9101
9102 /*--- Compute the primitive variables of the left and right state. ---*/
9103 su2double tmp = 1.0/UL[0];
9104 const su2double vxL = tmp*UL[1];
9105 const su2double vyL = tmp*UL[2];
9106 const su2double vzL = tmp*UL[3];
9107 const su2double pL = gm1*(UL[4] - 0.5*(vxL*UL[1] + vyL*UL[2] + vzL*UL[3]));
9108
9109 tmp = 1.0/UR[0];
9110 const su2double vxR = tmp*UR[1];
9111 const su2double vyR = tmp*UR[2];
9112 const su2double vzR = tmp*UR[3];
9113 const su2double pR = gm1*(UR[4] - 0.5*(vxR*UR[1] + vyR*UR[2] + vzR*UR[3]));
9114
9115 /*--- Compute the difference of the conservative mean flow variables. ---*/
9116 const su2double dr = UR[0] - UL[0];
9117 const su2double dru = UR[1] - UL[1];
9118 const su2double drv = UR[2] - UL[2];
9119 const su2double drw = UR[3] - UL[3];
9120 const su2double drE = UR[4] - UL[4];
9121
9122 /*--- Compute the Roe average state. ---*/
9123 const su2double zL = sqrt(UL[0]);
9124 const su2double zR = sqrt(UR[0]);
9125 tmp = 1.0/(zL + zR);
9126
9127 const su2double rHL = UL[4] + pL;
9128 const su2double rHR = UR[4] + pR;
9129
9130 const su2double uAvg = tmp*(zL*vxL + zR*vxR);
9131 const su2double vAvg = tmp*(zL*vyL + zR*vyR);
9132 const su2double wAvg = tmp*(zL*vzL + zR*vzR);
9133 const su2double HAvg = tmp*(rHL/zL + rHR/zR);
9134
9135 /*--- Compute from the Roe average state some variables, which occur
9136 quite often in the matrix vector product to be computed. ---*/
9137 const su2double alphaAvg = 0.5*(uAvg*uAvg + vAvg*vAvg + wAvg*wAvg);
9138 tmp = gm1*(HAvg - alphaAvg);
9139 const su2double a2Avg = fabs(tmp);
9140 const su2double aAvg = sqrt(a2Avg);
9141 const su2double vnAvg = uAvg*nx + vAvg*ny + wAvg*nz;
9142 const su2double unAvg = vnAvg - gridVelNorm;
9143 const su2double ovaAvg = 1.0/aAvg;
9144 const su2double ova2Avg = 1.0/a2Avg;
9145
9146 /*--- Compute the absolute values of the three eigenvalues and
9147 apply the entropy correction. ---*/
9148 su2double lam1 = fabs(unAvg + aAvg);
9149 su2double lam2 = fabs(unAvg - aAvg);
9150 su2double lam3 = fabs(unAvg);
9151
9152 tmp = Delta*max(lam1, lam2);
9153 lam1 = max(lam1, tmp);
9154 lam2 = max(lam2, tmp);
9155 lam3 = max(lam3, tmp);
9156
9157 /*--- Some abbreviations, which occur quite often in the dissipation terms. ---*/
9158 const su2double abv1 = 0.5*(lam1 + lam2);
9159 const su2double abv2 = 0.5*(lam1 - lam2);
9160 const su2double abv3 = abv1 - lam3;
9161
9162 const su2double abv4 = gm1*(alphaAvg*dr - uAvg*dru - vAvg*drv -wAvg*drw + drE);
9163 const su2double abv5 = nx*dru + ny*drv + nz*drw - vnAvg*dr;
9164 const su2double abv6 = abv3*abv4*ova2Avg + abv2*abv5*ovaAvg;
9165 const su2double abv7 = abv2*abv4*ovaAvg + abv3*abv5;
9166
9167 /*--- Compute the Roe flux vector, which is 0.5*(FL + FR - |A|(UR-UL)). ---*/
9168 const su2double vnL = vxL*nx + vyL*ny + vzL*nz;
9169 const su2double vnR = vxR*nx + vyR*ny + vzR*nz;
9170 const su2double unL = vnL - gridVelNorm;
9171 const su2double unR = vnR - gridVelNorm;
9172 const su2double pa = pL + pR;
9173
9174 flux[0] = halfArea*(UL[0]*unL + UR[0]*unR - (lam3*dr + abv6));
9175 flux[1] = halfArea*(UL[1]*unL + UR[1]*unR + pa*nx
9176 - (lam3*dru + uAvg*abv6 + nx*abv7));
9177 flux[2] = halfArea*(UL[2]*unL + UR[2]*unR + pa*ny
9178 - (lam3*drv + vAvg*abv6 + ny*abv7));
9179 flux[3] = halfArea*(UL[3]*unL + UR[3]*unR + pa*nz
9180 - (lam3*drw + wAvg*abv6 + nz*abv7));
9181 flux[4] = halfArea*(UL[4]*unL + UR[4]*unR + pL*vnL + pR*vnR
9182 - (lam3*drE + HAvg*abv6 + vnAvg*abv7));
9183 }
9184 }
9185
9186 break;
9187 }
9188 }
9189
9190 break;
9191 }
9192
9193 /*------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
9194
9195 case UPWIND::LAX_FRIEDRICH: {
9196
9197 /* Local Lax-Friedrich (Rusanov) flux Make a distinction between two and
9198 three space dimensions in order to have the most efficient code. */
9199 switch( nDim ) {
9200
9201 case 2: {
9202
9203 /* Two dimensional simulation. Loop over the number of faces treated
9204 simultaneously. */
9205 for(unsigned short l=0; l<nFaceSimul; ++l) {
9206
9207 /* Easier storage for some variables of this face. */
9208 const su2double *normals = normalsFace[l];
9209 const su2double *gridVels = gridVelsFace[l];
9210 const unsigned short lNVar = l*nVar;
9211
9212 /* Loop over the number of points for this face. */
9213 for(unsigned long i=0; i<nPoints; ++i) {
9214
9215 /* Easier storage of the left and right solution, the face normals,
9216 the grid velocities and the flux vector for this point. */
9217 const unsigned long offPointer = i*NPad + lNVar;
9218
9219 const su2double *UL = solL + offPointer;
9220 const su2double *UR = solR + offPointer;
9221 const su2double *norm = normals + i*(nDim+1);
9222 const su2double *gridVel = gridVels + i*nDim;
