9223 su2double *flux = fluxes + offPointer;
9224
9225 const su2double nx = norm[0], ny = norm[1], halfArea = 0.5*norm[2];
9226
9227 /* Compute the normal grid velocity. */
9228 const su2double gridVelNorm = gridVel[0]*nx + gridVel[1]*ny;
9229
9230 /*--- Compute the primitive variables of the left and right state. ---*/
9231 su2double tmp = 1.0/UL[0];
9232 const su2double vxL = tmp*UL[1];
9233 const su2double vyL = tmp*UL[2];
9234 const su2double pL = gm1*(UL[3] - 0.5*(vxL*UL[1] + vyL*UL[2]));
9235 const su2double a2L = Gamma*pL*tmp;
9236
9237 tmp = 1.0/UR[0];
9238 const su2double vxR = tmp*UR[1];
9239 const su2double vyR = tmp*UR[2];
9240 const su2double pR = gm1*(UR[3] - 0.5*(vxR*UR[1] + vyR*UR[2]));
9241 const su2double a2R = Gamma*pR*tmp;
9242
9243 /*--- Compute the difference of the conservative mean flow variables. ---*/
9244 const su2double dr = UR[0] - UL[0];
9245 const su2double dru = UR[1] - UL[1];
9246 const su2double drv = UR[2] - UL[2];
9247 const su2double drE = UR[3] - UL[3];
9248
9249 /*--- Compute the spectral radii of the left and right state
9250 and take the maximum for the dissipation terms. ---*/
9251 const su2double vnL = vxL*nx + vyL*ny;
9252 const su2double vnR = vxR*nx + vyR*ny;
9253 const su2double unL = vnL - gridVelNorm;
9254 const su2double unR = vnR - gridVelNorm;
9255
9256 const su2double radL = fabs(unL) + sqrt(fabs(a2L));
9257 const su2double radR = fabs(unR) + sqrt(fabs(a2R));
9258 const su2double rad = max(radL, radR);
9259
9260 /*--- Compute the flux vector, which is 0.5*(FL + FR - rad(UR-UL)). ---*/
9261 const su2double pa = pL + pR;
9262
9263 flux[0] = halfArea*(UL[0]*unL + UR[0]*unR - rad*dr);
9264 flux[1] = halfArea*(UL[1]*unL + UR[1]*unR + pa*nx - rad*dru);
9265 flux[2] = halfArea*(UL[2]*unL + UR[2]*unR + pa*ny - rad*drv);
9266 flux[3] = halfArea*(UL[3]*unL + UR[3]*unR + pL*vnL + pR*vnR - rad*drE);
9267 }
9268 }
9269
9270 break;
9271 }
9272
9273 /*--------------------------------------------------------------------*/
9274
9275 case 3: {
9276
9277 /* Three dimensional simulation. Loop over the number of faces treated
9278 simultaneously. */
9279 for(unsigned short l=0; l<nFaceSimul; ++l) {
9280
9281 /* Easier storage for some variables of this face. */
9282 const su2double *normals = normalsFace[l];
9283 const su2double *gridVels = gridVelsFace[l];
9284 const unsigned short lNVar = l*nVar;
9285
9286 /* Loop over the number of points for this face. */
9287 for(unsigned long i=0; i<nPoints; ++i) {
9288
9289 /* Easier storage of the left and right solution, the face normals,
9290 the grid velocities and the flux vector for this point. */
9291 const unsigned long offPointer = i*NPad + lNVar;
9292
9293 const su2double *UL = solL + offPointer;
9294 const su2double *UR = solR + offPointer;
9295 const su2double *norm = normals + i*(nDim+1);
9296 const su2double *gridVel = gridVels + i*nDim;
9297 su2double *flux = fluxes + offPointer;
9298
9299 const su2double nx = norm[0], ny = norm[1], nz = norm[2];
9300 const su2double halfArea = 0.5*norm[3];
9301
9302 /* Compute the normal grid velocity. */
9303 const su2double gridVelNorm = gridVel[0]*nx + gridVel[1]*ny + gridVel[2]*nz;
9304
9305 /*--- Compute the primitive variables of the left and right state. ---*/
9306 su2double tmp = 1.0/UL[0];
9307 const su2double vxL = tmp*UL[1];
9308 const su2double vyL = tmp*UL[2];
9309 const su2double vzL = tmp*UL[3];
9310 const su2double pL = gm1*(UL[4] - 0.5*(vxL*UL[1] + vyL*UL[2] + vzL*UL[3]));
9311 const su2double a2L = Gamma*pL*tmp;
9312
9313 tmp = 1.0/UR[0];
9314 const su2double vxR = tmp*UR[1];
9315 const su2double vyR = tmp*UR[2];
9316 const su2double vzR = tmp*UR[3];
9317 const su2double pR = gm1*(UR[4] - 0.5*(vxR*UR[1] + vyR*UR[2] + vzR*UR[3]));
9318 const su2double a2R = Gamma*pR*tmp;
9319
9320 /*--- Compute the difference of the conservative mean flow variables. ---*/
9321 const su2double dr = UR[0] - UL[0];
9322 const su2double dru = UR[1] - UL[1];
9323 const su2double drv = UR[2] - UL[2];
9324 const su2double drw = UR[3] - UL[3];
9325 const su2double drE = UR[4] - UL[4];
9326
9327 /*--- Compute the spectral radii of the left and right state
9328 and take the maximum for the dissipation terms. ---*/
9329 const su2double vnL = vxL*nx + vyL*ny + vzL*nz;
9330 const su2double vnR = vxR*nx + vyR*ny + vzR*nz;
9331 const su2double unL = vnL - gridVelNorm;
9332 const su2double unR = vnR - gridVelNorm;
9333
9334 const su2double radL = fabs(unL) + sqrt(fabs(a2L));
9335 const su2double radR = fabs(unR) + sqrt(fabs(a2R));
9336 const su2double rad = max(radL, radR);
9337
9338 /*--- Compute the flux vector, which is 0.5*(FL + FR - rad(UR-UL)). ---*/
9339 const su2double pa = pL + pR;
9340
9341 flux[0] = halfArea*(UL[0]*unL + UR[0]*unR - rad*dr);
9342 flux[1] = halfArea*(UL[1]*unL + UR[1]*unR + pa*nx - rad*dru);
9343 flux[2] = halfArea*(UL[2]*unL + UR[2]*unR + pa*ny - rad*drv);
9344 flux[3] = halfArea*(UL[3]*unL + UR[3]*unR + pa*nz - rad*drw);
9345 flux[4] = halfArea*(UL[4]*unL + UR[4]*unR + pL*vnL + pR*vnR - rad*drE);
9346 }
9347 }
9348
9349 break;
9350 }
9351 }
9352
9353 break;
9354 }
9355
9356 /*------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
9357
9358 default: {
9359
9360 /* Riemann solver not explicitly implemented. Fall back to the
9361 implementation via numerics. This is not efficient. */
9362
9363 /*--- Data for loading into the CNumerics Riemann solvers.
9364 This is temporary and not efficient.. just replicating exactly
9365 the arrays we typically have in order to avoid bugs. We can
9366 probably be more clever with pointers, etc. ---*/
9367 su2double Normal[3];
9368 su2double Prim_L[8];
9369 su2double Prim_R[8];
9370
9371 Jacobian_i = new su2double*[nVar];
9372 Jacobian_j = new su2double*[nVar];
9373 for (unsigned short iVar = 0; iVar < nVar; ++iVar) {
9374 Jacobian_i[iVar] = new su2double[nVar];
9375 Jacobian_j[iVar] = new su2double[nVar];
9376 }
9377
9378 /* Loop over the number of faces treated simultaneously. */
9379 for(unsigned short l=0; l<nFaceSimul; ++l) {
9380
9381 /* Easier storage for some variables of this face. */
9382 const su2double *normals = normalsFace[l];
9383 const su2double *gridVels = gridVelsFace[l];
9384 const unsigned short lNVar = l*nVar;
9385
9386 /* Loop over the number of points for this face. */
9387 for(unsigned long i=0; i<nPoints; ++i) {
9388
9389 /* Easier storage of the left and right solution, the face normals,
9390 the grid velocities and the flux vector for this point. */
9391 const unsigned long offPointer = i*NPad + lNVar;
9392
9393 const su2double *UL = solL + offPointer;
9394 const su2double *UR = solR + offPointer;
9395 const su2double *norm = normals + i*(nDim+1);
9396 const su2double *gridVel = gridVels + i*nDim;
9397 su2double *flux = fluxes + offPointer;
9398
9399 /*--- Store and load the normal into numerics. ---*/
9400 for (unsigned short iDim = 0; iDim < nDim; ++iDim)
9401 Normal[iDim] = norm[iDim]*norm[nDim];
9402 numerics->SetNormal(Normal);
9403
9404 /*--- Load the grid velocities into numerics. ---*/
9405 su2double vGrid[] = {0.0, 0.0, 0.0};
9406 for(unsigned short iDim=0; iDim<nDim; ++iDim)
9407 vGrid[iDim] = gridVel[iDim];
9408 numerics->SetGridVel(vGrid, vGrid);
9409
9410 /*--- Prepare the primitive states for the numerics class. Note
9411 that for the FV solver, we have the following primitive
9412 variable ordering: Compressible flow, primitive variables nDim+5,
9413 (T, vx, vy, vz, P, rho, h, c, lamMu, eddyMu, ThCond, Cp) ---*/
9414
9415 /*--- Left primitive state ---*/
9416 Prim_L[0] = 0.0; // Temperature (unused)
9417 Prim_L[nDim+1] = gm1*UL[nVar-1];
9418 for (unsigned short iDim = 0; iDim < nDim; iDim++) {
9419 Prim_L[iDim+1] = UL[iDim+1]/UL[0]; // Velocities
9420 Prim_L[nDim+1] -= gm1*0.5*Prim_L[iDim+1]*UL[iDim+1]; // Pressure
9421 }
9422 Prim_L[nDim+2] = UL[0]; // Density
9423 Prim_L[nDim+3] = (UL[nVar-1] + Prim_L[nDim+1]) / UL[0]; // Enthalpy
9424
9425 /*--- Right primitive state ---*/
9426 Prim_R[0] = 0.0; // Temperature (unused)
9427 Prim_R[nDim+1] = gm1*UR[nVar-1];
9428 for (unsigned short iDim = 0; iDim < nDim; iDim++) {
9429 Prim_R[iDim+1] = UR[iDim+1]/UR[0]; // Velocities
9430 Prim_R[nDim+1] -= gm1*0.5*Prim_R[iDim+1]*UR[iDim+1]; // Pressure
9431 }
9432 Prim_R[nDim+2] = UR[0]; // Density
9433 Prim_R[nDim+3] = (UR[nVar-1] + Prim_R[nDim+1]) / UR[0]; // Enthalpy
9434
9435 /*--- Load the primitive states into the numerics class. ---*/
9436 numerics->SetPrimitive(Prim_L, Prim_R);
9437
9438 /*--- Now simply call the ComputeResidual() function to calculate
9439 the flux using the chosen approximate Riemann solver. Note that
9440 the Jacobian arrays here are just dummies for now (no implicit). ---*/
9441 numerics->ComputeResidual(flux, Jacobian_i, Jacobian_j, config);
9442 }
9443 }
9444
9445 for (unsigned short iVar = 0; iVar < nVar; iVar++) {
9446 delete [] Jacobian_i[iVar];
9447 delete [] Jacobian_j[iVar];
9448 }
9449 delete [] Jacobian_i;
9450 delete [] Jacobian_j;
9451
9452 Jacobian_i = nullptr;
9453 Jacobian_j = nullptr;
9454 }
9455 }
9456}
9457
9458void CFEM_DG_EulerSolver::LoadRestart(CGeometry **geometry, CSolver ***solver, CConfig *config, int val_iter, bool val_update_geo) {
9459
9460 /*--- Restart the solution from file information ---*/
9461 unsigned short iVar;
9462 unsigned long index;
9463
9464 const bool compressible = (config->GetKind_Regime() == ENUM_REGIME::COMPRESSIBLE);
9465
9466 string restart_filename = config->GetSolution_FileName();
9467
9468 int counter = 0;
9469 long iPoint_Local = 0; unsigned long iPoint_Global = 0;
9470 unsigned short rbuf_NotMatching = 0;
9471 unsigned long nDOF_Read = 0;
9472
9473 /*--- Skip coordinates ---*/
9474
9475 unsigned short skipVars = geometry[MESH_0]->GetnDim();
9476
9477 restart_filename = config->GetFilename(restart_filename, "", val_iter);
9478
9479 /*--- Read the restart data from either an ASCII or binary SU2 file. ---*/
9480
9481 if (config->GetRead_Binary_Restart()) {
9482 Read_SU2_Restart_Binary(geometry[MESH_0], config, restart_filename);
9483 } else {
9484 Read_SU2_Restart_ASCII(geometry[MESH_0], config, restart_filename);
9485 }
9486
9487 /*--- Load data from the restart into correct containers. ---*/
9488
9489 counter = 0;
9490 for (iPoint_Global = 0; iPoint_Global < geometry[MESH_0]->GetGlobal_nPointDomain(); iPoint_Global++) {
9491
9492 /*--- Retrieve local index. If this node from the restart file lives
9493 on the current processor, we will load and instantiate the vars. ---*/
9494
9495 iPoint_Local = geometry[MESH_0]->GetGlobal_to_Local_Point(iPoint_Global);
9496
9497 if (iPoint_Local > -1) {
9498
9499 /*--- We need to store this point's data, so jump to the correct
9500 offset in the buffer of data from the restart file and load it. ---*/
9501
9502 index = counter*Restart_Vars[1] + skipVars;
9503 for (iVar = 0; iVar < nVar; iVar++) {
9504 VecSolDOFs[nVar*iPoint_Local+iVar] = Restart_Data[index+iVar];
9505 }
9506 /*--- Update the local counter nDOF_Read. ---*/
9507 ++nDOF_Read;
9508
9509 /*--- Increment the overall counter for how many points have been loaded. ---*/
9510 counter++;
9511 }
9512
9513 }
9514
9515 /*--- Detect a wrong solution file ---*/
9516 if(nDOF_Read < nDOFsLocOwned) rbuf_NotMatching = 1;
9517
9518#ifdef HAVE_MPI
9519 unsigned short sbuf_NotMatching = rbuf_NotMatching;
9520 SU2_MPI::Allreduce(&sbuf_NotMatching, &rbuf_NotMatching, 1, MPI_UNSIGNED_SHORT, MPI_MAX, SU2_MPI::GetComm());
9521#endif
9522
9523 if (rbuf_NotMatching != 0)
9524 SU2_MPI::Error(string("The solution file ") + restart_filename +
9525 string(" doesn't match with the mesh file!\n") +
9526 string("It could be empty lines at the end of the file."),
9527 CURRENT_FUNCTION);
9528
9529 /*--- Check that the initial solution is physical, report any non-physical nodes ---*/
9530 unsigned long nBadDOFs = 0;
9531
9532 if( compressible ) {
9533
9534 for(unsigned long i=0; i<nDOFsLocOwned; ++i) {
9535 const unsigned long ii = nVar*i;
9536 su2double DensityInv = 1.0/VecSolDOFs[ii];
9537
9538 su2double Velocity2 = 0.0;
9539 for(unsigned short iDim=1; iDim<=nDim; ++iDim) {
9540 const su2double vel = VecSolDOFs[ii+iDim]*DensityInv;
9541 Velocity2 += vel*vel;
9542 }
9543
9544 su2double StaticEnergy = VecSolDOFs[ii+nDim+1]*DensityInv - 0.5*Velocity2;
9545
9546 FluidModel->SetTDState_rhoe(VecSolDOFs[ii], StaticEnergy);
9547 su2double Pressure = FluidModel->GetPressure();
9548 su2double Temperature = FluidModel->GetTemperature();
9549
9550 /*--- Use the values at the infinity if the state is not physical. ---*/
9551 if((Pressure < 0.0) || (VecSolDOFs[ii] < 0.0) || (Temperature < 0.0)) {
9552 for(unsigned short j=0; j<nVar; ++j) {
9553 VecSolDOFs[ii+j] = ConsVarFreeStream[j];
9554 }
9555
9556 ++nBadDOFs;
9557 }
9558 }
9559 }
9560
9561 /*--- Warning message about non-physical points ---*/
9562 if (config->GetComm_Level() == COMM_FULL) {
9563#ifdef HAVE_MPI
9564 unsigned long nBadDOFsLoc = nBadDOFs;
9565 SU2_MPI::Reduce(&nBadDOFsLoc, &nBadDOFs, 1, MPI_UNSIGNED_LONG, MPI_SUM, MASTER_NODE, SU2_MPI::GetComm());
9566#endif
9567
9568 if((rank == MASTER_NODE) && (nBadDOFs != 0))
9569 cout << "Warning. The initial solution contains "<< nBadDOFs << " DOFs that are not physical." << endl;
9570 }
9571
9572 /*--- Delete the class memory that is used to load the restart. ---*/
9573
9574 Restart_Vars = decltype(Restart_Vars){};
9575 Restart_Data = decltype(Restart_Data){};
9576}
SIZE_ARR_NORM
@ SIZE_ARR_NORM
